Summary Heading: No hot water allowed for 3 days
Summary: Stayed in a 2 bedroom suite at Residence Inn on Harbor. 4 adults and 3 kids. 4 nights week of Thanksgiving. Checked in and for the first 3 mornings, no hot water or water pressure….shower would TURN off in the middle of shower due to lack of pressure. Complained on the way to the park every morning…one morning a man who spoke no English knocked on the door and said It’s ok….we said ok thinking he fixed it. Nope.  On the final morning (check out by 12) I complained about my stay in front of a lobby full of people. Maintenance came up. The guy said he gave us more access to pressure and the hot water, it was turned down to the room. #1 I did not know hotels could do that, #2 no refund or partial anything because I booked and paid through Disney as part of a package. I took the
Manager Response: @ChristinaM88310, Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  I'm very sorry to hear about your experience with us.  I will have my Front Office Manager contact you directly regarding your points.  There were a few water issues that took place over the last holiday, but we have since fixed those issues.

Summary: Let me start by saying that Residence Inn Garden Grove has been the go to for when I visit Anaheim with a large group, And up to this last visit it has been a place that I have always recommended. Sadly, this is no longer the case. I will not be returning, nor will I be recommending to anyone in the future. Let me explain why: I reserved 2 rooms for our week stay in Anaheim, one for myself, the other for my son. I had called earlier to request an early check in, as well as that our rooms be close to each other. Upon arriving, 1 room, my sons was ready (this was at about noon), I was told mine would be ready in about an hour.  We placed our bags in my son’s rooms and left for a breakfast reservation. Upon returning… 2 hours later I inquired about my room so we could all get
Manager Response: I'm so sorry to hear about your experience at our hotel.  I can guarantee this is not the norm.  Please feel free to contact us directly, so we can further discuss.

Summary Heading: No communication between Front desk and guests.
Summary: When I checked in they did not let me know they took a advanced deposit with the card on file, it wasn't a prepaid rate and their website with that specific rate didn't say anything about it being pre paid. When I tried to speak to the front desk a out this issue I sent a message through the app and it took them 3 hours to get a response, I'm just disappointed.
Manager Response: I am so sorry to read your feedback. It is not the type of feedback we usually receive and again I am so sorry for your less than perfect experience. Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure to do better in the future.

Summary: Stayed here 2 nights this past week.  I was happy that was all I booked.  Had a 1 bedroom “suite”.  Marriott needs to pull their name from this hotel.  It is way below the standards of any Marriott property I have stayed at.  The room was markedly worn.  The couch had stains of some sort and I didn’t  let my kids sleep on it.  The cushions for the couch didn’t seem to belong on the piece of furniture- no one ever sat on it.  The furniture seemed worn and sad in the room.  The electrical outlet in the vanity bathroom are didn’t work so I couldn’t do my hair.  Asked for service to come and change out outlet and to make the ice maker Work but no one ever showed up.  For 2 days.  No ice in the hotel and no ice in the room.  Brought this to the attention of the front desk and all I
Manager Response: @lisafahisa- I'm so sorry to hear about your experience at our hotel.  We do strive to ensure our guests are happy and we clearly fell short of that.  Please contact me directly, so I may take a look at your reservation history and resolve this matter.    Sincerely,   Julio Flores  General Manager anaheimrigm@ih-corp.com

Summary: Had to cut my stay short after seeing a fully grown German cockroach climbing up the wall and several smaller nymphs on the kitchen counter. This infestation was inexcusable, but not surprising given the amount of discarded food littering the hallway. The front desk seemed apologetic and moved me into a different room - but the damage was done. I left early with the promise to remove a night from my stay. That didn’t happen even with a Bonvoy Titanium status. Since Marriott failed to give me a chance to review my stay, my review is here. Heed my warning: stay somewhere else.
Manager Response: Dear E9198IAsp,   I'm very sorry to hear about your experience with the room.  I'm glad to hear they were able to move you, but very sorry you had to go through that.  Please contact me directly, so I may follow up with the reversal of the night stay.  My email is below.   Sincerely,   Julio Flores General Manager  anaheimrigm@ih-corp.com

Summary: My husband and I traveled to California so he could have a specialized surgery at UCI.  As we were having to stay a month because of recovery and follow up appts., we choose this hotel because of its location and rooms having kitchens.  First the pros: very friendly staff. Especially Susan H who was so helpful to us during and after our stay.  Give that woman a raise!  We were upgraded to a larger suite when they heard we were there for medical reasons  (and length of stay) - we appreciated the kindness!  Excellent breakfast...a new selection every day. Convenient location with shopping and a variety of restaurants and groceries close by.  Laundry room and work out area are nice extras.  Water pressure in the showers was good. Blackout curtains in the main bedroom are wonderful
Manager Response: Dear C5184Qlsusanw- thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel.  We read through every review and ensure we address items that are listed on the review.  We will be sure to celebrate with Susan for this positive name mention- I agree she is terrific!  Please email me directly, I would love to speak with you.    Sincerely,   Julio Flores  General Manager  anaheimrigm@ih-corp.com

Summary: On the plus side, this is one of the few properties I could find in the greater Los Angeles area with two bedroom spaces separated by a living space in the center for a reasonable price.  The breakfast service staff was awesome and accommodating!!  So, the rest...  Parking is a horrid situation, with most people double parking and essentially blocking access to the remainder of the parking lot while they unload, amazing that they charge $22 a day for this mess of spaces that are too small out of greed, but since everyone else does, so do they.  Room was a good amount of space, however, all of the furniture was barely adequate (tables, desk and appeared "ikea" ish but all were somewhat uncomfortable after awhile).   The couch was dirty with unknown large stains in MULTIPLE areas,
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort Area/Garden Grove and providing your honest feedback.

Summary: Dirty floors everywhere, no hot water, AC is terrible, people passed out in front, couch cushions completely ripped up, trash bags in halls ALL day, pot smoke in the halls and elevator...and we’ve only been here one night. I stay at hotels all the time. I’m a Diamond for Hilton and Gold for Marriott. Not a snob and willing to overlook the occasional glitch but this hotel is in serious need of an overhaul.
Manager Response: We are truly sorry for the experience you had, as this is not the norm. We are grateful for the choice you made to be a guest of the hotel and we will continue striving to provide a level of hospitality that exceeds your expectations. We hope you will give us another opportunity in the future to show you that we have improved.

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay with breakfast
Summary: The service here is great. I have stayed here a few times and always been very pleased. The breakfast served by Maria B. is  very convenient with a lots of choices. Whenever I need items in the room the response is very quick.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to give us feedback and for the kind words! We appreciate you and hope you will stay with us again in the near future!

Summary: Perfect spot right down the street from the entrance to Disneyland.   Nice spacious suites and free breakfast.  Very family friendly in terms of space and cost.  Literally walking distance to Disneyland, so easy to get back right after a day at the park.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking time out of your day to provide us with direct feedback! In addition, thank you very much for staying with us!!

Summary: Residence Inn hotel at Garden grove is the place to stay away from home staff are very friendly and helpful. Good service especially Miss Maria B very helpful to guests. The housekeeping staff always keep the hotel lobby and the elevator clean.  I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family.
Manager Response: Thank You for your review! We appreciate it!

Summary Heading: "Thank you Maria B for the tasty breakfast"
Summary: This is my 2nd time staying in this hotel. I always choose this hotel for its clean rooms, excellent location and most of all for its professional staff. I also want to thank Maria B for her bright and positive attitude every morning when I get my breakfast. She always serves with a smile and gives you the right portion of food.  She will make sure that I won't go hungry. She is an asset to this hotel. Again, thank you very much and stay safe.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time out of your day to give us a great review! We are very happy to hear that Maria B made your stay so much more enjoyable! We hope you will stay with us again soon!

Summary: Maria B, has given me the best customer service. She never fails to ask about my morning every time I come down to get breakfast. She would always greet me with a smile(through the mask). She always makes sure to fill my plate with a hefty amount of food. Thank you for your service. God bless you and God bless the whole staff. Happy SUNDAY ❤️
Manager Response: We appreciate the shout out to our wonderful staff member Maria, she's a gem! We hope you will visit us again soon!

Summary: The staff here are absolutely amazing. Especially Lola and Maria B were so nice and friendly while serving breakfast. They made us feel so welcome during our stay and started our day off on a good note. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area.
Manager Response: jtn303 - Thank you for taking the time out of your day to recognize the breakfast attendants at the property.  Lola and Maria B are just two of our outstanding team members.  We're happy to hear that with the help of those too, you were able to start your days off on a good note.  Thank you again for staying with us.

Summary Heading: Thank you Maria B for the good breakfast!
Summary: Been staying at the residence inn until now because of the staff are so nice and the food are so good.I want to say thank you Maria B for the number good service and the delicious food.Maria B is nice and very happy person.I agree we need this kind of folk.
Manager Response: Leemaricel2014 - Thank you for shouting out our fabulous breakfast attendant Maria B!  She is just one of our rock stars that takes pride in making sure our guests are starting their days off right.  Thank you you staying and come back soon!

Summary: Residence inn has been my home because of the pandemic. Working as a frontline worker during this period is exhausting. But thanks to the residence inn workers who’s giving great services! Shout out to Maria B. For always giving excellent service during breakfast time!
Manager Response: Gideona158 - First and foremost THANK YOU, for all that you are doing to battle this pandemic.  We are honored to have you stay with us.  Maria B is our morning rockstar, and we’ll make sure she see’s your wonderful comments.  Thank you again for choosing to stay with us.

Summary Heading: Maria B for Great Breakfast Service
Summary: She's so nice and efficient. Always with a smile and have a great day to send you off Happy. Need more folk like this especially now with physical distancing. All good interactions and moments are welcomed. Much appreciated.
Manager Response: Thank you Maria B for the great review.  During this pandemic we've had to come up with creative ways to offer our famous breakfast buffet.  We're happy to hear the staff was able to put a smile on your face and start your day off on a positive note.  We hope to see you back again soon.

Summary: The hotel service is top notch. The lobby is always clean or being cleaned which definitely shows how serious they take this pandemic. They treat the elevators the same way. The staff is super friendly they always cheer up my mornings with a  nice greeting and they always make me feel better coming in with a warm welcome. Housekeeping has a superb work ethic they have yet to dwindle in their services. Maria B. makes an extra effort to get to know the hotel regulars and she’s always ready to attend to your breakfast needs. Thank you so much for helping health care workers during this great pandemic!
Manager Response: CNA - Thank you for all that you do, and trusting us with your stay.  Our hotel has taken this pandemic extremely serious and has implemented multiple cleaning/sanitizing practices to make sure our guest feel safe when staying with us.  Maria B is a great new addition to our breakfast team and we'll make sure that we pass your praise to her.  We look forward to having you stay with us again soon.

Summary: Our family unexpectedly had to stay at the Residence Inn due to some water damage in our home. I really enjoyed our stay, the staff was great and management even during there construction. We had pets to bring and I was just so glad that they were accommodating to our family. I had to work from home and had not problems doing that. It almost felt like home although I will be glad to be home. I also am fighting Cancer and I did not at any time feel that I would be in any danger of getting Covid19 as long as I followed the rules put in place and most residents did and staff. I will definately suggest them to family and friends. Thank you Residence Inn
Manager Response: Thank you Vanessa for being our guest and for the amazing review!   We are happy to have you with us and that you felt so comfortable and safe. So glad that you are back home and doing well!

Summary: After a not so great start to our family vacation from another hotel in the area, non marriott affiliated we choose this hotel. They were very welcoming and we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel as this was a late night arrival and booked this room as we were leaving the other hotel. The property was very clean, and was great that it was  close to Target, so we were able to walk around before heading off to Downtown Disney (as the parks were closed due to covid). We had the 2 bedroom suite with the king and 2 twins and sofa bed. There was plenty of room for all of us to be spread out. We also enjoyed the kitchenette in the room for our yogurts and milk for our little ones cereal in the morning she was wanting. When traveling to the Disney area we will definitely be picking
Manager Response: Mrinzi16 - We're sorry you stay your vacation didn't start off the best, but we are happy to here you got to finish the trip happily ever after.  Our two bedroom suites are great for trips with the entire family!  When the parks open back up we look forward to hosting you again.

Summary: I have Stayed here Off and on Thru The Covid 19 Situations while working at a Local Hospital.  They have completed the Room Renovations, and are now Doing the Lobby and Also Including a BAR, YES A BAR, Can't wait to see when the bar Opens. During this time the Staff has been Extremely Extremely Accommodating and Going Above and Beyond during my Stay.  I would want to Commend the Director or Rooms Guy Alfredo, He does an awesome job in making sure you room is on on the schedule to getting it clean with the Most AWESOMENESS and TALENTED HOUSEKEEPING staff.  Also to ROY aka Peetey-Pablo  who works the Front-desk during the evening, He doesn't Miss a Beat....Always there making sure everyone is wearing their Mask, and monitoring those who come in and out out the hotel.  Also theirs
Manager Response: none

Summary: I just wanna say the Staff (limited) here at this hotel know how to make a person feel not only WELCOMED, But also Feel at Home, the Newly Renovated floors and Full Size Kitchens with a FULL SIZE STOVE, reminds me of my own Apt back at home in Dallas, TX, I am an Anesthesia Assistant traveler, working at one of the hospitals here in Anaheim, and when I come after a 12hr to 14hr shift, I always get a "Hello" or a Welcome Back Mr. Luna. The Staff, even though what is happening and what they are going thru, they always have a SMILE on their faces and always eager to help you when your tired, and don't or too tired to make a trip to Target for some Raisin Bran.  Kelly Montes, the GM of the Property is always working either a morning shift or the overnight shift is always their with
Manager Response: none

Summary: We visited Disney and Universal for a 4 day stay with our two school-age kids and baby. The 2 bedroom accommodations reeled us in as well as the proximity to Disney and the shuttle to avoid traffic on the day we visited.  THE GOOD:  The staff was friendly, we were greeted with smiles all the time.  The complimentary coffee and infused water was a nice touch and the cookies they give when you check in were OUTSTANDING! My family couldn’t get enough of them and they were by far the best part of the stay here.  Target is right across the street for any last minute items.  The beds were comfy, typical for a Marriott.  Housekeeping occurred daily and they did an excellent job.  The complimentary breakfast was typical and nothing to write home about, but I guess it’s good that they
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is amazing.  While our room was a bit dated and worn (and now currently all rooms are being refurbished) the service provided by everyone we encountered at this hotel makes it a 5 star!!!!  I have stayed at hundreds of hotels and never have I had everyone that works there making customer service a #1 priority.  I am talking from the front desk, to the breakfast area, to the gentleman who seem to always be cleaning the carpets (so clean all the time), the shuttle, local recommendations,  the pool area with the basketball court, ping pong table and comfortable chairs and tables. The breakfast options were one of the best included breakfast I have ever encountered.  We stayed at a hotel in a brand new hotel in  LA for a few days after that could certainly use a few
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Susan at front desk was amazing!
Summary: We stayed with our grown up son in this hotel for a week. Susan at front desk welcome us with her cheerful and friendly demeanor. She was amazing and helpful, made our stay enjoyable. The hotel is close to Disneyland but located on the quiet area. Shuttle bus or by car to the park. Rooms very clean and have full kitchen. Their free hot continental breakfast was very delicious.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed here before and it was in better.condition. But they are going to remodel shortly after we stayed there.  The rates were great and free breakfast is always a plus. They also have a shuttle you can take at the front of the hotel for $6.00 for adults and it takes you to Disneyland and back it leaves every 30 min. We used it and it was very convenient. Our room was the 2 bedroom suite and had a view of the fireworks from our windows. The only complaint I have is that our room was right on the end by the road and even with ear plugs  I could here the motorcycles reving up. We will definitely stay here again especially since they are remodeling.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My boyfriend and I live in Phoenix and have very busy jobs in customer service so we do not get out very often but, because of our jobs, our standards are incredibly high. We arrived at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort Area/Garden Grove way before check-in around like 11AM we were planning on stopping by the resort, checking it out and then leaving to do all of our planned activities around the city. However, upon arrival we met Susan, and I hope that she sees this because I want her and everyone she works with to know what an amazing front desk agent she is. She checked us in early, AND upgraded us to a suite! Totally not necessary, but it felt incredible to be treated so kindly and we truly started our trip of with joy. She greeted us with a friendly smile each morning and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: 5 Star Experience, Beautiful Hotel, Great Amenities at Affordable Prices
Summary: As Gold Elite Marriott Rewards/Bonvoy members, we've stayed here maaany times over the past 8 years. This hotel is generally the absolute best -- although over the past few years it had (past tense) experienced a few downturns in customer service. Thankfully over the last 7+ months that has reverted into the *stellar* zone -- it's like 5 Star Service with affordable prices. This is largely thanks to a new manager here by the name of @Marie D. She is responsible for us returning yet again -- as I type this -- in addition to our last stay just a few weeks ago. You might even say, coming back to see Marie is almost on par with coming back to see Mickey Mouse (since this resort is so close to Disneyland)!  Fyi this hotel has a wooonderful Kids Entertainment Room with TV projector,
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great stay for Disneyland for families
Summary: Best free breakfast ever. They have scrambled eggs and bacon very early so your entire family can eat before the park.  They have coffee and water all day.  The pool and jacuzzi are very relaxing.  The pool is heated and we swam in January.   It's a little further than I normally stay from the park but worth it because of the accommodations.  The shuttle is 6 bucks a person so if theres several of you, it's worth just paying for parking at the big structure. My room was huge and had a full kitchen, so we brought food up too.  they have a great store filled with Disneyland souvenirs at great prices.  The front desk workers are very nice. The maintenance people are friendly.  We lost track of time in the jacuzzi and they were very nice about letting us know. They were tons of
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great breakfast, hotel was clean, everybody was helpful! Rocio was the best, always with a nice smile and ready to help with anything we needed! Will stay there again when we go to Anaheim, we had a pleasant stay
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family just returned from a 2 week stay at the hotel. We loved it. The place is slightly dated (apparently, they are renovating next year) but it is clean, and the staff are AMAZING. Target is right across the road and the shuttle to Disney stops out front. I would not hesitate to stay here again. My only complaint would be that I found the rooms to be quite dark at night a few extra wall lights would be great. One other thing to keep in mind is there are no hairdryers, which is not a big deal if you know beforehand. The buffet breakfast was yummy and so was the free hot chocolate bar. Being Christmas time, the hotel was beautifully decorated, and they even had a Santa meet and greet in the lobby on the weekend.
Manager Response: none

Summary: rooms are great with two queens and pullout couch. kitchen area. gift shop somewhat pricey but drug stores and groceries are closeby as other options. The exercise room is bare-two treadmills (on was out), elliptical, one bike, some weights, kettle bells-this is where they can improve. The pool is nice except they don't mandate people are gone by 10pm which makes the sleeping experience poor when teenagers are outside yelling until midnight. Breakfast buffet is the best thing about this hotel. I think they serve real eggs instead of powdered, sausage, potatoes, cereals, fresh fruit, yogurt, and various bread carbs. Coffee and hot water at all hours. Popcorn sometimes and movies for kids. Ive stayed here 3x and once the elevator was out. There are a LOT of tourists here and ALOT
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you have stayed at Residence Inn properties before, you know what to expect - all rooms have a full kitchen, and breakfast is provided. This is a large hotel with many many guest rooms, and the breakfast area isn't large enough to handle the number of people. Tons of families means limited tables available for sitting, and tons of people crowding the food area most of the time. Parking will cost you $19. We were disappointed to find the pools and hot tub closed on a day we wanted to enjoy them, due to rain. Maintenance and cleanliness is average. You can walk from the hotel to Disneyland, but be aware it will take around 30 minutes and is over a mile each way.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Stay For Family Holiday Fun
Summary: Stayed here in late November for a family vacation to Disneyland. First and foremost, some of the best customer service I have experienced in many years. I stay 50+ nights a year in hotels. During our stay we interacted with the front desk, the manager, breakfast staff, maintenance staff. Every single experience was outstanding. The way they interacted with my children made them feel so valued. That was every day during our Sunday – Thursday stay. The one day they had set-up a mailbox for kids to send letters to Santa. They had everything the kids needed to do this and my youngest was so excited. Completely unexpected to me, we received a letter from the hotel via mail a couple of weeks later forwarding the return letter from Santa (picture attached). I was very impressed.   In
Manager Response: none

Summary: Susan at the front desk is amazing!  We've stayed at this hotel before,  so I knew an early check in was most likely not going to happen. When we landed at the John Wayne airport around 1, my 8 year old wasn't feeling well.   I called the hotel to see if there was any way we could check into our family suite early.  Susan told me to head to the hotel and she'd do her best to get someone from housekeeping to get a family suite ready for us.  We were able to get checked into the hotel an hour later.  She was great!   We were at the hotel for an entire week and all the staff is amazing.  Whether you're leaving for the day,  coming back at the end of the day or coming down to breakfast the staff is so friendly!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We went to visit Disneyland and stayed here. It was great,Bernice at the desk was so kind and went above and beyond for my family!!! W had breakfast every morning in the hotel, included. the staff was very quick to clean and keep everything picked up.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay here.  The staff was excellent. They are dog friendly supplying treats and doggie bags.  Breakfast was just ok. Disneyland shuttle stops right in front of the hotel and was always on time.   I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this location for 32 days.  Our first night at the location we noticed our ac didn’t work, we are from the Midwest and can handle humidity, but our thermostat in the room kept reading hotter and hotter, we had maintenance come and check it out, they fixed it twice before I told them we would like to switch rooms bc it was getting a little crazy them trying to fix it with 3 kids and 2 dogs in the room. We moved to another room which had the same issue, after looking at 3 rooms we finally got settled into a room, there were definitely things wrong with this room, but I was tired of packing and unpacking mind you there were 5 of us and 2 dogs staying for quite a long time.  I was advised we’d be give a discount for all our trouble which was super nice of them to do,
Manager Response: Dear Anna I,  Thank you for sharing your review of your experience with us. We are concerned at your comments regarding the challenges you encountered during your stay, as they are not typical of our usual feedback from our guests.  Rest assured, I have passed along the feedback to use as an example and to train our staff accordingly.  We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future and demonstrate our commitment to improve.   Warm Regards,

Summary: What I really loved most about this trip, that was different than other Disneyland trips we’ve had, the staff here was very warm and welcoming. My husband was mostly impressed with the room’s cleanliness. It’s a great place to stay with your family and the convenience of being able to buy your park tickets and shuttle passes was awesome and saved us time so we definitely took advantage of that. Even if you aren’t there to visit the parks, I would recommend this place based on the service alone. They really try to accommodate any requests you have.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Dirty rooms, poor communication rude staff.
Summary: Worst experience ever stayed here 9 days, they didn't  service our room on 4 of those days. Front desk was rude and straight up lied on multiple occasions. Leah is completely rude when I had a delivery for to the hotel..I'm attaching a picture in front of the elevator on a regular basis.  Due to elevator problem there were at time a 30 min wait to get to your room. Elevator was operating problematically for 7 of the 9 days. When I brought the issue to management, Kelly the gm said they cud give me a late check-out and some bonvoy pts since I booked third party, hardly comparable to the issues i had.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just checked in as return visitors and was welcomed, as usual, in a friendly and professional manner. We were welcomed to breakfast and allowed to check in early. Breakfast was fantastic, particularly Rocio’s amazing smoothie! Wouldn’t stay anywhere else!  Keep up the great work.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to keep family and experience Disney
Summary: Very good selection of rooms. Small rooms do not have an oven. Large suites do. We had one of each size. Noise on street side is noticeable while inside facing courtyard a bit quieter.   Rooms are clean and have basic utensils.   Breakfast area good size. Breakfast foods okay, what one should expect for this type of hotel.   Service excellent. Not often you get delivered coffee while sitting at your table in a serve yourself breakfast hotel. Lourdes served us well and was super polite as were all staff.   I’m a Marriott loyalist but this one gets extra credit for courtesy and helpfulness. Made the Disney portion of trip all the more delightful.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms in need refresh
Summary: We stayed in early October for a conference at Hyatt next door.  Wife and son accompanied me and we did Disney before and Hollywood after.  When we arrived were received by the most super friendly staff ever!  She welcomed us and thanked me for being Gold Elite member and upgraded us to 2 room suite. Answered all my questions and her suggestion for shuttle to Disneyland was perfect for us (every 30 minutes).  Room was showing its age. Ripped carpet and shower needed upgrade but was very clean and verrrry spacious. Breakfast was typical of included bkfast hotels but there was always something available and predictably busy depending on time you go in morning.  Since we are from east coast and 4 hour time difference , we did not have any problems getting there very early so not
Manager Response: none

Summary: Rocio was an excellent breakfast host. She greeted us when we walked to the breakfast area with a smile and was very friendly. Rocio also offered us smoothie which was so tasty. She is the reason why we will come back to this property.   The walls in the lobby area were a bit dirty but overall we were happy with our stay
Manager Response: none

Summary: We loved our stay for our Disneyland family vacation. Sophia was so kind and thoughtful! Our kids had been sick and she went out of her way to make things better for us. Anytime we needed something they were happy to help. Anytime we went to breakfast they had a surprise for our kids. Breakfast was great with lots of options. We will definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The residence inn at garden grove is a fantastic place to take your family. Our room was very accommodating and the air conditioning made it even better because of how cold it would get. Beds in our room were very comfortable and the staff did everything they could to accommodate us, I would even say they went over the top!  The breakfast is not your typical free breakfast! These guys change it up everyday and give you ten different options to eat! From 6 different good cereals not the kind you’d never touch to great yogurts waffles, eggs, bacon etc!! The cooks are fantastic and care about your experience!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great stay, loved the staff specially Lourdes, its hard to find great customer service but she made a huge difference in our trip.   Definitely coming back not just because of Lourdes but because its close to Disneyland as well !  Had a great experience.  -Alexa
Manager Response: none

Summary: There is a shuttle and runs every 30 minutes taking you to and from the park and it's super cheap we paid like $6 for me and my kid for all day. You can buy your just need tickets at the hotel which saves time! They even have a cute little shop that sells tons of Disney souvenirs! The pool is amazing they have tons of pool toys! They have outdoor games for the kids and a basketball court the arcade was super fun and I have a great laundromat! Super family friendly! The breakfast buffet was so good they even have Mickey waffles. Huge huge breakfast selection everything from a parfait bar to corned beef hash and eggs everything they literally had something for everyone. And the best part about this hotel the absolute reason why I will always stay here any time I come to
Manager Response: none

Summary: Room style 2 bedrooms with kitchen , Buffett breakfast included,  pool , neighborhood access to restaurants, Disney.  Very helpful staff.  Giorgi was extremely helpful and always followed up.  Gym is limited equipment.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Crappy service, no shuttle to Disney
Summary: The only good thing going on at this location is the flavored water they have in the lobby. My friend booked this for us using points. She called multiple times leading up to our trip making sure that we had the right room booked and everything was alright and was assured it was. The first night we received the room she booked. As we were leaving the next morning they told us that we had to pack and move rooms because they had sold our room.(She booked with points, so apparently her loyalty isn't worth anything). The staff was rude, asking her "what do you want US to do? The room is sold". We moved rooms, but when we came back from our day our room keys didn't work. They had checked us out and turned off our card keys. So, after a day of walking at a convention, we had to trudge
Manager Response: none

Summary: The folks at the Residence Inn were outstanding from start to finish.  Leigha was fantastic at check in and put us in a great room.  Though the one tv did not work at first, Luis came and was friendly, quick and thorough in getting it repaired, and Kat took care of us at check out, sending us on our way with complimentary cookies for our son.  In every way, the price, location, and above all hospitality and service were as impressive as anything I have experienced at far more famous, "pricey" hotels.  Nice job, guys!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Staff are always friendly & helpful, going out of their way to meet our needs. We've been bringing our family here for many, many years. Always a pleasure to return & have people recognize you & call you by name. We are given the special treatment without having to be asked. Large 2 bedroom suite is awesome for our 6 person family. Location is great with shopping areas close by. A bit of a walk to Disneyland but the weather is sunny & great for walking. Room prices are more reasonable in the off season. Another off season advantage is that it isn't so crowded at breakfast time. Full breakfast with something for even the pickiest of eaters. The kitchen staff are wonderful, esp. Lourdes, who goes out of her way for us. Welcoming, friendly, & accomodating...what more can you ask
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Bed bugs and too many long term guest
Summary: Overall this is not a bad hotel. Breakfast is decent, its located close to plenty of stores and restaurants. It operates more like an extended stay motel, quite  a number of guest appeared to be living there. Front desk seemed short staffed or invisible last few visits. At least one staff member was very helpful and she is the reason for the 3. We stayed a few days left with bite marks and bug bites from possibly bed bugs. I called to speak with the manager Roy on multiple occasions to address the incident with the bugs and he never returned my calls. This is not what I expect as a long term marriott guest. I wll not return and will not be encouraging others to stay here either.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback about your recent stay at the Residence Inn Garden Grove. Please accept our sincerest apologies for any aggravation or inconvenience experienced during your visit. Comments from our guests enable us to continually improve and exceed those standards. Please be confident that we will follow-up on the points you have outlined to avoid recurrence. The time taken along with the effort made to share your comments with us is most appreciated. Feedback from our guests is vitally important in our mission to be the first choice of the world’s travelers. We want you as our guest and are hopeful that you will afford us the opportunity to provide lodging services in the future. Thanks for your ongoing loyalty and understanding.

Summary: Great hotel for families!  Book the room with two bedrooms/two bathrooms-well worth the extra money!  Kitchens come with full size fridge, stove, and microwave.  Also table that seats four.  Lots of space! Pool is large and clean,  temperature seemed to be about 75-77 or so.  Large basketball court.  Grill area is not too large, so you may have to wait for grill.  Breakfast is ok, good variety changes each day.  Plenty of space in the breakfast room. Shuttle for DisneyLand picks up right in front, ride to Disney takes about 10-15 minutes, depending on number of stops.
Manager Response: none

Summary: By far the best value for our big family. We have 6 kids and our suite has 2 twin beds in one room, 2 queens in another, and a pull out couch and 2 bathrooms. And free breakfast! Great value all around! Central location. Very friendly staff. Great pool as well. This is our #1 choice, well above any VRBO because you can’t beat the value.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I’ve stayed here before and had a great stay, however, this stay was EXCEPTIONAL! We came for a few days to celebrate our daughters 2nd birthday. I had originally booked my stay through the Marriott Bonvoy app but also called in the day of to find out if there was any possibility to check in earlier. LEIGHA took my call and assisted in the check in process and also flagged our room for early check in. She was very helpful in adding in our additional requests (crib, extra sheets, etc), all the while being attentive and helpful. She also took note that we were staying to celebrate my daughters 2nd birthday. She promptly asked what my daughters name was and wished her a happy birthday. Once we arrived at the hotel, the check in process was fast and efficient!  Once we finally
Manager Response: none

Summary: I’m really quite confused at the positive reviews. It isn’t until now that I saw Sugarcane77s reviews. I wish I had seen it before I booked!!  This hotel is run down. The pool area is dirty (stuff floating in pool and bandaids and food crumbs all over and no one cleaning it), the room is dated and dingy. I feel like I’ve been duped by the reviews. I’m quite sad that I booked here. I hope Costco Travel will let us move. But that will be hard after a full day at Disneyland. I may have to stay. We are Marriott rewards members and have stayed at lovely Residence Inns. This not one of them.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I left feeling like I mattered and that they did it right!
Summary: Thank you very much for your assistance for our vacation. We have not been on one in years and the last one failed so this was really special. My kids are about to go off to college and you helped place a last good memory of the family in their minds.... Ok on to the purpose of the email.  We arrived in the afternoon and we immediately noticed 2 things. One was the greeting the front desk staff called out to us when we walked in (smiles attached), and the second was the cucumber water table. We were treated professionally every step of the way. I will detail some interactions below, but I want to call out a name that my fiancé remembers fondly before I forget, Susan at the front desk helped my fiancé well enough that while I had a hard time remembering any specific names Trish
Manager Response: none

Summary: July 9 2019 I stayed at your hotel. We had some very unfortunate experiences. July 9th when we had got to our hotel room we turned on the tv and there was images of pornographic videos. We let the front desk know about it, and they said they had no idea. Also our room was never cleaned three days in a row. I had let housekeeping know about it they apologized about it, but than they never ended up cleaning the room. Maria front desk said they had “too much work” and I totally understand that. But why did it happen for three days in a row? Not very happy about this. Also on the Friday morning of last week. Mrs Lourdes I believe that is her name. She had yelled at me for saving breakfast for my kids and also would clean my table when I wasn’t finished eating it was very upsetting
Manager Response: Hello Marcela l,  First and foremost I would like to apologize to you regarding your recent stay with us.  We do our best to make sure all of our guest leave happy, and it looks like we've failed.  I will be using this as a training opportunity for my team to ensure that this doesn't happen again.    I hope you will give us another chance in the future to show you that this isn't like us.   Kind regards,  Roy Garcia Front Office Manager

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel about ten times as my son plays in basketball tournaments in this area frequently. What I like best about this hotel is that everything is good every time. Easy to park, quick and friendly check-in, clean suite, lots of space, full size fridge. Nice pool and hot tub, basketball court for my son, good breakfast.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights with 3 kids in the 2 room suite with 2 bathrooms. The rooms were dated and could use some new carpet.  The beds were comfy. The air conditioning worked well in all the rooms.  The pull out couch was a joke...it was all springs, so my daughter had to sleep on the cushions. We had some toilet issues, which they sent someone immediately to fix it. They claim that the beds are queen, but they are clearly double which is disappointing when you are staying for 4 nights and specifically look for queen beds.  The complimentary breakfast was good with 5 waffle machines and bacon or sausage and scrambled eggs as well as some fruit, cereal, muffins, breads, yogurt, etc. They restocked often as well although sometimes ran out of coffee in all 3 machines at once
Manager Response: none

Summary: this is a clear situation in which the staff makes a huge difference  Especially Lourdes Bautista heading the food and beverage area along with Don Armando, Kat at reception along with Jessica Georgie and one of the kitchen really strived to make this as every other experience unforgettable  The gym and pool are wonderful cleanliness for the hotel perfect  Parking and Disney shuttle are a breeze   Kat loves kids and treated us like family  Had an amazing time at the grill + ping pong area and even made friends from Australia
Manager Response: none

Summary: Loved staying at Residence Inn Garden Grove, the hotel is very clean, the staff are amazing and so helpful. Their breakfast has a lot of varieties, and Lourdes was on top things. We loved the outside area by the pool. Great at everything
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Breakfast was great, rooms were nice, request were not responded to
Summary: We recently stayed here, in a two bedroom suite.Our flight was early and we got to the hotel early (about 9:30 am). We were tiered from the the early trip to the airport and had requested an early check in. We did not get our room till 3 pm and were still charged an early check in fee. When we got our room it was spacious and tidy. The beds were comfortable except for the pull out, the mattress was basically a wire frame with a sheet on it, my son was miserable.we also spent out first three days requesting 2 pillows that finally came on day 3. We were not disappointed by the breakfast. They had scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, and a variety of breakfast breads, cereals, waffles, fruits, juices, and various other items. It was fantastic to get a good breakfast to start the day.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel suite for larger family
Summary: Shuttle service available for small fee, drop off right before entrance to Disneyland. Suites a must to move comfortably for all ages, kitchen stocked with utensils, pots, pans, bowls, etc. The fridge had a working ice maker, dishwasher, microwave, oven, & garbage disposal properly functional. We cooked to reduce prices of eating dinner. Residence provided a full breakfast buffet, easy to access in early mornings. The children enjoyed the warm outdoor pool & we dipped into the hot tub after our trips to theme park. Different restaurants around hotel (Joe crab shack, red Robin, steakhouse, McDonalds, Indian restaurant, etc). We utilize laundry area, packed our own detergent and our clothes were not stolen. We enjoyed our stay and had exceptional service from house keeping (clean
Manager Response: none

Summary: I read all the reviews and felt pretty confident to book this hotel chain (Marriott Residence Inn) again. What a mistake. Let me give the details. Booked a two bedroom suite for 5 nights in July. It worked for the family of 6 (my hubby and I, our two little boys and my parents). The suite was very spacious. I loved there were two bathrooms and kitchenette! BUT, the ice maker didn’t work and neither did the oven. Turned out someone had unplugged both per the repairman they sent up to check it out. The hotel is really run down, need some remodeling like some paint in the rooms and bathrooms. The master bathroom smelled awful the entire time. The elevators were really slow. And my last complaint are the towels. I don’t think the cleaner understood the concept every hotel has on
Manager Response: Hello Sugarcane77,  I would like to thank you for taking the time to reach out to us in regards to your stay at the Residence Inn Garden Grove. I would like to apologize that our services fell short of your expectation. Comments such as yours are great tools for us as we use that for re-training our team to ensure each guest has a great time whilst staying with us. The issues you mention have been brought to the attention of the respective department heads to ensure that they are rectified to prevent any guest inconvenience.  The time taken along with the effort made to share your comments with us is most appreciated.

Summary Heading: Perfect place, perfect people for Disneyland stay
Summary: Like many families, we met in Anaheim to spend a day at Disneyland. Our range of ages was 1 to 72 and everyone enjoyed the visit, in no small part because of our treatment over two nights at this hotel. The employees attended to requests big and small. There were six of us in two rooms and we asked about getting rooms close together. No problem, even though this was clearly a busy time, as the week of the Star Wars opening at Disney. Both Susan and Leah at the Front Desk could not have been more pleasant and more accommodating. We asked about where to get a toothbrush, since one of us forgot hers. Bingo. Here it is. On the morning of departure, Star Wars characters were in the lobby and breakfast room, where Lourdes was making sure everybody had a good time (she insisted we all
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for reaching out to us in regards to your stay at the Residence Inn Garden Grove.   Thank you so much for sharing your positive comments with us which I have gladly passed on. I was so glad to read that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay. Your message has been shared with the entire team and the respective department has been complimented for a job well done. The time you have taken along with the effort you have made to share your comments with us is most appreciated. We are looking forward to welcoming you back.

Summary: The people here is very nice, since we arrived we have received smiles, wishes and actions to make us our visit very comfortable and prevent any situation. Lourdes in the restaurant zone is great!! The location is very good.
Manager Response: none

Summary: It began with Jessica at the front desk.  She was extremely helpful, patient, courteous and welcoming. That was much appreciated after a long drive.  When we entered our hotel room it was clean and had all the comforts of home.  The staff had an amenity placed in the room with a nice card attached for our anniversary! It brought a smile to our face when we open the hand written card.  Breakfast was delicious and even had the mickey mouse waffle makers.  After a long day at Disneyland coming back to a hotel with such pleasant and outgoing employees.  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone that is making the trip to Disneyland.  The shuttle service was easy, effortless and convenient.  We will definitely be coming back!  Thank you!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family booked a family suite in this hotel through Costco travel. We were able to check in early, our Disney tickets were waiting for us at concierge desk. Room was huge with two bedrooms and two bathrooms. Good breakfast. Convenient shuttle service to Disney for a reasonable charge. And the best customer service!!! They helped us a lot with getting back things we forgot in the room safe.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location and clean rooms. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Roberto and Mike the manager went up and above to make sure we had a great trip! I would like to thank the staff and everyone. Our vacation was a mess and the staff jumped right in to help clean it up. Thank you again!!
Manager Response: Los117277 - Thank you for taking the time to recognize Roberto and Mike from our Front Desk team.  We certainly pride ourselves on providing a great customer experience and these two do an amazing job at that.  We're happy you enjoyed your vacation and we would be happy to have you back any time.

Summary: I just wish the $20 parking fee was not in such fine print and was shocked at the price when I checked in. During check-in at 5:30 and there was a long line and only one person attending. I mentioned it upon check-in to the clerk that I was surprise for such a large hotel there was only one person at the reception counter. I just got a shag of the shoulders.
Manager Response: Hello pidasostewart1971,  Thank you for your feedback about your recent stay at the Residence Inn Garden Grove. Please accept our sincerest apologies for any aggravation or inconvenience experienced during your visit. Comments from our guests enable us to continually improve and exceed those standards. Please be confident that we will follow-up on the points you have outlined to avoid recurrence. The time taken along with the effort made to share your comments with us is most appreciated. Feedback from our guests is vitally important in our mission to be the first choice of the world’s travelers. We want you as our guest and are hopeful that you will afford us the opportunity to provide lodging services in the future. Thanks for your ongoing loyalty and understanding.

Summary: This hotel staff is fantastic. From the moment we checked in until the moment we left, the whole team was kind, engaged and helpful. They helped our group out when we had room requests, the breakfast was amazing and we loved the Star Wars theme for the opening day of Star Wars Land at Disney! They truly go above and beyond and I would not stay anywhere else on my next trip to Disney. The hotel is clean and the set up was perfect for our family vacation.  Special thanks to Susan, Leigh and Lourdes. Great job.
Manager Response: Hello lisasJ6698SE,  Thank you for reaching out to us in regards to your stay at the Residence Inn Garden Grove. Thank you so much for sharing your positive comments with us which I have gladly passed on. I was so glad to read that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay. Your message has been shared with the entire team and the respective department has been complimented for a job well done. The time you have taken along with the effort you have made to share your comments with us is most appreciated. We are looking forward to welcoming you back.

Summary: The family and I were leery booking our stay at the Residence Inn due to a bad experience at another hotel nearby Disneyland but we were all pleasantly surprised!   Check in process was quick and easy. Our room was a King Suite with Small Kitchen. The rooms could use a little updating but we were never bothered by the room seeing “out dated” or dirty. Rooms were surprisingly clean in fact.   This hotel has 8 floors and I would recommend a room on the lower levels due to there only being two elevators and it’s a pretty busy hotel especially on the weekends! We were on the 8th floor and it made for very long elevator rides.   Breakfast was also much better than expected. Nothing to write home about but you can pick and choose something to your liking for sure. I’ve been to some of
Manager Response: Dear MikeandMeliss,  On behalf of the entire hotel team, we want to thank you for sharing your most memorable experiences with us during your recent stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort Area/Garden Grove.  It is always encouraging to hear positive feedback, particularly when it comes from those who matter the most – you! By taking pride in putting people first, we are not only executing the mission of our founders, but exceeding the expectations of our valued guests.  Please note your feedback has been shared with the hotel team as a critical way of understanding how we can continue to deliver great experiences. Thank you for staying at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort Area/Garden Grove and we hope you choose to create more memories here whenever your travels bring you back to Garden Grove.

Summary Heading: Not up tostandards of Marriott hotels!!!
Summary: Stayed May 18th to 19th at the Residence Inn Garden Grove, Ca. where we have stayed many times before and never had a problem until now. I will say that they were very helpful in that I accidentally put in the wrong date for our arrival and they accommodated us anyways.  We were in a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom suite and it  was very disappointing this time.  The room was very dirty and run down.  The hallway carpets were dirty and when we got off the elevator there was an extremely strong odor of marijuana down the hallway. We did tell the front desk right away but the next morning it was very strong again. We could tell which room it was but I guess it was not important to the hotel because they continued to stink up the "non-smoking" hotel.  The two twin beds did not have blankets
Manager Response: Hello Lovefortravel64,  Thank you for your feedback about your recent stay at the Residence Inn Garden Grove. Please accept our sincerest apologies for any aggravation or inconvenience experienced during your visit. Comments from our guests enable us to continually improve and exceed those standards. Please be confident that we will follow-up on the points you have outlined to avoid recurrence. The time taken along with the effort made to share your comments with us is most appreciated. Feedback from our guests is vitally important in our mission to be the first choice of the world’s travelers. We want you as our guest and are hopeful that you will afford us the opportunity to provide lodging services in the future. Thanks for your ongoing loyalty and understanding.

Summary: Suite 727 - GOOD - efficient central a/c, quiet, 2 good Queen beds in BR, decent pillows, in-unit safe, pleasant staff, breakfast incl, close to restaurants, Target etc. Rarely heard other guests, unaware of water use in unit above! Buy shuttle tickets to Disney - it is much easier and cheaper than taking your car.  Disney parking is $25/day:-(  If you're with Interval the parking is free.  Otherwise $19/day:-(  NEGATIVES - a/c compressor in BR wakes you.  A/C blows directly on head of beds, full kit is ill-equipped, beware the rough edges on closet shelves, no DVD or CD players, no washer/dryers in unit, couch uncomfortable, windows dirty.  Needs more and better lighting in unit.  This is a tired Marriott - we are used to better from Marriott. But the location is great if
Manager Response: Avlem - Thank you for the great feedback after your stay.  We agree with you -  our rooms are in need of a make over and we're excited to announce that January of next year we will be undergoing a full renovation!  The TV's in the room are smart TV's and allow our guests to connect to their Hulu/Netflix accounts.  And although each individual suite does not feature washer and dryer we do offer a large laundry facility for our guest to use on our lobby level.  We are confident that you'll enjoy the rooms much more after the renovation and hope that you come back and try us again.

Summary: They accommodated our 30 students for the FFA state convention with no issues. Area is safe and easy to walk to convention center and Disney areas. Clean and nice hotel overall. Entrance and lobby is easy to navigate. Mickey waffle makers was a hit!
Manager Response: Luckycreeker - Thank you for choosing to stay with us for the FFA State Convention.  With our properties two bedroom suites and rooms with two queen beds we find that we are an ideal option for large groups.  Toss in the location being close to Disneyland and walking distance to the Anaheim convention center and what more could you ask for???  Free breakfast!!!  The waffles are always a big hit, but we do offer a variety of healthy options as well.  We would love to host you all again next time you visit the area.

Summary: l have been staying here for over 8 months.  The hotel has a great pool and hot tub.  The terrace is very nice with comfortable furniture.  Lots of washers and dryers. The staff is incredible!  Mike, Marcie, Wilma and front desk people are always there to meet any needs I might have.  They treat me like family!   I have had a great experience by staying at this hotel...mostly due to the amazing staff who work here.  Thank you for all the holiday surprises!   The shuttle to Disney is a life saver.  Great place to stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Family Property - Easy access to Disney!!
Summary: First trip to Disney with our 4 Grandchildren.  Couldn't have had better accommodations. One King Bed/Bath - Living area w/ Kitchen & pull out sofa. (sofa mattress was horrible so just used the sofa cushions for the smallest one to sleep on - worked fine)  Second Bedroom with two Double Beds/Bath. Management and staff were very welcoming and the Breakfast staff worked constantly to keep good supplies of food out.  Would recommend and will come back again. Note: yes, it can use some updating /paint & furnishings which we understand is being scheduled.  For a large family it doesn't get much better. In addition, great amenities for the kids / pools, games, etc. and coin-op laundry available.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is a short Uber ride to Disneyland and offers excellent amenities.  The free breakfast is outstanding!  Waffles, eggs, sausage, breads, milk, juice, cheese, tortillas, cereal, oatmeal, nutella, yogurt, fruit and more.  You name it they has it, except bacon at least not often.   The room was spacious.  We had a king suite.  My wife and I occupied the King bed in its own room and our 5 year old slept on the pullout couch and our 3 year old slept in a playpen which the hotel provided free of charge.   Our Uber ride to Disneyland from the hotel was always $6-7 USD.  We didn't bother with the shuttle as we wanted to operate on our own schedule.   The pool area is amazing.   Great hotel.  Will stay there again!
Manager Response: Hello Jeremy J,  Thank you for reaching out to us in regards to your stay at the Residence Inn Garden Grove. Thank you so much for sharing your positive comments with us which I have gladly passed on. I was so glad to read that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay. Your message has been shared with the entire team and the respective department has been complimented for a job well done. The time you have taken along with the effort you have made to share your comments with us is most appreciated. We are looking forward to welcoming you back.

Summary: Our family had a suite with bunk beds for the kids, that was worth the price! The room is spacious, quiet and clean.  They offer Paul Mitchell shampoo and conditioner, which is nice. The breakfast is included and has a lot to offer, this is what stood out to me: they offer four hot items and the scrambled eggs were delicious! They offered Noosa Yogurt which was a hit.  There are about five cereal options and two of them were healthy granola.  Of course they had the waffle makers and everyone likes those. There is plenty of seating in the dining area as well. Now this hotel is not close to Disney; it is a 40 minute walk with kids and a $6.00 Uber/Lyft ride. I would still stay here again because the breakfast that is included is a huge savings and the bunk beds.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Better Residence Inns and extended stay hotels in the area
Summary: Let me preface this with, I stay at a lot of Marriott Residence Inn properties in the US.  I am an Ambassador Elite member in their loyalty club.  Residence Inn is my preferred brand in the Marriott family.  So I feel I can say with all sincerity that this is not a good example of a Residence Inn property.  While the staff at this hotel were friendly, they did not do their jobs particularly well.  For example:   I called 5 hours prior to check in and was told I would have a shower chair in our room, which was not there.   Check in took 20 minutes, even though I checked in through the Bonvoy App. Our room not only showed HUGE amounts of wear and tear (every seating surface had holes, burn marks, stains, or missing upholstery) and the door leading back to the hallway had writing

Please accept our sincerest apologies for any aggravation or inconvenience experienced during your visit. Comments from our guests enable us to continually improve and exceed those standards. Feedback from our guests is vitally important in our mission to be the first choice of the world’s travelers. We want you as our guest and are hopeful that you will afford us the opportunity to provide lodging services in the future. Thanks for your ongoing loyalty and understanding.

Summary: We arrived after a long drive to find our room incorrectly booked. We were able to work quickly with Hortencia to resolve the problem. Sweet people! Nice pool! Clean place! Breakfast was good! They handle a busy check in very efficiently!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for Disney. Front Desk Manager (forget the name but was a male) was very polite and provided a lot of helpful information.   Allie from the front desk helped me print event tickets when I was having an issue. She went out of her way to help me out and really provided superior customer service. She certainly knows how to provide excellent service.   I would certainly provide a solid recommendation for the service at this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights along with another family and were assigned to adjacent rooms, which was nice.  This was our first stay here and we were absolutely stunned. We brought 4 of our children, so having a kitchen was great, but the complimentary hot breakfast every morning was awesome!  It helped us save on our meal budget, which meant we could do more fun stuff.  The staff was always amazing and extremely helpful and took the time to any our (many, many) questions.  We highly recommended this hotel and hope to stay there again in 2021!
Manager Response: Hello Dizol_Ohana,  Thank you for reaching out to us in regards to your stay at the Residence Inn Garden Grove. Thank you so much for sharing your positive comments with us which I have gladly passed on. I was so glad to read that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay. Your message has been shared with the entire team and the respective department has been complimented for a job well done. The time you have taken along with the effort you have made to share your comments with us is most appreciated. We are looking forward to welcoming you back.

Summary Heading: Terrible customer service. Avoid at all costs.
Summary: Items were missing from my room when I returned in the afternoon. I approached the front desk to discuss what happened and not only were they unwilling to help, but the manager essentially laughed in my face. He did nothing to make me feel better about this violation and offered zero compensations, other than scoffing and saying it was not possible. Absolutely deplorable.   Now, the hotel was booked solid due to a conference, and we were paying premium rates in addition to being Marriot Preferred clients. This hotel was already lower than my usual expectations, and this experience with the front desk in Anaheim was the worst I’ve had and I’d beg you to consider another hotel in the area, or make sure and bring all of your items with you each time you leave unless you don’t mind
Manager Response: none

Summary: I came down for a funeral needed a happy place to check into. I’m so thankful it was Residence Inn w/ Horcienda. It was my birthday checked in and had to Run for more errands. As soon as I got back to my room there was a Tote with a HOME MADE BIRTHDAY CARD and goodies inside. The cookies were my FAVORITE! She made the check in so easy and worth my stay. I came for a funeral and she brightened my day with that small gesture. Thank you Horcienda I really needed that. She put it us in a quiet area knowing it’s been a long day. The room was very clean and the kind of relaxation I needed. Thank you Horcienda I will recommend this hotel to everyone and hope they get to meet your beautiful spirit as I did.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: This place make you feel like your home again
Summary: We have stayed at this location for years.  We have tried other places by the park. None of them come close to Thisbe place.  Leigha at the front desk is always friendly and always makes our stay special.  Breakfast is always fresh. If they run out do t hesitate to tell them.  They are always hustling to keep stuff hot and fresh. Lorades ( Lulu ) always remembers me and my family.  She always welcomes us back.  Rooms are spacious and work well for a large family.  This is a place that truly make you think you have just arrived to your second home... staff is always friendly and smiling.  You can’t beat the location.  Target is right across the street for anything you might have forgot. Don’t hesitate booking.  I promise you will not be sorry.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good Location, Very Clean, Great Breakfast
Summary: We traded in with Interval International. We did get a unit on the 8th floor which we were very appreciative of as I had read other complaining about the noise. All of the staff were very friendly & accommodating. We were even given a bag of fresh cookies at check in. The unit was very clean; in fact all of the public areas were very clean as well. Every morning there was a great breakfast - lots of options & some changes every day. The staff made sure that everything remained well stocked. This was a very nice free feature.  The unit itself was dated. The kitchen was very poorly equipped compared to what I usually find in II trades. The bed was very comfortable. Unfortunately, there was not a comfortable chair in the living room. My husband has a bad back & he really struggled
Manager Response: none

Summary: We arrived two weeks before Christmas and stayed for a week. Upon arriving, the front desk gave us a warm welcome followed with a bag of homemade cookies to bring to our room! They also had a coffee/hot chocolate station set up in the lounge. This is a perfect hotel for families. We were pleasantly surprised by our room.Super clean and a great layout with a separate bedroom from the main living area. The room was equipped with a full size fridge and dishwasher and is a 5 minute walk to target. The buffet breakfast every morning exceeded my expectations. They have a wide variety of cereals, waffle station, pastries, and a hot food station that changes slightly each day. They have plenty of seating for families as well as a children's room decorated with Stars Wars and other
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A Great Visit to Garden Grove California!
Summary: I, and we, have stayed at the Residence Inn Garden Grove since the year it opened.  It is an exceptional location with fantastic staff.  The suite I stayed in was spotlessly clean, well appointed, and even though a single bedroom unit was spacious.  Marie, who checked me in, was very professional, helpful, and welcomed me by name.  As I had arrived relatively late, she even provided some fresh water for me as I was not going to get groceries until the next day.  Marie also took the time to update me on some changes at the resort and also gave me a welcome "treat".  This was great service and appreciated after a long day of traveling.  I made a quick call to the front desk to ask Marie for some extra clothes hangars and they arrived at my door within 5 minutes!  Simply great
Manager Response: none

Summary: After a fantastic check in with wonderful staff, a room upgrade and just a fantastic  visit overall, my last day my partner was washing clothes downstairs so I didn’t have the latch on the door. I heard a knock at the door expecting it to be her and unannounced a housekeeper walked in!!! Needless to say I wasn’t appropriately dressed (or dressed at all for that matter). I was not happy.  Other than that this hotel is great and has a Disney shuttle (currently $6.00 round trip). They have one of the best breakfasts that I’ve seen at a Residence Inn (WAY better than the RIs at Disney World in Florida). They do charge for parking but it’s unreasonable given their nightly rates.  Give them a visit!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We are a family of four (2 adults and 2 kids) and we’d stopped over in LA on our way to New York so we could take the kids to Disneyland, Adventure Land and Universal Studios.   The Residence Inn is conveniently located for the Disney parks, unfortunately I hadn’t looked at relative distances to other attractions, namely Universal Studios which is at the other end of Los Angeles city.  The hotel is price pointed at a budget level but accommodation is clean and spacious. We got a family suite which had 2 separate bedrooms (both with ensuites) and a common lounge/kitchen area.  The accommodation was clean and reasonably appointed but looked dated. Each room had a TV with remote and the main lounge area had a desk / lamp. Room also had a airconditonining. The kitchen was well
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice to have a real kitchen. Some of the furniture was a bit old but was well kept. Large shower toilet space but small vanity with one sink. Over all the room was a bit pricey although it was close enough to the Civic Center that one could walk to the show.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Fantastic Customer Service and Family Hotel
Summary: This is the first review I have every written as usually I can't be bothered making a comment and usually the places are not really worth the effort.  I am making an exception as I think this place is fantastic.  Here is why: a) Leah and MIchael at the front desk couldn't do enough for you.  From grabbing us ice to have with our drinks around the pool, supplying us cookies while we sat by the fire (w/o asking), knowing our names and answering any type of questions we had with a friendly smile and attitude.   Customer Service is everything.  b) The Family friendly Amenities like a warm pool, spa, table tennis, basketball court, outdoor BBQ, laundry, gym and 1 and 2 bedroom suites allow you to take a break from the busyness and craziness of Disneyland.  Everyone in the family is
Manager Response: Dear Bald123,  Thank you so much for sharing your positive comments with us which I have gladly passed on. I was so glad to read that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay. Your message has been shared with the entire team and the respective department has been complimented for a job well done. The time you have taken along with the effort you have made to share your comments with us is most appreciated. We are looking forward to welcoming you back.

Summary: Room was the perfect set up for our family.  Target is across the street. Disneyland is a short bus ride. Restaurants with eat in and order pick up. Perfect hotel for families. Some of the room furniture is showing its wear and tear. One thing of note. The wifi has a standard speed with the option to purchase higher speed for streaming movies on your device.
Manager Response: Sudsie S - Thank you for the positive comments you left reflecting on your most recent stay.  We happen to completely agree with you and Thank that our hotel is the perfect location for families or anyone traveling for an extended period of time.  Not to mention our close proximity to Disneyland makes us a clear choice for those on vacation.  Thank you again for staying.

Summary: Jessica at the front desk was amazing. She was welcoming and helped us with our room. She answered all of our questions and was super friendly. Room was good as well. Will be staying here again. Thank you for the great experience!
Manager Response: Sophiesmith5 - Thank you for taking the time to recognize Jessica, just one of our amazing front desk staff.  I'm happy to hear that she exceeded your expectations in service and made your stay that much more enjoyable.  We cant wait for your next visit, we'll look forward to seeing you soon.

Summary Heading: Rare two bedroom suite, but not without problems.
Summary: We overall liked this place, but couldn’t give it four dots.  Finding a two bedroom suite near Disneyland at a reasonable price seemed like a great deal, but some issues bothered us enough to make it an average stay.  Don’t get me wrong, if you have two noisy kids and need a second bedroom with doors separating them from the main bedroom, this is still worth it!  The following lists may seem picky, but I’ll include them anyway.  Good: Friendly staff at front desk.  Check-in and check-out was a breeze. Free breakfast was great!  Long hours and lots of food! Shuttle to Disneyland was frequent and fast. Showers were nice and the towels thick :)  Bad: Kitchen was so dark we had to ask for an extra lamp, which didn’t help much. Sofa bed was dirty and couldn’t be opened without moving
Manager Response: 111SimonA - Thank you for your candid review after your most recent stay.  It looks like the stay left plenty of room for improvement.  We certainly appreciate your constructive criticism and as we are in the planning stages of our much needed renovation, we will take your comments into consideration as much as possible moving forward.  Otherwise, we are happy to hear that the additional space in the large two bedroom suite worked out well for your family.

Summary: love the hotel the staff friendly and helpful great if you wanna go to Disneyland for more days i only stay 2 nights love the breakfast to a lot of options and hot the bedroom was great for 5 and yo have kitchen too.
Manager Response: Linda260311 - Your 5 star review is greatly appreciated!  We are thrilled that you were able to enjoy our large complementary breakfast and the large suites that we offer with the fully equipped kitchens.  Thank you again for the kind remarks and we look forward to have you back soon.

Summary: We surprised are kids with a Disneyland trip for the Holidays!  It was so much fun that we will be making this an annual trip! We even bought season passes!  The staff was wonderful and friendly! We will be back.  Thank you!
Manager Response: joserazo1 - Thank you for choosing to spend your holiday season with us and Disneyland.  We're thrilled that you've decided to become annual pass holders, and we hope that we'll become your hotel of choice for your future visits.

Summary Heading: Top notch - 4th stay and more to come
Summary: This is my 4th stay at this property, and each stay is just as pleasant as the one before... if not better. Although I always check in via the mobile app, the line to check in/get my key was fairly long and the wait seemed destined to be a while. Enter Alfredo (Director of rooms I believe) - He wanted to help facilitate the movement of the line, and so he started attempting to help me with the check in process. Not being 100% familiar with all aspects of the system, he called on an associate that was passing by named Carrington. Carrington was just as pleasant as can be. Trainee was the title on his nametag, but he was clearly not a trainee - he stepped in and quickly completed the process. Each one of my stays, it certainly wasn't required, but my rooms were always upgraded,
Manager Response: Lvnodoubt2018 - First and foremost thank you for being a loyal repeat guest and continuing to choose to stay at our location when your travels bring you to Anaheim.  All of the individuals you recognized in your review are just some of our top notch staff, and we certainly pride ourselves on creating a culture of fun, personalized, warm hospitality.  I will be sure to share your comments with each individual - thank you again and we all look forward to having you back soon.

Summary: This hotel gave us such a great experience.  Hortencia worked the front desk and she was so helpful even on the phone before we arrived.
