Cookie making and movie night for the kids and games for them on the property to keep them entertained. Everything was super clean. We will definitely go back to stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Location and great family hotel
Summary: We booked this hotel for the sole purpose of going to Disneyland.  We didn't want to spend too much but at the same time we wanted to be close to the park.  This place was perfect for our objective.  At check-in, the front desk lady asked if we were going to Disneyland and I said yes, and she promptly came back with a Disney toy for each of my kids.  I thought that was very nice.  The hotel itself wasn't fancy, or new, but it was clean and comfortable.  The complimentary breakfast was decent - and we really liked the family/children area with kids-sized tables and projector showing kids shows - very nice touch!  For Disneyland, we took the 3rd-party shuttle ($6 RT for adults and $3 for kids over 3), and it couldn't have worked out any better.  I would definitely recommend the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Amazing hotel, amazing breakfast. Perfect for kids and super close to Disneyland. My daughter loved every part of the hotel, they had amazing activities for kids. The breakfast was one of the best breakfasts I’ve ever had at a hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for three nights with some family on a trip to Disney land.  We chose this hotel due to them having a big enough room with enough beds to sleep all five of us.  Room was clean and well maintained.   Housekeeping did a good job daily.  Front desk staff were helpful.  The only thing that keeps this from being a five was the fact that one of the breakfast attendants on the Friday that we checked out wasn’t very friendly or helpful at all.  Maybe she was having a bad day.  However, we would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great family stay for first Disney trip
Summary: We spent two nights on family trip here. We were surprising our five year old daughter before she becomes a big sister soon. The staff at the hotel were so kind to us and even gave my daughter some fun goodies to celebrate. They helped us get our tickets and transportation all set. The hotel is very kid friendly with a nice pool, outdoor games, and a kids eating area. Thank you to Kat at the front desk and all the awesome staff that made our trip more memorable!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Clean rooms. Comfortable beds. Good Kitchen & Amenities. Need to better the breakfast selection. They had two sets of breakfast menus which was laid every alternate day. Although the front desk staff was polite but some of their staff needs to learn customer relations. This was well handled by the managers. Overall a comfortable stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: one of the worst Marriott I've ever stayed in
Summary: Yes, It's close  to Disneyland but that's about it.  The room was very noisy 24/7. Road noise and children running up and down the hall.  It is old and run down.  The rooms need an over all cleaning .  A request for extra towels ,pillows and blankets was never taken care of. We had to go to the desk and get them ourselves. One of the days,  our room was never even serviced .  The front desk response made it  seem like it happened often .
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this hotel because of how close it was to Disneyland. We arrived early and was able to check in, there were 13 of us total so had a one room suite and a 2 room suite. Both rooms were spacious. We walked the 1.5 miles the first day but by the end of the night we were exhausted, did take the shuttle the next day, small fee involved but totally worth it so you don't have to park at Disneyland. They offered a great breakfast in the morning even though it got busy people moved about easily. I would stay here again if I ever come back to Disneyland.  The only down side was the maid cleaned the room and forgot to leave us towels, called the front desk and they delivered them within 15 minutes.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Location is very convenient; there's a shuttle to and from disneyland park with a minimal fee.  Staff at the front desk are cheerful and pleasant. The Kitchen staff provided excellent choice of breakfast food.  They worked very hard especially the # of people they serve during breakfast.  They should be commended and there should be a jar for tips :-) I just gave one of them a $ tip to make her day. We always stay here every time we bring the kids to Disneyland!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were just staying 1 night after visiting Disneyland. This hotel was super close and we were able to walk to Red Robin after a long day to get a drink. The parking was pretty confusing, but worked out. It does cost $17 per car, so be aware.   The BEST part of this stay was checking in. Lupe was amazing! Diet cheerful and upbeat she totally made our stay!  Breakfast was good, SUPER busy but they did a great job refilling items. We would totally stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here recently on a trip to Disneyland. Arrived early and was able to check in early which was a great bonus and allowed us to do some sightseeing. The front assist staff was very accommodating and Kelly Montes went out of her way to make our visit to Disneyland memorable. The one bedroom suite was spacious and comfortable. Made great use of the spa after a long day at Disneyland. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Recently stayed here for a few nights while attending a conference at the convention center. Hotel was about a 15 mins walk. Luckily weather was great each day.   Staff in hotel were nice. Breakfast was good. Even had egg white scrambled eggs. Room was a one bedroom suite. Could use some update but found it quite nice.  Stayed on first floor against street and never heard traffic noise.   Gym was nice few treadmills, dumbbells, and a bike and elliptical.    Pool looked nice for family’s with kids. Outdoor seating area was nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for 2 nights, staff are very friendly, rooms are clean, but it's outdated, carpets smells bad and is old, need to be changed. Breakfast is great, a lot of choices.  Overall my stay is okay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We are here for 3 days at Disney, and this hotel has been pretty great. I’ve cooked a meal for 3 in the kitchenette, the breakfast provided is a great spread, and pool/ hot tub are among the nicer facilities I seen at a Marriott. Front desk is pretty great, quick to respond and courteous.  I noticed that our bathroom is a little dated, but clean. The beds are HARD, which is really out of character with our vast Marriott experience.  There is a cheap shuttle to Disney, so you don’t have to drive. It REALLY irritates me that if you’re paying all this money to stay somewhere, you get slapped with a parking charge. $17 a Day is just ridiculous. I know that other hotels charge it, but be different Marriott! And if you have platinum or elite members staying, eat that fee to keep
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here with our children and family and we had a great time. The room was amazing and very spacious! Check in was quick. Breakfast was awesome! All the employees were nice and very helpful.  We will definitely book here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great hotel! It was busy but the free breakfast and our room are awesome!! All the staff work hard and are very polite! We had 7 of us, 4 adults, and 3 teenagers. We had plenty of room ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ We’ll be back again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a great visit kids loved all the things to there.  They also made little Guy’s birthday very special with balloons and a gift. Thank you Lourdes for make it special.  We will definitely go back.👍🏼
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here one nite, very happy with service, room was grraittt!!! 2 rooms, 2 bth rooms, bunk beds and king size bed, full kitchen, very roomy, it was prestin clean, excellent view to the pool, brkfst included. Will stay here again
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked a bunch of marriott hotels in the area during our one week stay in LA. This had to be the worst of the bunch. We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite (Gold status) and the room was a nice size but the motor in the fridge was so noisy. Breakfast was ok with pretty good selection although the trays were empty a couple of times. It seemed like they were having trouble keeping up.   Biggest faux pas of the hotel was that there was a gentleman who definitely was not a guest of the hotel was hanging by the pool area and ended up swimming in his white undies leaving nothing to the imagination, All the kids left the pool cause of that and I didn't see a staff come out at all. Says a lot about the lack of security in the hotel.
Manager Response: Eric C, Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your recent stay at the Residence Inn Garden Grove. As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. We do apologize for the inconvenience with the fridge motor being noisy and the incident in the pool during your stay. We hope you will give us another opportunity to better your experience during your next travels to the Anaheim Area.

Summary: As of this date, I have spent 52 nights of this year (almost 2 months) at Marriott properties. Writing that this is the worst one is an incredible understatement. The lobby smells weird. My "upgraded" room looks like it may have been nice, 12 years ago. Parking is horrible and they have the nerve to charge $17 per night for it. Avoid the free breakfast. You get what you pay for. Unless you like playing waffle batter wars with 6 year old kids. If so, then try to arrive around 8AM to catch things at the peak.  I am really hard pressed to believe this is a Marriott property. I kept checking the signage thinking maybe they were scammers using a mis-spelling like "Mariot"  There is no bar here or I'd be drunk by now. There is a pool (think Karate Kid) and a Hot tub that is scarier to
Manager Response: Dear John C,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.  As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for any inconvenience you encountered during your stay. Please rest assure that we are anxiously waiting for our full hotel remodel coming soon.  We do take precautions and do all the necessary daily cleaning procedures within the hotel.  We are doing everything we can to prevent them and hope that this didn't leave a lasting impression of us.    Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Garden Grove.

Summary Heading: Top Notch Staff and Decent Rooms
Summary: The entire staff is top notch in providing the best customer experience for their guests.  Although I had issues with my AC the staff stepped up and got it addressed quickly  It’s next door to the Hyatt and several good restaurants   Nice pool and patio for relaxing   Rooms are very clean and comfortable
Manager Response: none

Summary: A pleasant surprise to have dinner with beverages on the first 3 days of the week. Twice a month, you can get a taste of a food item found only locally. One time, the hotel added a magician to entertain guests while enjoying the dinner. You will enjoy the food and with always a sweet smile on her face, Lygia, takes the evening  dinner a pleasant and memorable night. She prepares all the food and drinks and always with a happy smile in greeting guests.  Good job! Keep up the good work.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I asked for a quiet room, and got it!  Used the outside shuttle service to get to Disneyland and it was very good.  This location was close enough to Disneyland, with the use of the shuttle, which cost $15.00 for 3 days per person. Free breakfast!!!!  Pool was very nice too.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Booked room through Expedia after watching and watching for a great deal. And up came an offer we couldn't refuse. From the moment of check in when Danny, who I am positive works 24/7, made sure that even though we were very early, that he would make sure that our room was ready when we returned from lunch. All staff was not just great but amazing. Room was always cleaned to perfection and care and attention was always given to the children's room and their stuffies. Breakfast was as expected. Pool always had clean towels. Shuttles were an easy way to get to the parks.  Location was close to all amenities. This was our second time at the property, the first being 10 years ago. Thank you for making our vacation very special.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice clean room with special options
Summary: We were in town for a conference hosted in the hotel next door. Residence Inn Anaheim was clean, family friendly, great breakfast included. We had a two room suite which gave us the space needed for connections and privacy.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Try a different hotel in the area...
Summary: We usually stay at the Residence Inn Maingate during our trips, but were using a combination of Marriott points/cash and that hotel was "sold out".  We decided to give this Residence Inn a try......and I regret that decision.  We stayed for 3 nights.....it took over 1/2 an hour to check in at 7:30pm (and with only 2 people ahead of us).  There was 1 front desk attendant even though there were other staff members that came out occasionally but did not assist.  The parking is an additional $17/night, but the spaces are narrow and limited so best of luck if you have a large vehicle.  The hotel only has 2 elevators, which seemed extremely slow.  Finally got into our room which was dated and below average for a Marriott property.  We had an incident the first evening, as one of our
Manager Response: Dear Ms. Debbie,  Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable feedback. My name is Danny Godoy and I am the Front Office Manager at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort Area/Garden Grove. It has come to my attention that the service you received during your recent stay did not meet your expectations. For this, I sincerely apologize.  The experience you described is not characteristic of the level of service our associates strive to provide. I would love the opportunity to hear more about your recent stay in an effort to prevent this issue from occurring in the future.  Please let me know the best contact number and time to reach you, or feel free to contact me via hone anytime at 714-591-4016. I look forward to speaking with you in order to restore your confidence in the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort Area/Garden Grove.  Sincerely, Danny Godoy Front Office Manager Residence Inn by Marriott Anaheim Resort Area Garden Grove anaheimrifom@ih-corp.com 714-591-4016

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights because my daughter was in a dance competition next door.  There are much nicer hotels available for less all over the area.  We arrived early and our room was not ready, which we expected.  We were told to check back every half hour to see if it was ready (guess they don’t call).  My wife kept checking and at 1:30 it was ready but we would need to pay 20 extra dollars to check in.  We decided to wait just on principle. Guess the room would sit empty for a few more hours while we sat in the lobby and the kids swam!  Some friends arrived around 3 and were given their rooms immediately.  We went to ask and about our room and they said, oops they gave it away.  They said they are tried to contact us (we were in the lobby).  We eventually got in
Manager Response: Dear OneManWolfpack658,  Thank you for sharing your experience at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort Area/Garden Grove through Tripadvisor,  With a mission to provide superior customer service, we take great pride in serving your needs and are concerned about your service you received, and not meeting your expectations when it comes to our check-in process . As a valued guest, your feedback will be shared with the front desk staff to ensure this is an isolated issue moving forward.  Thank you for staying at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort Area/Garden Grove and Thank you for being our guest.

Summary: I really enjoyed my stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim, Garden Grove. Rooms were roomy and clean, staff was very nice, wide selection of coffees and teas on the lobby and you also get a FULL breakfast buffet every morning!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family of 4 stayed here for 4 nights during our trip to Disneyland.  The front desk staff was friendly and attentive.  We got the two room suite with bunk beds which was perfect for the size of our group.  There is Target right across the street to stock the in suite kitchen with some snacks after a long day at Disneyland.  Breakfast got very crowded so go early to avoid long lines (which you will do if you want to get to Disneyland at or before opening anyway).  We did not use the pool.  Laundry room was well equipped with 6 washers and probably 8 dryers.  $2 per load to wash and $2 to dry.  They sell laundry detergent at the front desk for $1 a load.  Loved the coffee and water station right by the door to grab a cup on the way to the parks or a cold water on our way back
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location for Convention Center - 2br/2bath is a nice option!
Summary: We stayed 4 nights here with our two daughters, 16 and 13.  The 2 bedroom/2 bathroom was perfect for us.  Lots of room and the ability to have bunk beds in the second room is a nice option.  The location is an easy walk to the convention center, lots of food options also within walking distance and a Target store across the street make the location ideal.  Breakfast was included with our room and it was pretty decent.  The rooms are old and are in need of an update, but overall, we were happy with our stay and would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Close to Disneyland park,rooms are a nice size. We stayed in a 2 bedroom with full kitchen and loved it. We had 8 people in our party 5 adults and 3 kids & had plenty of room to move around. The breakfast buffet is M-F and it's worth it. Plenty of options to choose from. There is a shuttle service to park for a small fee and it's so convenient, drops you off in front the of park then driving your car and parking getting on a tram to take you to park.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I stayed at this Residence Inn for our most recent trip to Disneyland. It my first time staying here and I will definitely return. The hotel is very nice and clean with a very friendly and attentive staff. We stayed in the two room suite with a king bed, sofa bed and bunk beds. Room had a full kitchen and an excellent complimentary breakfast buffet every morning. My whole family was very pleased with our stay and highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Sandman702,  We appreciate your business and value your honest feedback. Your comments have been shared with the hotel team as a critical way of understanding how we can continue to deliver exceptional service to guests like you.  Thank you for staying at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort Area/Garden Grove and we hope you choose to create more memories with us whenever your travels bring you back to Garden Grove.

Summary Heading: Excellent stay. We will be back!
Summary: Came for a couples vacation to Disneyland and wanting a nice, quiet hotel. We couldn’t be happier. We arrived earlier than planned and our room wasn’t ready but we were headed to the park so we didn’t mind. We were pleasantly surprised to receive an upgraded room and a fun, yummy gift as well. Breakfast was good. Cold Dr Pepper in the vending machine. Easy drive to Disneyland. Target down the street. Lots of restaurants nearby. Only complaint is there were only a couple disabled parking spots and they were always full. We will be back!
Manager Response: Dear Kristine M,  We are delighted to have been your chosen hotel during your recent stay in Garden Grove. It was truly a pleasure to serve you.  We appreciate your business and value your honest feedback.  Our hotel team takes great pride in delivering exceptional service to guests like you.  Thank you for staying at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort Area/Garden Grove and we hope you choose to create more memories with us whenever your travels bring you back to Garden Grove.

Summary Heading: Nice place but could use an update
Summary: Overall the hotel was good, but it could use some updates.  The bathrooms in particular seemed like they haven't been redone for years.  Having said that, it was still a good room as far as functionality.  The beds were very comfortable.  The air conditioning worked well.  We didn't use the kitchen much, but everything seemed to be in order.  The breakfast buffet was pretty good with lots of healthy and not-so-healthy options.  Tap water tasted terrible, but that is probably not the hotel's fault.  We walked to and from Disney the first day there, and then took Uber the second and third days, which worked surprisingly well.  We found drivers quickly both in the morning and late at night, and the cost was $6-$7 each way without a tip.  Note that parking is $17 per day at the
Manager Response: Dear Bob H,  Thank you for being our guest and taking the time to share your experience in regards to your recent stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort Area/Garden Grove.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for the issues you experienced. I have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated experience and that the maintenance issues are corrected moving forward.   We do list our parking information directly on our website as well as any other third party websites. Compared to other competitor hotels, we try to remain reasonably priced at $17 per night versus other properties that charge up to $26 per night.  Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Garden Grove.

Summary: A couple quick hints if attempting Disneyland attendance: If you’re up for a walk, walk to Toy Story parking lot to then get on the free shuttle to Disney.  Or get a Lyft from the hotel to Disney as it cost our party of six $9 each way. Lyft is pet friendly as the kennel as Disneyland is great, clean, and affordable.   Room wasn’t ready upon our afternoon arrival, clerk stated she would call us when a room was ready. Less than 20 minutes later received the call.  Room was clean and the 8th floor was quiet throughout our stay.  Minor inconveniences:  1. A/C wasn’t working properly. Front desk states it wouldn’t be until the next morning for it to be repaired and offered to move us to another room. Received keys to another room on the 8th floor looking North to D-land, BUT it was
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us at the Residence Inn. From reading your review I see that there are opportunities for improvement from the service standpoint as your mentioned concerns should have been communicated with you rather than finding out in unfortunate circumstances. We will be communicating your points with the appropriate team to ensure correction and appreciate your feedback. Thank you for being our guest.

Summary: The first thing you should know: it's 17.50 a night for parking which was pretty poorly advertised and definitely nobody bothered mentioning this the 2 different times we stayed or there's a 100% chance I would habe stayed only once. So if you're thinking to yourself you'll sabe money on Disney Parking, you won't, between this nightly parking rate and the shuttle fee you're actually paying more. Stay somewhere with free parking and pay the 20 bucks at Disney, it's cheaper.   Second, their night auditor Roberto is a complete jerk. We booked a family rate and I'll take responsibility for not having it at check in but we arrived just before midnight. I told them I could have it by morning when my family member woke up (it was past midnight in MST) and were informed we'd have ti be
Manager Response: Thank you for your time and feedback, as was noted, there are always areas for improvement for service and sincerely apologize for any inconveniences faced. Being an associate and/or representative of an associate, we know you are understanding of the policies with Marriott and we must adhere to the rules since we have chosen to work for the great company. As this is not the proper forum for this discussion we again thank you for your feedback and wish you enjoyable future travels.

Summary Heading: Hotel ok, customer service when an issue arose horrible
Summary: I stayed here for 4 days. It was ok not high quality but decent. I accidentally left my work laptop in the closet at departure.  I get the hotel to agree to ship it back to me and send the UPS label over. When I receive the laptop it is severely damaged screen cracked frame bent. The hotel just placed the laptop with sleeve in a box taped it up and wrote fragile on it. I purchased insurance however of course since it was not packaged correctly it was not covered. This was end of March, now it is mid May and I am still trying to remedy. I have attempted contact with the assistant manager who pretty much has been ignoring my emails and contacts. I travel heavily staying at marriotts several times a month. I have never received such poor customer service. I had to escalate to
Manager Response: Dear Jessica,  Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. I am very sorry to hear that your lost and found item was damaged en route to you. May I ask who you have been trying to contact at the hotel? Please feel free to contact me directly so that we may work to resolve this issue.  Best Regards,  Frank C. Front Office Manager

Summary: Stayed for 11 days so had a chance to really get to know the place. Hotel is in serious need of an overhaul. The 2 bedroom room they put us in (Room 820), had a serious black mold problem in one of the bathrooms - so bad you could smell it in the room with the door closed. When we complained, they offered to spray deodorant -- when we refused that, they were quite nice and put us in a much better room that looked like it had been renovated. So that was good. But if you have a room along Harbor Blvd, the windows are paper thin and you can expect lots of noise. I had asked for a room to watch the fireworks which would have had to be one on the north side -- they acted like they were giving that to me but we ended up along Harbor. I didn't push it because our daughter couldn't take
Manager Response: Dear Airfotog,   Thank you for being our guest and taking the time to complete the Guest Satisfaction Survey in regards to your recent stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort Area/Garden Grove.    As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for the issues you experienced. I have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated experience and that the maintenance on the bath tubs is being corrected moving forward.    Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Garden Grove.

Summary Heading: Great value but fold out couch not comfortable
Summary: We had a party of 2 adults and 4 children.  We rented a one bedroom suite with 2 queen beds and 1 fold out couch.    Room: We appreciated having a full kitchen, even though we primarily used the refrigerator and sink, and didn't cook any meals.  It really helped to store drinks/snacks for Disneyland and have supplies when we ordered dinner.  Room was clean and comfortable.  However, the kids complained that the fold out bed was not comfortable.  If I book this hotel in the future, I would definitely opt for another real bed.  Service: Staff was very friendy, although housekeeping was understaffed the whole time that we were there.  I would have thought that the hotel knows far in advance if they are full and would staff accordingly.  Our room was not ready at check in time.
Manager Response: Dear Cecilia,  Thank you for leaving a review of your stay with us. Feedback from reviews such as yours assist us greatly in improving our operations. Thank you again and we hope to serve you the next time your travels bring you to the area!

Summary: Great Hotel! We only stayed for one night but the service was excellent. At check in they asked me if we were here for Disneyland and I said "yes, we are celebrating my son's 3rd birthday". Well the following morning my son was surprised at breakfast with the staff singing him happy birthday, balloons and a custom gift bag with snacks.  It was really sweet of them to do that for him and it made his day that much more special.
Manager Response: Hello Liz Z,  Thank you for sharing your feedback in regards to your stay! I am glad we were able to create everlasting moments for you and your family.  Our hotel team takes pride in putting people first, we are not only executing the mission of our founders, but exceeding the expectations of our valued guests.   We would love to have you back to celebrate his 4th birthday with us as well.  Thank you for being our guest and staying with us at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort Area/Garden Grove.

Summary Heading: Great place with lots of amenities for Disneyland-bound families
Summary: We stayed for 4 nights as a family of 6. I researched it thoroughly before booking and wasn't disappointed. Specifically, the full kitchen and separate lounge/bedroom was perfect. The kitchen has a dishwasher, cooker, microwave, toaster, pots, pans and cutlery. I would have loved a few more condiments. There is a Target across the street which was brilliant. Breakfast is plentiful and although I'm not a fan of American breakfasts the choice was great and the kids room has a mini-cinema area. The pool and outdoor jacuzzi was a lovely addition (and nice after a day tramping around Disneyland), and I deeply appreciated the laundry facilities ($4 to wash and dry plus $1 for soap, which seemed a bit mercenary), despite all but ONE of the washing machines being broken. Parking on site
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary: Second time staying here for WonderCon.  Due to a considerable airline delay with getting into LAX airport, arrived after the 4 PM check-in time, which went smooth and swift.  In comparison to my stay a year ago, the room could still be described as "a little worn around the edges" in certain spots, but was in much better condition, especially the shower / toilet area.  Sadly, like last year, the drain lever on the sink was jammed, and would not fully close or open even with some effort.  The king-size bed was comfortable as usual, and perhaps due to being on 8th floor of the hotel, there was minimal noise in the hallway at night due to families returning from the Disney Parks(though the car and emergency vehicle noise from the street was noticeably louder).  Tried the free
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary: It is a great hotel for families. Hot breakfast had lots of choices. Swimming pool was enjoyed by my kids. Front desk staff were very helpful. Target is within walking distance. Transportation is great. We took the bus to Disneyland instead of shuttle. Bus stops are conveniently located. Highly recommended.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary Heading: Comfortable, spacious and well appointed room
Summary: I could not get into the hotel I usually stay at in Anaheim and luckily I got a room at the new Residence Inn.  It is close to the convention center, the rooms are spacious, the beds are comfortable and the free breakfast are much better than the usual free hotel fare. The well appointed suites include a kitchen (with a refrigerator, dish washer, stove, etc), a sitting room, a bedroom and a large bathroom.  All in all the hotel was very comfortable, the staff was friendly and helpful and I would be happy to stay here again.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary: Overall this hotel was great! Location is good with a shuttle system to Disneyland (you have to pay like ART), lots of eating places within walking distance. You get a free FULL breakfast every morning and if you can/want to take advantage, free, select, food options at different days of the week. There is ALWAYS coffee, hot water (for the free hot chocolate or tea) and iced water for you conveniently in the lobby. Always friendly staff who are very helpful. I, personally, had no complaints and would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary: Just stayed at this hotel and staff was extremely helpful, especially Hayley at the front desk. Breakfast was good and our room was clean. Definitely would stay here again. Probably a 20 minute walk to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Cindy,  Thank you so much for the review! We're pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay and look forward to serving you the next time your travels bring you to Disneyland.

Summary: We stayed a week in a top floor two bedroom corner suite last October. Rooms are clean but very dated. Great employees, especially the front desk crew. The pool was great but in the shade most of the day.  The bigggest disappointment was the buffet breakfast - in one word terrible! Staff there never kept on top of replenishing the food , coffee and other drinks. We would look and try to find someone to ask and they always seemed to be conveniently out of view in the back kitchen. Other  guests were just a frustrated and it wasn’t super busy. we needed up going out for breakfast. We don’t expect anything fancy but just to at least have eggs and coffee out! This has been only hotel we have had disspoingting breakfast service. Housekeeping was great !
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Comfortable stay with very good house keeping
Summary: We stayed at Residence In for 3 days during our Disney trip. We needed a stay with kitchen due to my picky daughter and this one proved to be one of the best facilities we could get. We booked a king bed suite with sofa bed but when we checked in we were offered 2 queen beds. But we insisted on getting one with a king bed if available and the staff immediately upgraded us to a 2 room suite with bunk beds at no additional cost. Excellent customer service there. The house keeping is worth the mention. We left the messiest kitchen possible and we came back after a tired day, all was clean, dishes done and water bottles refilled. On spot for all the three days. Pros: 1. Comfortable extended stay with excellent breakfast. Free wifi which is good. Could make video calls as well with
Manager Response: none

Summary: Since this hotel is basically a Disney property, it caters to families with children.  For those of us on business - specifically going to a trade show at the convention center - this is NOT a hotel for us.  It is a very old property.  The rooms needs a lot of updating.  The bathrooms are dirty, the carpet is old, wallpaper is falling down and the furnishings are well overdue for replacement.  Bathrooms are...well...look at my pictures...ick.  Windows have never been cleaned.  WiFi is mediocre.  The business center does not have computers or printers that work (it is mostly occupied by kids playing games online.)  The food is...gross.  The "social hour" was chili dogs with water or water downed lemonade.  Seriously?  The breakfast room was a mob scene - which is OK - but there
Manager Response: We thank you for your time in reviewing our property, we always appreciate any feedback as we continuously strive to better ourselves to be the best we can. This time around looks as if your stay fell short of expectations with the points you brought up. I am glad you felt the staff was great, but saddened about the challenges as we will share your input with our management team to be able to make your experience an isolated occurance. Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we hope you are able to find the right property to satisfy your needs.

Summary: Our family of 5 with three small children enjoyed this hotel very much for our recent Disneyland vacation. The rooms were clean. It was odd that pots and pans were kept in the oven so I had to remove those prior to using. The breakfast was easy and nice. Some mornings were busier than others. Our rooms were always cleaned up. The only complaint I have is too many TVs. There were 3 huge flatscreen TVs in our room. Three! That was an issue as the reason we went on vacation was to escape all media. I had to keep turning them off when my 3 small kids would turn them on again. Even the extra kids room with a bunkbed had a huge flatscreen TV in front of it. I was speechless. Are there parents that do this at home? Wow. One TV is plenty! If we come again can we request that all of the
Manager Response: Thank you for your time in reviewing our property, we are glad you had an enjoyable stay. We look forward to hosting your family once again.

Summary: We did it! The obligatory family trip to Disneyland. Honestly, I would rather be at the beach. But THIS HOTEL made it magic!! Incredible room, service, pool, ping pong table, basketball court, and the breakfast is AMAZING! I had to feed 6 hungry boys and this place did the trick! They also had barbeques and pizza nights, all complimentary!! It was seriously so amazing. It was close to Newport Beach, and had a Disney shuttle, and right across the street from a Target. They were so amazing. We didn't even leave the hotel for one whole day!! Thank you Residence Inn!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for being our guest, we are glad you had an enjoyable stay, we look forward to being able to host you once again.

Summary: On a recent trip to Disneyland my family and I stayed at this hotel. Great location,  easy access to Disneyland, and very comfortable beds. The free breakfast was outstanding. Lots to choose from. The scrambled eggs actually stayed hot until you got to your table to eat them. Great, and very unusual for a buffet. We stayed several days and was pleased that the meat choice varied day to day. Several self serve waffle makers  we on hand, including at least one that made mini waffles. Nice touch  for the little ones. Fresh fruit and oatmeal with a variety of toppings round out the choices. The large rooftop pool/ hot tub area was nice. Reasonable rates. The suite handled 5 of us very comfortably. Having the two bathrooms was great. Only problem was I wish the water pressure was a
Manager Response: none

Summary: Last July we stayed here while visiting Disneyland and absolutely loved it. They get that you are looking forward to a fantastic relaxing vacation. Again they made us a welcome box with a personal note. This time we rented the 2 bedroom suite and met our son and his family from Portland. We enjoyed bedroom 1 with a king while they they had 2 queens and their own bathroom. The living area was big enough to sit, eat and visit. Our last desk manager was Alex Lucero he is gone but has trained Maria a very sweet and very helpful manager. She made us a welcome box including Disney luggage tags. Such a special way to keep us coming back on each visit to Anaheim. Clean, beautiful rooms close to everything! Thank you Maria and all the staff for another great vacation.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Pros: good breakfast, nice pool and hottub, very quiet room, easy drive to Disneyland, room was large and very comfortable   Cons: too far to walk to Disneyland, in 7 nights twice our room was not cleaned, parking was difficult to find a spot  We were given no reason for the lack of cleaning. Maybe $5 tip is not enough?! We were told parking was included, it is not; $15/day. Close to amenities, but all hotels in this area are.   Nothing wrong with hotel but will chose a different hotel next time. Walking distance would offset all the parking at the hotel and Disneyland; combined was $35/day. Plus fuel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel has a lot to offer.  The suites have everything a family needs.  A full kitchen, breakfast, and outdoor amenities.  The laundry facilities are great, as well.  We enjoyed our stay and Lauren who checked us in was so respectful and pleasant.  It was such a nice way to start our trip.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Another wonderful stay at the Garden Grove Residence Inn. The staff is so welcoming and the hotel itself is in such a great location. Within walking distance to Target which makes it easy for snacks for Disneyland. This is our go to hotel when visiting Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review and thank you for being our guest.

Summary: LOVE the setup of bunk room + kids bath and separate master bed + master bath.  Rooms are separated and sound doesn't really carry.    Service was very good.  Kitchenette was adequate -- we had to request a second pot (only 1 skillet was provided, and the second never showed up), but it was fine.  Rooms show heavy use, but are very clean and well organized.  Air system in master was a little noisy.  Free breakfast-- gets busy.  Prepare for a line up and typical buffet breakfast food.  Serves kids well.    Uber/Lyft to park gates was between $5-10 one way, depending on the size of the ride.
Manager Response: Thank you for your time in reviewing us, I am glad you found value during your time with us. We look forward to hosting you again.

Summary Heading: A Fantastic Stay in Garden Grove @ Residence Inn/Anaheim Resort Area Garden Grove CA
Summary: I am the member named Keith from Calgary and myself and my family have stayed at the resort since it opened.  They never cease to amaze me with their friendliness and we are always treated like family with fantastic service.  My suite was impeccably clean and literally spotless when I arrived on December 2, 2017 and the cleaning staff were incredible as when I returned to my suite each evening it looked "brand new" and was literally spotlessly clean!  I would like to thank and directly compliment the following staff members: Mr. Walter Maldonado, Katrina, Mr. Bill Evans, and Lourdes... Each of these staff members greeted me by name (and I had not been to the resort for 11.5 months!) and treated me royally during my 8 day stay... I cannot thank them and of course the other staff
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we are always glad to have you come back and visit. I am glad again to hear once again you had a positive stay. We for sure look forward to seeing you once again.

Summary: We stayed here on a recent stopover to Disneyland. The rooms were very spacious, great amenities (full kitchen, coffee, tea, paul mitchell soaps and shampoos), a little disappointed about the $3.50 water bottles in the room - that just seems so petty. The bathrooms needed to be cleaned more thoroughly but the breakfast seriously made up for it all. We had a party of 8 and all could find something to eat, from the health conscious to the junk foodies - everyone was happy. Parking is $15 - another nickel and dime type of charge, but taking our coffees and hot chocolate on the road from the breakfast seemed to put that out of our minds.
Manager Response: Thank you for your time in reviewing our property. We look forward to having you visit once again.

Summary Heading: Our family had a great stay!
Summary: We stayed at this property for 3 nights and had a great experience from beginning to end. Check-in was fast and the person who helped us was wonderful. She gave us transportation and parking suggestions for Disneyland. Unless you're the kind of person who never tires of walking, this hotel would be too far to walk from Disneyland, but the Toy Story lot is just down the street and there is a shuttle that stops right outside the hotel. There were 8 of us and we all fit in a van, so it was more economical for us to park at the Toy Story lot than to ride the shuttle. We had a room with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. This was a great set up for us since we were traveling with my parents. They had their own bed and bath with a king sized bed, and my family had a bedroom with 2 queen beds
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your time in reviewing us I am glad you had a convenient and enjoyable stay with us. Your feedback is greatly appreciated and I hope to see you visit once again.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: The front desk people were very helpful in advising us for transportation to DIsneyland. The rooms were nice. The breakfast was fantastic.They really keep the the breakfast area clean and the food is quickly replenished. I was here with my wife, but this is also a great hotel for the whole family.
Manager Response: Thank you for your time and feedback, we look forward to you visiting us again.

Summary: The service was good as well as the breakfast the hotel is fun because they have a basketball court and a ping pong table with an arcade to play games and it is really fun for the kids you should pick this hotel it’s the best deal and really a touristic spot and it’s close to everything like a food markets and restaurants.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your feedback and are glad you were able to find value in your time with us. Thank you for being our guest.

Summary Heading: Excellent choice for a medical visit
Summary: I stayed here for almost 3 weeks before and after having surgery at UC Irvine Medical Center. My surgeon wanted me to stay near the hospital in case of complications, and this hotel is less than 2 miles down the road. The staff were excellent and accommodating - I received a reduced medical rate, and they let me request my room location to minimize noise (top floor in a corner). The room setup was also great for recovery - I had a separate bedroom so could rest while my husband was out in the main area, and the almost full kitchen (we had no oven, but the stove/microwave/dishwasher/fullsize fridge were great) meant that we could cook our own meals without having to eat out constantly. The full breakfast at the hotel was also appreciated. Overall we had a great stay (and a smooth
Manager Response: Thank you for being for sharing your experience, and hope your recovery continues successfully. Thank you for being our guest.

Summary: It seems that the chain books you in one hotel then puts you in one of the others. Then trys to put you in what ever room they decide on.Hmmmmmm? The hotel was great they are convinced they ar 10 minutes walk from Disney land, not in this lifetime. Need transport to and from each.Not expected or the cost.  The good part the hotel is clean and staff are great.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your reviewing our property. As this is not the proper forum to address some of the issues faced, I am glad we were able to make your stay enjoyable as we strive to make everybody's stay the best possible. Thank you for being our guest.

Summary Heading: Perfect Hotel for our Disneyland Visit
Summary: We found Residence Inn at Garden Grove to be well situated for our visit to Disneyland. The suite was clean, comfortable and well appointed. A generous breakfast was included in the price. Also on three late afternoons midweek, snacks were provided in the dining room . There were around 3 restaurants within easy walking distance.  A shuttle bus runs and returns regularly for Disneyland from the hotel for a reasonable fare. The staff were all friendly and helpful, especially Marie at Reception.We would be happy to return there.
Manager Response: Thank you very much in reviewing our property. I am glad our facilities and proximity to other locations mad your stay a convenient one. We will be passing on your information to Marie to ensure her recognition. Thank you for being our guest.

Summary Heading: Our favorite hotel when we visit Disneyland
Summary: We love this hotel! Lots of room options and even king suites with 2 rooms and 2 bathrooms plus a large living room with a full kitchen. Great size for our large family and even grandma to sleep comfortably. The pool area is great with a BBQ and a few lawn games. They serve a Full breakfast every morning with a room for kids to eat while watching Disney channel. Great customer service and very clean rooms. A shuttle takes you to Disney every half hour. Can't wait to stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your time in reviewing us, I am glad you had an enjoyable stay and we look forward to having you once again with us.

Summary: The customer service we received from Gemma, was outstanding! She went out of her way to make our stay enjoyable! Our rooms were clean and functional (the kitchenettes were nice) and our location was close to Disney, just a little far to walk. The free breakfast was good and plentiful.
Manager Response: Thank you for your time in reviewing us, I am glad you had a positive experience with us and your comments will be shared with Gemma and the team.

Summary: Enjoyable stay. Compact but plenty of room for 6 people, we had 2 room queen suite, beds comfy, sofa sleeper adequate. Kitchenette was useful. Nice grounds, w/activities, good pool. Free Breakfast was really good; many healthy choices, and was plentiful, lots of people but it’s to be expected; just be patient & wait your turn. Paid shuttle to DL - do it! The walk is too far; even from Toy Story free shuttle lot, believe me!! All in all this was a great stay. Kudos to staff.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Loved It SO Much We Extended
Summary: Staying here made this one of our greatest trips to Disneyland ever!  We found that it is hard to find hotels we enjoy as so many in Anaheim are older and musty.  We are thrilled to have found a place that we all loved. We stayed in the family suite so the kids had their own room and bath with bunkbeds and we had a king room with private bath.  The pool and hot tubs were clean and the breakfast was wonderful.  They even have an outdoor BBQ one of the nights so we were treated to a feast by the pool and saved on dinner in a big way.  Having a kitchen was also a bonus for saving on dinners and preparing lunches/snacks for our Disney days. The only downside to our stay was the elevator situation--and it was a really big inconvenience. Especially during breakfast hours, the crowd
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I needed a basic room for two adults and three kids, close to Disney World. This hotel is basic and even a little outdated but the staff are friendly and helpful. The included brunch is ok- we loved the fresh waffles. Drawbacks- they ran out of food at the buffet a few times and it took a while to refill, the shuttle takes a while to get to Disney. Pluses- the rooms were spacious and provided everything we needed for our family trip.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent customer service and great stay
Summary: Chris, the Manager and Hayley the front office supervisor showed excellent customer service skills.  I had 2 rooms, one for my brother and  one for myself.  We stayed 2 nights and the 2 of these folks made our stay delightful.  If Hayley lived in St Louis, I would hire her in a minute-she is exceptional.  Chris was also very accommodating and gracious.  Would definitely stay again.  Coleen Stoutenburg
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the two bedroom residence, hotel amenities are abundant including a nice breakfast and all day coffee and spa water at the lobby. The pool is heated and enjoyed by the kids. The room are clean and staff are courteous. They have a shuttle outside that will take you to the gates of Disneyland. Walking distance to groceries and shops.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have been accused of being hotel snobs - probably pickier than average traveling family....and we loved this experience. The hotel is a bit old and needs some TLC after the constant beatings from wild kids, but it's super clean and there was a lot to like: (1) staff was so nice and spoiled the kids; they sent up a welcome gift to my kids with a personalized message and drawing about the star wars characters they talked about! (2) kids felt like they were in heaven with the pools and other activities like basketball and ping pong (3) breakfast and weekday evening food (yes they cooked guests food almost every night) was really good, way above average (4) shuttle to Disney was super easy and right out hotel doors (5) bunk bed suite was perfect size and kids loved it (6) superb
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nothing but rave reviews about this hotel! We only go a couple times a year to this property, but every time we go, Hayley is just simply the sweetest and most caring person at the front desk!  She makes us feel so welcome and special everytime we show up, plus makes our daughter feel like a princess getting ready to visit Disneyland!. The rooms are immaculate, breakfast is great, staff is always so kind. Thank you so much Hayley, for upgrading our room, for a comfortable night sleep, care package, and all the detailed welcoming and warmth you exude towards our family! Because of a sweetheart like her working for this Residence Inn, it makes us want return again and again! Our family wants Marriott to know how lucky they are to have an individual like Hayley, working for them,
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for 5 nights in a 2 bed 2 bath suite. Spacious for all ( 2nd bedroom has no windows though so was a bit dark) Anyway was good to have the option of a kitchen so we could prepare our own stuff every now and then. Grocery shops nearby if required and restaurants too. The usual 'Marriott breakfast', a few things did ran out very quickly some mornings,perhaps a variety once in a while in the food choices available. If visiting the Disney parks, the proximity to the parks is close, and a shuttle bus stops right outside the hotel. You can purchase tickets for the shuttle and Disney if required at the hotel. My son turned 9 whilst there and the hotel sent him a 'goody box', balloons and a voucher for the gift shop ( Thank you!) Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place for a family to stay
Summary: I had nothing but great things to say about this place. The staff was amazing. They made us feel special. We got a suite with a kitchen which was great because we didn't want to drag our kids to restaurants after spending the day at Disneyland. The maid service was fantastic. Also each night they  did something different like one night was smores, the next a bbq, all which was complimentary. If you are planning on going to Disneyland purchase a shuttle pass because the shuttle stops right at the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: So I stayed  there  over  the  weekend  because  I have  allergies  I called  A head of  time and asked  if  they can  pre  block  the  room  to  have  the  carpet  clean  the  person I talk  to said  sure  No  Worries  i also told him   I will  be arriving early  he  said  no  worries  we will take good care of you.  upon  arrival the  front desk  agent  said  your room is ready  but we have to shampoo . I asked  why wasnt  this  done  she  said i do apologize  this was  our  fault  but your  room  will  be  ready  soon.  well four to five hours  later the room was ready . I talked  to the  front  desk  manager  he  stated  they were  sold out the night before he lied right to my face  they were not  sold out  he even seen i called  so  I dont  know  why  he  would  lie  in my
Manager Response: Thank you for being our guest and for sharing your concerns. I am sorry to hear you experienced issues while with us. We work diligently to ensure guests have the best experience possible and work hard to fulfill guest requests, even those that may leave carpets damp upon their arrival. I want to assure you I have looked thoroughly into your concerns and I would have been happy to discuss these issues prior to your departing the hotel, however, I do not believe this is the forum to currently discuss the concerns you noted above.

Summary Heading: Awesome Place to stay to relax.
Summary: Our family booked a 2 bedroom 2 bath suite in July. Upon check in they were so friendly and made it easy for a tired traveler. I kinda worried that because I booked through Expedia I would not quite get the same service as if i had booked straight with them I was SO wrong. I inquired about food near by and received coupons for a  nice pizza place near by which was good. They also gave us  gourmet cookies! Our room had a king size bed and the other a bunk bed. Everything was clean and fresh. Our smoke detector started to chirp and within 5 minutes of making the front desk aware of it Leno was there to fix it. Later that night Alex sent us a box of goodies for our day at Disneyland. It was filled with Adult and kid snacks, it was perfect and VERY thoughtful. The breakfast was
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your informative feedback. I will pass on your information to Alex and Lino. I am glad we were able to share in you experiences and look forward to seeing you again. Thank you for being our guest.

Summary: This place is real disappointment. We were to check in at 4:00pm and at 4:05 they are saying they don't have a room available yet cause they haven't been cleaned.  We got our room and discovered it still has popcorn ceiling and such uncomfortable couch and beds.  Everything is so dated in this hotel and needs a remodel. Not worth the $310 I paid for one night! The toilet was running so we called maintenance and they never showed up.  The toilet became plugged up at 11:30pm and they send security up with a plunger. We open the door and security hands us the plunger and says that's not my job.  We tell him we and not gonna do it and then he comes in unhappy that he has to be the one to do it.  They don't have enough parking in their lot even though they charge you $15 per car per
Manager Response: Thank you for being our guest and for sharing your review with us. I am sorry to hear you had a difficult time with us and I will assure you I will look into the matter. I appreciate your feedback and hope that we may have an opportunity to better serve you on a future trip to the Disneyland area.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for families on vacation
Summary: This hotel was an excellent place to visit with a big family.  The breakfast was excellent.  Everyone was very happy with the room and the swimming pool.  The staff was excellent and helped us out many times.  It's very close to Disneyland - the main reason we were here, but also had lots of parking and was centrally located to Newport Beach and lots of good restaurants!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good location, comfy bed, quiet rooms but .........................
Summary: Unfortunately our stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim was marred by the fact that the hotel charged us twice for Disneyland tickets that we purchased at reception and it took a whole week for them to refund the money ($597) back to us. If they'd done things properly their end in the first place we should have received our money back within 2 hours of them notifying the bank of their mistake. Instead it came to the day of check out with the issue still not being resolved and I had to make phone calls & send emails from Australia to ensure we got our money back. The most disappointing thing is when I personally spoke to the general manager there was not one word of apology!  On a good note the king bed was very comfortable as were the pillows. The sofa bed is ok for a kid but would
Manager Response: Thank you for being our guest. I am very sorry to hear there was an issue with the billing of park tickets, but I will certainly look into the matter to better understand where the error occurred and how it was handled to ensure, to your point, that this is an isolated experience. I appreciate your feedback on your stay and on the handling of this issue and sincerely hope that we may be given the opportunity to better serve you and regain your trust in us on a future trip to our hotel. Thank you again for being our guest.

Summary: We recently stayed at the Residence Inn By Marriott Anaheim Resort Area, Garden Grove.  It was an excellent choice for our family of five plus one friend.  Ours kids are ages 8, 12, and 16.  My 16 yr old son also had a friend join us for the trip.    Room: The room booked was a two bedroom suite with two bathrooms and full kitchen.  The master had a king bed.  The second bedroom had 2 queens. The living room had a sofa bed. The sofa was a sectional with an additional long seating area which my youngest daughter slept on.   Hotel: The hotel has a pool, kiddie pool, hot tub and basketball court.  Food: The hotel offers a buffet breakfast every morning.  Weeknights they also have offerings.  Tuesday was free appies, Wednesday was BBQ night with a complimentary burger or hotdog,
Manager Response: Thank you very much for sharing your experience, and I hope you enjoyed your dole whip.

Summary: I stayed in a 2 Bedroom/2 bath unit with my handicapped adult daughter, her Personal Care Attendant and my teenage daughter.  This hotel gets a lot of traffic due to the proximity to Disneyland, which is about 1.5 mi away or a 30 minute walk straight down the street according to Google maps (althougth some guides will say it is less than a mile, which is not correct).  The upkeep is somewhat average, as housekeeping and maintenance does seem to have difficulty keeping up, but it's okay and they will respond promptly if you let them know about an issue.  Having a full fridge and freezer and stove is nice, and there is a Walmart with groceries close by.  The breakfast buffet is the best I have seen at any hotel, including the Marriot chain that I have stayed in frequently.  Food
Manager Response: Karen O, thank you for your feedback and I am we were able to help you enjoy your stay with us. Have a great day.

Summary: This is the second time in two years our family has stayed at this hotel. Our daughter has a national dance competition next door at the Hyatt. The Residence Inn is a great offsite location, you are located just steps from the Hyatt. You are within walking distance to Disney (2 miles). The shuttle or the city bus is also very affordable. The rooms have kitchens which is a huge money saver. The hotel also provides breakfast. We figure our family of four saves $120 a day by staying here. The pool is clean. Rooms are clean. Hotel staff is very accommodating. Like all hotels we found a few problems with the room, but we talked to the staff and the were repaired within a couple hours.
Manager Response: Michael C, thank you for the feedback, we hope everything went great at the dance competition and we look forward to seeing you in next years as well.

Summary: Staff was friendly, we enjoyed the pool and free hot breakfast. Hotel is pet friendly, has a gym, kids movie room and business center. In walking distance to shopping plaza, taco, pizza, variety of food choices and on main street for public transit system.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this hotel with 2 adults, 2 teenagers (17) and one 10 year old. We booked the two bedroom one bathroom suite, and to my surprise they gave us a two bedroom and two bathroom when we arrived! The rooms were very spacious, I loved the bunk beds! The beds were very comfortable, and the bathrooms were perfect in size. It was very quiet at night, which was appreciated. We took advantage of the hosted BBQ and had great burgers and hot dogs by the pool. That was AWESOME! The staff was incredibly nice, and very accommodating to our every need. The shuttle stop was right around the corner, so very close. I have zero complaints about this hotel, and we will stay there again when we return!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Where do I begin. When we checked into our room, I found pubic hair and a booger on the bathroom wall after the maid had just "cleaned" the room. The table tops were extremely dusty after we explained to the front desk that we needed a clean room as one of the guests had a compromised immune system. We then moved to a new room which wasn't much better. The phone and remote control for the tv did not work. Then there's the issue of the parking or lack thereof is more like it.  Don't make the mistake of getting back late as you will find yourself driving around aimlessly looking for a spot. Not fun.   I saved the best for last. As my daughters and I were leaving the gym and walking down the hall, we heard a loud noise that sounded like an explosion.  When I looked to the left, I
Manager Response: Thank you for your time in reviewing our property. You have brought up some concerns from your stay that are out of the norm. We have passed on your information to the appropriate team members and made sure that the proper steps were taken. I apologize for any shortcomings and thank you for being our guest.

Summary: Excellent stay in a two bed two bath suite.  Clean and very comfortable rooms.  Manager was super helpful with area and resort information that saved us money and time.  Only complaint is the free wifi that is so slow we just didn't use it.  Had the same wifi experience at 2 other Marriott properties in Ohio and Arizona during the last month, so seems like they want you to pay the $5 per day upgrade fee.  Regardless, we will definitely stay here again for our future trips to Disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: It is a hotel that most taxi drivers and uber driver don't know its whereabouts
Summary: We stayed this May.The only reason why we book this hotel was the brand "Marriott attached to it. There are plenty of hotels with the brand "Marriott attached around the vicinity. Taxi driver got confused.  We arrived early before noon for check-in but were told to wait. We went away for shopping in the meantime and asked to be called  once our room is ready but they don't bother to call. I am quite sure there are rooms available, it is just they don't want to let you check-in earlier.   It is more like a service apartment style with kitchen. Bath room amenities were disappointing. Soap bar is given for bath- goodness! Towels smell of chlorine which I am not sure if it more hygienic to be this way.  Breakfast was less than satisfactory. The coffee is the most blend and diluted
Manager Response: sawlee-  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about our hotel. I am sorry to hear that it was an adventure getting here, there are a lot of hotels in the area and the driver must have mixed up our hotel with one of the other Marriott hotels in the area. I am also sorry to hear that we failed to meet your expectations. We try our very best to check in guests as early as possible, however we can not always get people in as early as they'd like. We should have called you as we promised when a room was ready and I will be following up with my team to make sure we deliver on what we promise. I am also very sorry to hear that our breakfast and bath amenities were a disappointment to you.  If you are in the area again, please call me ahead of time, I will personally take care of you and prove that your experience was not the norm here. Our guests are very important to us and I am terribly sorry your stay was less than perfect.  Chris D General Manager

Summary: Stayed for 4 nights with a group at the Residence Inn - again!!! My 6th stay there and the staff, the amenities and the overall experience was great. Wilma, the sales director took great care of our group and the front desk staff could not have been nicer and easier to work with. Yes, many would say the hotel perhaps needs a few updates, but for the money and to feel well taken care of, this is the place for families to stay when going to The House of Mouse and area. We utilized the pool area and the shuttle pick up right outside the hotel is a blessing. The breakfast buffet was always well stocked and the snack times in the evening were an added bonus. Will always stay here when I do my Disney trips with family and friends. Also, the free access to secure our boarding passes in
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel, great room and pool, will stay here again
Summary: Had room with a view on 8th floor toward California Adventure.  Great view of fire works! worth spending money for an upgrade to see fireworks.  Breakfast was surprisingly good.  The eggs were real and fresh, not from powder.  Breakfast was a pleasant surprise.  Bunk beds are also a great concept.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I simply cannot say enough how wonderful this property is and how much we enjoyed staying there.  We started as a party of three, but as soon as we arrived one member of our party got herself upset for reasons we could not comprehend.  The hotel staff did everything in their power to get her settled, but the more we all tried to settle her down the worse things got.  She eventually left the hotel leaving just the two of us for a memorable vacation.  Even after all the fracas she caused the staff treated us like welcomed guests.  I had several conversations with the manager, Walter, and could tell he was a man of great character and that showed in the way he treated his staff and guests.  Whenever we walked into the hotel we were always greeted kindly with a warm smile.  The
Manager Response: none

Summary: Lourdes (around for breakfast) and Luis (around for dinner) have both been fantastic!  I've been staying here since October and really appreciated the friendly service of employees. Though there is a gym it is a little small they do have a gym and free weights.  The hot breakfast, snacks/food in the evenings 3-4 times a week has been fantastic in the evenings.  Really appreciate the full size kitchen, tables, couch, and overall amenities in the room.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed April 9 thru 12 2017.  The hotel is beginning to show its age.  The one (1) bedroom suite was nice, but had a few "quirks".  Sloppy caulking around the stove top and in the bathroom distract from the overall experience.  No cups/glasses in the bathroom.  Someone had decided that it would be a good idea to place the thermostat behind the TV, making it nearly impossible to regulate the rooms temperature because of the heat that the TV is emitting.  In the bathroom sink area one of the shelves was loose and falling off.  The hallway smelled of mildew, or something else, I am not an expert.  Breakfast was cold.  Cold scrambled eggs are not very good.  It took 4 passes thru the toaster to get the bread toasted.  The best Residence Inn breakfast I have had is the Fort Smith
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your feedback, I am sorry to hear you had a less than pleasant stay with us.  I will ensure your feedback is delivered to the appropriate departments as we do our best to ensure concerns are corrected. Once again thank you for your feedback and thank you for being our guest.

Summary: We had the 2 bedroom 2 bathroom suite for our family vacation.  The hotel was nice. The breakfast seating area was HUGE.  The serving room was quite large.  The breakfast had hot options (eggs, sausage,) as well as "make your own" waffles, and every other bread product you could want.  Fresh fruit, a bar with either yogurt parfaits, or fruit and cheese every day.   Coffee, juice, milk, and soda, also cold cereal.   The rooms were a good size. The queen beds were really comfortable. The sofa bed matress however, was so bad that the kids just slept on the sofa with a sheet on it.  The furniture in the room was a little worn, but was useable.  The room was clean and quiet. There were alot of families with small children, but we were never heard them.  The kitchen was great, but we
Manager Response: none

Summary: Was really looking forward to a couple days at Disneyland with my family. We wanted to take our time at Disney and Cali Adventure, with lots of pool time in between. Much to our dismay, the pool was closed (no indication when I booked), outdated room, and complete mayhem at the buffet breakfast.   This hotel is also a ways down Harbor from the Disney entrance, so the shuttle is a must. Only comes and goes every 30 minutes-and is usually packed because it stops at 3 hotels along the way (incl the Residence Inn).  I would recommend staying closed to the Disney entrance in the Portofino, Springhill Marriot or if you can splurge, just stay at one of the actual Disney resorts. Much better customer service, no fussing with shuttles/transportation, pool time would be simpler to have
Manager Response: Dear Sionesteward,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review about our hotel. I am so sorry that your stay fell short of your expectations. We are very sorry that the pool had to be closed during your stay, this is not something we ever want to do. We had some issues with our filtration system and we could not keep the water at safe levels for our guests. Safety and the well being of our guests is of the highest priority for us and we did not want to risk anyone getting sick or burned with too much chlorine. The parts for the system took a few days to get to us causing us to keep the pool closed for longer than we'd like. We have fixed the pool and it is running properly now and I am really sorry that it wasn't fixed during your stay. If you are planning on coming back to the area please reach out to me and I will personally ensure you are well taken care of.  Chris D  General Manager

Summary: First time staying with this hotel, since my usual choice for Wondercon are the Anaheim Convention Center ones.  Arrived around Noon, so no room was available yet, but Maria at the front desk got everything ready for when I returned at 4 PM for check-in.  Later, Alex got me checked in, and I was amazed at how much room there was, including the kitchenette (only used the refrigerator, stocked from the nearby Target Store).    Room was definitely comfortable for both sleeping and just lounging around, but there places where "worn around the edges" would be good description for certain areas.  While very clean, there were signs of worn molding or water damage around the bathroom door, and there appeared to be some basic maintenance issues with the sink (it wouldn't drain, even when
Manager Response: none

Summary: This property is old and in desperate need of refurbishment. The blankets are ripped, the furniture is all stained and banged up and the bathrooms are looking tired with rust stains. The staff is actually quite friendly and do their best. Breakfast is quite hearty, eggs, bacon or sausage and an assortment of fruit, waffles and juices. This hotel is too far to walk to Disney as you will be exhausted at end of day. There is a shuttle that comes out front but you will have pay extra. They also charge $15 a day for parking. This is a 3 star hotel at best. Not bad enough to leave but despite a great staff, not enough for me to come back.  Fix up rooms and I will be back.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your the time you have taken to complete your feedback for us.  I want to thank you for being our guest, and at this time apologize for falling short of expectations, your feedback is greatly appreciated and will look into having your concerns addressed accordingly.  Once again, thank you for your time, and for being our guest.

Summary: We had a great 5 week stay at this Residence Inn. I don't even know how to explain how good it was, it felt like a full service Marriott.  The rooms were clean and quiet. Internet was fine. Breakfast was fantastic EVERY day which doesn't always happen at hotels this busy. The laundry room was the nicest I've ever seen in a hotel, plenty of machines. Beautiful pool and hot tub area, felt like a resort. The staff was always present, always smiling and wanting to help any way possible.   The hotel is right on the shuttle route to Disneyland or you can walk the 1.5 miles, it's a straight shot. You can easily walk to the convention center as well. Target is across the street and Von's is down Chapman. Lots of restaurants to choose from.  Our stay was so good, my wife wrote a long
Manager Response: none

Summary: we did the disney thing with hubby and 3children(ages 6,3 and 1). Hotel staff were welcoming especially the young lady at the reception who went out of her way to make sure we're comfortable(wish I had written this earlier because I've forgotten her name) having travelled for over 20hours from Nigeria. We used the hotel disney shuttle,drivers were courteous and sometimes helped with folding my baby's stroller. Buffet breakfast was nice as we had lots of variety but my kid's favourite was the waffle and strawberry toppings. They also have a game room which my kids enjoyed. We never got to have a swim in the pool though it was a nice view from our room. Oh we took the 2 bedroom apartment with the kitchenette and it saved us lots of money as we had food from Nigeria. Overall made
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review with us. I am very pleased to know you had a great stay with us and that having the kitchen in your suite helped make your stay with us a little more like home. Thank you for being our guest and I hope we may have the opportunity see you and your family again on a future trip back to the Magic Kingdom!

Summary: Hi, stayed here over the summer and it was okay; however there is room for improvement. First of all all the floors were dirty and needed hoovering. Now I understand it is a family hotel and is going to get messy but, but whilst staying there were quite a few occasions when the corridors were filthy with food everywhere. The same goes for the hotel room. The carpets were filthy and really needed a good clean. There were bits everywhere. Other than this, I can say it was a nice place to stay and was ideal for Disney being just a few minutes away on a shuttle bus service from the hotel. It is a great hotel for families and the breakfast was ideal; however I would say a slight change each day would have been good as the food got a bit boring after a while having the same cooked
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear we did not meet your expectations during your stay in the Summer of 2016. Your comments will be shared with our management staff to ensure that changes that were made to address the issues you noted from last year are still in place and still correcting the short comings you noted.
