We had 16 people in our group 8 were children, the money I saved on breakfast alone was a blessing because of the free buffet full breakfast..everyday something different to choose from (loved the creamed spinach)..and also Mon. thru Thur. 5-7 pm. a nice simple dinner..on Thur. a bar-b-q style meal by the Residence Inn..hamburgers and hot dogs even veggie style..always fruits and salad available. And you can use the grill anytime you want also..My neighbors stayed at another hotel and breakfast was 15.95 per person..(and I ate real good here)..Movie night and popcorn for children on
Manager Response: I am very lucky to have a staff full of great people like Jessilyn working at this hotel. Our staff genuinely cares about our guest's experience and we will always go out of our way to ensure that every guest has a great memorable stay. Both our daily breakfast buffet and the evening manager’s reception are an added value especially when you are traveling with a family. Thank you for being our guest! Hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Not up to par, many issues here
Summary: We expected more for the price and the rating from other guests posted here. The hotel is very shabby. The carpet felt tacky under foot. The sofa bed was fraying and the pull out bed had an odd smell. There are no bell services, everything is strictly DIY, like bringing luggage up to your room. There is no restaurant or bar on the premises. To have a glass of wine by the pool, guests are advised to go to the nearby Hyatt, have the wine served in a plastic cup, and then quietly walk it back over to the Marriott. We unfortunately had a 4th floor room overlooking the pool. The kids outside were screaming until 10 PM when they close the recreation area. For families trying to put younger kids to bed early so as to be up early for Disneyland, this creates serious problems. It makes
Manager Response: We appreciate your very direct feedback and will follow-up on your impressions to ensure we offer the best stay possible for all of our guests. We expect to provide a clean and comfortable suite with everything in working order and apologize that this was not your experience. We are scheduled for a renovation in the near future and most of the rooms’ issues will be addressed. On behalf of my entire staff, I apologize that your experience was not exceptional. We hope that we can have another opportunity at your business on your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Great for long term stay - or any stay with family
Summary: We moved from nearby Marriott Anaheim Suites and over to Residence Inn because we needed a kitchen. So what we got extra was a kitchen (with a large refrigerator with freezer), free wi-fi, breakfast included and two separate bedrooms. The master bedroom with a king size bed and separate bath was really nice. The other bedroom had two single beds and a separate bath, but no window. Not so nice (no window..) but OK for kids for 2 week stay. The staff where very friendly and helpful. We got 2 ekstra chairs for the breakfast table, so our large family could eat together. The wifi is free (which is great for kids and adults..) - not among the fastest, but OK for most uses. We didn't use the free breakfast much, as we have dietary needs not so easily met by the standard breakfast
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this kind review. We get many guests that stay with us for an extended period of time as the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort is centrally located with access to all Southern California attractions. Your review touched on many of the reasons that we are the best choice for a hotel stay during a visit to Disneyland. We hope that you and your family return soon.

Summary Heading: Hotel is average. Transit to Disneyland is bad.
Summary: We just got back from Disney(July 15-21). I don't have any major complaints against the hotel but, I wasn't there very often and did not utilize some of there services.  We were in Disney everyday from 8am-10pm except a few days we came back to the hotel to re-energize. Getting to and from Disney we utilized the ART transit. The good news is, the Residence Inn is the first stop back from the park. The bad news is, it's the ART.  The hotel is just over a mile and it takes 30 mins. to walk and that depends on many variables.  On average, we waited 25-30mins for the shuttle to arrive and it takes about 20-30mins to get to the park after it makes three more stops. We were never the first in line waiting for the shuttle.  There is no set pick up times, you just have to show up and
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting us during your recent trip to Disneyland. We regret that  you found the ART shuttle service to be inconvenient I will share your comments with the ART shuttle management team. Your perspective is greatly appreciated. If there is anything I can do to change your mind on staying with us in the future please feel free to contact me at 714-591-4015.

Summary: This was our second stay at the Residence Inn in Garden Grove and unfortunately for this trip we came with a sick child.  The hotel staff was so understanding and allowed us to leave early without penalty - they were incredible (especially the night front desk person, Joe).  The two bedroom suite is very spacious and great if you have a family (the second room allows the kids to have their own space) and the little touches (like cookies waiting for you in the room) just show how above and beyond the staff goes to make your time at the hotel extra special.  The breakfast and dinner are also a huge plus as is having a full kitchen in your room.  My kids also loved going down to the basketball court and playing around.   I will say that in the summer the hotel is packed and to no
Manager Response: Thank you for this review and your referral to other families visiting Disneyland. We're glad you and your family had a good stay. I absolutely agree with you; we do have a great staff and we are fortunate to have each and every one of them. I will be sure to share your feedback with our staff. I hope to have you back soon!

Summary Heading: One of the best hotels in Anaheim!
Summary: This Marriott is awesome. Plain and simple. I've been at a lot of hotels in Anaheim and this is ONE OF THE BEST! They have an awesome breakfast. Big, spacious rooms. And during the week they offer something different every night; Nachos, taco bar, etc. And it isn't too far from the main gate for Disneyland or parking for DT Disney.
Manager Response: It means a great deal to us to receive such a positive review from someone that has stayed at some of the other hotels in the area. The additional space enhances your trip by giving you room to relax after a long day. Our daily breakfast buffet is an added value especially when you are traveling with a family. Thank you for being our guest!

Summary Heading: Very good hotel in Disneyland neighborhood
Summary: Stay there 5 nights last week. It was supposed to be 6 nights, howerver at check-in I was informed that a little fire caused damage to the room we were supposed to have (studio suite). Unfortunately for us the hotel was sold out that night.  The hotel management team did a great work to relocate all my family to the Residence Inn maingate for the night and offer that complimentary night. The next day, I met the hotel general manager Frank Palacios who did again a very good work in order to accomodate the family. We were upgraded for the week in a 2-bedroom suite with bunkbed. Kids were very excited about that!!! They manage all this issue with a lot of professionalism.   The suite was large enough for a family of four. It has 3 HD TV, 2 bathrooms and fully equiped kitchen. The
Manager Response: We can't tell you how much we appreciate you taking the time to share such an experience on this website. Your review touched on many of the reasons that we are the best choice for a hotel stay during a visit to Disneyland. We hope that you and your family return soon.

Summary Heading: Non-Disney Resort that treats you like Disney
Summary: We've just returned (July 14th-18th) from a wonderful stay at the Garden Grove Residence Inn. We had a 2 bedroom suite with a King bed in the 1st room and a set of bunk beds in the 2nd room, also a living room A kitchen with refrigerator, microwave & oven. The kitchen had glasses/plates/silverware, did not have any pots or pans, but we weren't planning on cooking. I loved that each bedroom had its own bathroom. I liked being able to close the bedroom doors in the morning and put my make-up on in the living room without waking anyone up. I knew about the room layout so I made sure I took a travel mirror. There were 3 TV's. We have 2 sons 20 & 18 yr old, They loved the bunk beds. The complimentary breakfast was really good. My favorite morning was July 15th, they had tamales I
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us during your recent trip to Disneyland! We’re delighted to hear that you and your family enjoyed the Two-Bedroom Suite, Disney shuttle service, and breakfast. We hope to see you and your family again very soon

Summary: My family and I stayed here for a short trip to Disneyland. The room was perfect for 5 people, with my parents in the master bedroom, two in the bunk beds, and I took the sofa sleeper. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. My nephew fell on the ground before we left for the park and started crying. The girl at the front desk brough him over a Disney Augtograph book with Mikey on the front, and he was instantly cured. I would recommend this hotel to any buiness traveler or leisure traveler going to the area.
Manager Response: We thank you for posting this review. We feel that no hotel in the area caters to large families like the Residence Inn by Marriott. Whether traveling with a family of 5 or even more, the additional space enhances your trip by giving you room to relax after a long day. The people that work at this hotel are an exceptional group and greatly appreciate you noticing their efforts. We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: Wee chose this hotel because of its proximity to Disney parks. Price and chain loyalty were secondary considerations. It's a newer style Residence that is more like a traditional hotel than the condo-style Residences.  (There is one of those even closer to the parks, but we prefer this style.) The two bedroom was very large, clean and nicely appointed. The sofa sleeper could use a better mattress, but that's true of 99% of them. And, it was okay for our daughter who is tall and very thin. Outdoor pool was nice. Breakfast area is large with four waffle irons- a huge plus.  There is a pay shuttle service o the parks that stops at hotel, but we drove the mile and a half and parked in Disney garage.
Manager Response: We thank you for sharing your experience on your recent stay. The additional space enhances your trip by giving you room to relax after a long day. Our daily breakfast buffet is an added value especially when you are traveling with a family. Thank you for being our guest! Hope to see you soon

Summary: We stayed for 3 nights in a 2 bedroom suite.  Very reasonably priced for the amount of space.   Full kitchen with major applicances is great to have especially when traveling with kids.  The complimentary hot breakfast included a waffle station, fresh fruits, breakfast meat, omelets, cereals and fountain drinks.  Excellent way to save before breaking the bank for lunch in the Disneyland Parks.  The rooms were clean and the staff was very friendly.  The only inconvenience was the parking which fills up in the evening.  If you stay out late like we did, there may not be parking when you return.  Luckily the front desk provides a voucher to use the open lot in the Hyatt adjacent to the Residence Inn.  It is just a short walking distance if you cut through the pool area.  The night
Manager Response: We thank you for posting this review. We feel that no hotel in the area caters to large families like the Residence Inn by Marriott. The additional space enhances your trip by giving you room to relax after a long day. Our daily breakfast buffet is an added value especially when you are traveling with a family. Thank you for being our guest! Hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Solid stay, still room to improve
Summary: This was a good stay with the family in the two bedroom suite for a week.  The rooms show a little age with multiple wrinkles in the carpet and spots in the microwave.  It is quite clean.  The housekeeping staff always cleaned in the morning as we requested.  The lack of attention by housekeeping was a slight nuisance.  Sometimes did not empty garbage, missing towels, etc.  The lack of attention carried over to breakfast.  Juices were mismarked on the machine and then just out of juice two days in a row.  The breakfast, while serviceable, was more concerned about moving through large amounts of people than having variety or flavor.    Bottom line.  We would stay again, but like Disney, they are geared toward moving large volumes of people in a reasonable manner, not in providing
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us during your recent trip to Disneyland! We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your Two-Bedroom Suite and the location of the hotel We apologize for any inconveniences and frustrations that you experienced during your recent stay at the hotel, and thank you for taking the time to let us know about your concerns I certainly will address this with our staff. We hope to see you back soon.

Summary Heading: Cleanest hotel I've ever stayed in; great family hotel
Summary: We used my husband's Marriott points for 2 free and one paid night, so that is why we chose this hotel. It exceeded my expectations by far. The hotel was very busy, but I am shocked at how clean everything was. The lobby was spotless. Our room smelled clean (not like cleaning products), and even the bathtub was spotless. I have very high cleanliness standards, and it hard to impress me, but this place did! It was far cleaner than the other two 4-star hotels we stayed in this vacation while in Carlsbad and Newport Beach.  We loved having free breakfast every morning and the snacks on the weekend evenings. The crowd at breakfast was a little crazy (with some people pushing/shoving, acting like this would be their only meal of the day). But staff was very responsive when asked to
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting us during your recent trip to Disneyland! The title on your posting put a big smile on my face our housekeeping staff works hard everyday to keep our hotel clean. We are so happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed your suite. Thank you for your recommendation of the hotel, and we hope you will visit us again.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for about 2 weeks in a one bedroom suite and it was good overall, besides the housekeepers busting in every morning, sometimes without knocking. One of our stove tops also didn't work and the sink to the bathroom was not actually in the bathroom, but in the bedroom... which is a little awkward and noisy if you have people staying with you who want to use the sink when you're sleeping in the bedroom. The gym had a few treadmills and a bench. I loved the outdoor pool and the staff at the front desk were really helpful. Great location and decently-priced shuttle to and from Disneyland.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to write this review and share your experience during your recent stay. We apologize for any inconveniences that you experienced during you stay with us, and we thank you for letting us know. Thank you for staying with us, and we look forward to welcoming you back as our guest.

Summary Heading: I think they read the reviews
Summary: Im a Marriott rewards member so I primarily stay at their properties.  This particular one a couple times a year.  Last time was very disappointing and a I wrote a review on it.  Well this time things sure have changed.  Front desk was so much nicer.  I'm not a disney person but my kids are and every birthday they can invite friends to go for the weekend.  This particular friday we rolled in  ..party of 7 teen girls and myself.  We were early  but front desk held the cake in the refridgerator and put the balloons in the back office so we could go out to lunch.  When we got back they had put both in the room. Awesome!!!  Now they have flat screen tvs in every room!!  We had the biggest suite and everything was very clean. One small problem.  There were two broken glasses in the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post this review. We appreciate all the feedback we get from our guest. I’m sorry we failed to swap out the broken glasses. We have had several improvements to our hotel like flat screen TV’s including HD quality channels, in room safes, and most recently complementary WIFI in all guest rooms. Thanks for being our guest and hope to see you soon.

Summary: We stayed a week at this location on business and could not have been more pleased.The staff was outgoing, (thanks C, you know who you are) breakfast ample, business necessities well appointed. Rooms were serviced promptly, and efficiently, front desk more than just helpful for maps and suggestions beyond the Anaheim World of Disney. We really enjoyed the local slant to the meals-especially the breakfast beef tamales! Would definitely stay there again!
Manager Response: We thank you for sharing your experience on your recent stay. The beef tamales were a new breakfast items that we are trying out glad you liked them. Our daily breakfast buffet is an added value we hope to see you again very soon.

Summary: We were so impressed with our stay here.  We stayed for 4 days over Memorial Day this year with our 3 kids and 4 grandkids-so 9 of us all together.  The staff were wonderful, the rooms were in great condition and very clean.  Very easy to get to Disneyland on the Disney Shuttle.  The breakfast was super--even with a large group, there was something for everyone, and it felt so good to start a busy day with a good breakfast.  We LOVED this place and would stay there again anytime.
Manager Response: We thank you for posting this review. We feel that no hotel in the area caters to large families like the Residence Inn by Marriott. The additional space enhances your trip by giving you room to relax after a long day. Our daily breakfast buffet is an added value especially when you are traveling with a family. Thank you for being our guest! Hope to see you soon.

Summary: We stayed here for 4 days during Disneyland visit and completely satisfied with what the hotel has to offer. The room was clean and nice. The hotel has a toddler pool, which is a great plus for my son. Breakfast was excellent, with different kind of choices. There is a bus shuttle in front of the hotel that takes you directly to Disneyland. The front desk staffs were very friendly and accommodating. I definitely recommend this hotel if you are to go to Disneyland.
Manager Response: I absolutely agree with you we do have a great staff and we are fortunate to have each and every one of them. The ART shuttle system is a convenient way to get around town most recently ART shuttle has expanded to Knott’s Berry Farm and Medieval Times. Thank you for being our guest.

Summary: We stayed there this past weekend and were 'upgraded' from a kids suite to a 2 Q and 1 K suite but we still paid an extra $30.  The room was clean and worked well for 4 adults and 2 childrenbut I was a bit disappointed to not get the children's suite with bunk beds.  The evening meal was nice to hold us over until our reservations on Thursday and was just simple hot dogs and burgers  We booked this hotel specifically for the hot breakfast and the suite.  The breakfast was just average and was cold on the first day.  While the spread is varied, I found myself eating waffles only since the rest of the food was pretty limited; eggs, waffles or bagels and maybe a meat. The hours are not great for trying to get to the park at opening since you can't eat before 7 on the weekends.  We
Manager Response: We thank you for sharing your experience on your recent stay. I’m sorry that your experience of the breakfast was less than positive; I will personally share your comments with our staff to ensure our breakfast is always hot and available. I will consider your suggestion on expanding the breakfast hours to accommodate those early risers. I hope you will give us an second chance to show you we can provide a yummy breakfast. Thanks for being our guest.

Summary Heading: Visiting Disneyland? This is a great family hotel!
Summary: We stayed in a two-bedroom suite. The first bedroom has a king-size bed and private bath. The second bedroom has a set of twin-size bunk beds and a private bath. The living room/kitchen included sofa, desk and kitchen table areas.  There is a bus that will pick you up in front of the hotel and take you to Disneyland. We chose that option rather than moving the car. The bus makes its round in about  20 - 30 minutes. The area where you are dropped off at Disneyland is at the closest drop-off point; very convenient in the evenings with tired feet! The breakfast area is large and the buffet is fantastic.I would recommend staying here when visiting Disneyland in Anaheim, CA.
Manager Response: We thank you for posting this review. We feel that no hotel in the area caters to large families like the Residence Inn by Marriott. Whether traveling with a family of 5 or even more, the additional space enhances your trip by giving you room to relax after a long day.  The ART shuttle system is a convenient way to get around town most recently ART shuttle has expanded to Knott’s Berry Farm and Medieval Times. We hope to see you as a guest again very soon.

Summary: Room:  Air conditioner hard to regulate.  Would get too cold so tried to turn up and would get colder.  Not bad enough to ask to be moved.  Ice Maker:  Left two notes with cleaning staff that ice maker was not working and was filling up with water and making a huge block of ice (not cubes).  Food:  Breakfast was fantastic.  Hospitality Hour:  Horrid.  Out of four nights we had two that were edible.  One was a Nachos night and one was the BBQ held on Thursday nights.  We had what was billed as "Beef stew over rice".  It was gravy (couldn't find any beef and two tiny pieces of carrots) over instant mashed potatoes.  Then we had "Finger Food".  Dried up chicken nuggets and dried up baby corn dogs.  Also, carrot sticks and celery sticks.  This is our third time to your hotel and the
Manager Response: Thank You for reviewing our hotel on trip advisor. We appreciate your comments. Feeback, such as yours, helps us improve for our future guests. We will definitly look into the mentioned items in your suite. Thank You for the posting and your recent stay with us!

Summary: Had another amazing stay at this hotel! Frank and his staff were amazing, they always go above and beyond and it's not just me! I have never seen his staff not smile or offer a pleasant greeting. They truly make you feel right at home and franks BBQ on Thursday nights are well done and very comfortable. It's always nice when you see the manager take care of their employees. Very classy guy and staff
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words it was truly a pleasure having you as our guest. The people that work at this hotel are an exceptional group and greatly appreciate you noticing their efforts. We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: My stay at the Residence Inn was fantastic.  The hotel was clean, nice and convenient.  The staff were extremely helpful and courteous and the parking and on-site facilities were great.  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone considering staying near Disneyland.
Manager Response: We thank you for sharing your experience on your recent stay. We are thrilled that you enjoyed so many aspects of the hotel and look forward to seeing you on your next visit to the area.

Summary: Very nice hotel for Disneyland vacation if you have kids. Room layout and bedding was great. Even though off property of the park, still was close enough to take a lunch and swim break midday. Breakfast and dinners were very good but the dinners did not really fit our schedule. Hotel and room were very clean along with pool area. Used pools everyday and they were always well maintianed. The ART shuttle/bus worked well and we never had any long waits. Saw some reviews about the elevators and wifi being slow but both were more than fine during our stay and the hotel seemed very busy. The only thing I would complain about is they charge you for parking, I hate the feeling of being nickled and dimed. We were there a week and thats a good hunk of money for hotel, I just think they do
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your feedback.

Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights as part of our uSA holiday.  Cannot fault the hotel.  Fantastic for families, very clean, beds are comfortable and the rooms have everything you could possibly need -including a popcorn maker!  Breakfast is extensive and there is lots of seating.  Dinner is also provided most nights.  The BBQ night was enjoyable and the kids loved the games. Close to Target for groceries and heaps of restaurants also close by.  No car needed.  The ART bus picks you up outside the hotel and takes you to the door of DIsneyland.  Staff are always smiling and accommodating.  Would certainly stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review. I absolutely agree with you; we do have a great staff and we are fortunate to have each and every one of them. The ART shuttle system is a convenient way to get around town most recently ART shuttle has expanded to Knott’s Berry Farm and Medieval Times. Thank you for being our guest.

Summary: We didn't know what to expect.  We were happily suprised.  Hotel room was very clean, beds comfortable, service was exceptional.                They went out of their way to accomodate us. This hotel is great for families, grocery shopping is nearby, one block to Target, 5 mins. to Vons. Really enjoyed breakfast and social hour (Mon-Thurs 5-7). We had hamburgers, hot dogs with vegetables, salads etc. Thurs., missed the other nights. Would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post this review. It's always nice to have a little extra room to unwind after a long day at Disneyland and we're glad that you and your family had the same experience. Our managers BBQ night is one of my favorite events of the week meeting our guest helps our managers understand our traveler’s needs. We are grateful that you indicated you will return again in the future.

Summary Heading: Perfecto for my Ohana...We Loved It!
Summary: We stayed here last week tuesday for 4 Nights, and 5 days. It felt soo much like a home, my kids,would say "can we go home, i mean back to thé hotel!" Lol...Sergio at thé front Desk was very gracious as well as every single employee we encountered. We love thé breakfast buffet, by far thé best. Our last leg of trip we had to stay at an Embassy Suite and by far, Resident Inn is still our favorite for Customer Service, their spacious room, their ono breakfast buffet, and the disney shuttle right outside the Hotel. My family of 5 was in love with this hotel and now we know our next family trip will only be at the Resident Inn Garden Grove. We hope the staff enjoyed the Mango bread we brought up to give to the hotel for their geneorosity and really defining of what great employees
Manager Response: Mahalo, for posting this review. We feel that no hotel in the area caters to large families like the Residence Inn by Marriott. Whether traveling with a family of 5 or even more, the additional space enhances your trip by giving you room to relax after a long day. I absolutely agree with you we do have a great staff and we are fortunate to have each and every one of them. Thanks for the yummy bread I was lucky enough to get a taste. A hui hou!

Summary: While traveling on business, I was fortunate enough to find this Residence Inn close to the convention center and convenient to Disneyland.  The hotel is clean and comfortable with its clientele of families clamoring to Disney as well as some business travelers.  For the number of guests of all ages and the fact that it is also pet-friendly, the hotel is in excellent condition.  The most notable part of my trip was really the staff and in particular Kristin!  Kristin works at the front desk and she is AWESOME!  One of the most professional, courteous, enthusiastic and friendly staff members I've ever met - Thank You Kristin!
Manager Response: I am very lucky to have a staff full of great people like Kristin working at this hotel. Our staff genuinely cares about our guest's experience and we will always go out of our way to ensure that every guest has a great memorable stay. We can't wait to see on your next visit.

Summary: We have stayed other places while visiting Disneyland in the past.  Some have been nicer but none have had better service.  The front desk staff could not have been more helpful.  5 stars to the housekeeping staff.  How they do it is beyond me, but our room was cleaned (we left dirty dishes in the sink, never expecting the housekeeper to do them but she did!) to a T everyday.  Morning breakfast was just fine - no gourmet fixings but their were hot eggs, waffles, bagels, cereal, fruit, yogurt, etc - and plenty of each.  The hotel is a ways from Disneyland but the shuttle picks you up twice an hour. Outside pool was well tended, grounds were neat, interior decor is nice and up to date, this simply is the PERFECT hotel for a Disney vacation.   We booked here because of great TA
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to write this review and share your experience during your recent stay. The people that work at this hotel are an exceptional group and greatly appreciate you noticing their efforts. We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: This is the best hotel to stay at when visiting Disneyland! The staff has gone above and beyond the standard to make us feel welcome.  The rooms are clean, comfortable, and pretty big for the price.  The hotel is about a mile or so from disneyland, but by staying a mile away, you get comfort at a great price, there is a tran out front of the hotel for a small fee, like many if the other hotels in the area. Not to mention they have an awesome continental breakfast! It would be a no brainer to stay here when in the area, our any marriott hotel for that matter.
Manager Response: We thank you for sharing your experience on your recent stay. Our staff goes out of their way on a daily basis to make every stay special. Our daily breakfast buffet is an added value we hope to see you again very soon.

Summary: I liked the hotel ! very convinient to disneyland and surrond attractions ! breakfast was super good, my kid loved getting balloons at breakfast time. the only thing that i didnt like is the charge to use the business center. if you need to print your boarding pass you need to pay $1 per page. we are paying already almost $200 per nite and why we cant use the business center for free???  the room is good, bathrooms too. my bathroom had a little crack on the wall, shower area. cant it be fixed ?it does not look pretty. thanks for the front desk for putting my family at top floor !
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to write this review and share your experience during your recent stay. Thank you for noting some of the amenities in the suites that separate us from the rest of the hotels in the area. Boarding passes should be free of charge when printing at our business center I will make sure this is properly posted. I’m sorry about the condition of the shower area if you have a moment please reach out to me so that I can get your information and identify the room you stayed in. We would very much like to properly repair the crack on the shower wall. Again thank you for being our guest I hope to see you soon.

Summary: My family stayed here when we went to Disneyland this spring. Our travel agent recommended it as a good place for families. And she was so right! The entire staff was so great and helpful! The breakfast every morning was so good, and the dinner at night was better than I expected. I was told it would be a light, kid friendly meal that may not be great for adults, but I enjoyed the meals too. And we had enough to eat. We will for sure stay at this hotel anytime that we go to Disneyland and highly recommend it!
Manager Response: We thank you for sharing your experience on your recent stay. Our staff goes out of their way on a daily basis to make this a special vacation for all of our guests and we're thrilled that you and your family had such a wonderful stay. Our Thursday managers BBQ is a popular event I enjoy meeting our guest and personally thanking them for their patronage. We hope to see you and your family again very soon.

Summary Heading: (Diane H) Wow! What a great place to stay!
Summary: I can't speak too highly of this hotel! Everyone and everythink was wonderful. When we were checking in, I asked several people who were checking out how they liked it. All of them said positive things. We were there a week starting May 9, 2012. They did grocery shopping for us at no extra charge...can you believe it!!! They let us stay until we had to leave for the airport even though it was in the afternoon. The beds were really comfortable, everything was clean, and it was great to have a full kitchen where we could fix our own meals if we wanted. They have a full breakfast buffet with scrambled eggs, sour cream, sausage, cheese, waffles, pancakes, and on and on. Some nights they even had free buffets of pasta and other food. Everyone was friendly, helpful, cheerful. One of
Manager Response: We thank you for posting this review. We feel that no hotel in the area caters to large families like the Residence Inn by Marriott. The additional space enhances your trip by giving you room to relax after a long day. I’m glad that you were able to use the fully equipped kitchen to prepare yummy snacks for your family. Our daily breakfast buffet is an added value especially when you are traveling with a family. Thank you for being our guest! Hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Great Value, Great Staff, Pleasant Stay!
Summary: Incredible value, very spacious, friendly staff, great buffet breakfast. Very convenient and close to Disneyland. Staff was very accomodating to our needs. Bed was very comforatble, and slept great. They allowed us to use their parking lot 5 hours prior to our check-in time, so that we could venture over to Disneyland and come back later to check in. Will definitely be staying at this hotel again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Southern California. We are thrilled that you enjoyed so many aspects of the hotel and look forward to seeing you on your next visit to the area.

Summary: I stayed here May 8th 2012. The staff at check-in couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. Laura at the front desk was so friendly and helped us quite a bit!  The room was nice, clean and well appointed. The beds were very comfortable, and the room was very quiet. I wasn't traveling with children, but it would be a great place to stay with kids. The morning breakfast was very nice. They have large stations with  a lot of variety. I missed the evening reception, because we were at Disneyland, but  I'm sure it was very nice. I liked that the internet was free and easy to use.   For dinner, we walked to the Hyatt and ate at their Italian restaurant. They had a nice house wine and reasonable food prices.   Here is the only down side, they don't have their own shuttle to Disney. You
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review. I absolutely agree with you; we do have a great staff and we are fortunate to have each and every one of them. The ART shuttle system is usually very reliable I will personally share your experience with the ART manager to ensure that this is not a recurring problem. Thank you for being our guest.

Summary: We Stayed Here With Our Four Kids Ranging in Age 2-12 too Celebrate My Daughters 2nd Birthday At Disneyland from April 20-24th 2012. We Stayed 4 nights and Realy enjoyed our room. Our Room was very clean, bathroom very clean. Had no complaints. Loved that had a full kitchen with full size refrigerator that made it great  for all our grocerys.. Drinks, milk ,snacks for kids etc. Used Kitchen late nights when we returned from a long day at Disneyland instead of going out to eat and saved us alot of money. Also Had Free Hot Breakfast every morning That all of us enjoyed! The only complaint I would say I had was the parking lot was extremely full coming back at 1am from the park with kids sleeping was a hassle getting them all Out And up too the room,having too park so far in the
Manager Response: Thank you for this review and your referral to other families visiting Disneyland. We believe we are the ideal choice for anyone visiting Disneyland and are happy that you agree. I’m sorry your experience with our parking was less than positive, we do have over flow parking available next door at the Hyatt. We have several parking spots dedicated to loading and un-loading in the front of the hotel. I’m pleased to announce that by May 25 our hotel will have wireless internet access in every suite! We hope to see you and your family again very soon.

Summary: My husband and 2 children stayed at the Residence Inn Marriott last week for our family trip to Disneyland.  My husband had previously stayed but this was my first time.  I was impressed immediately!  We stayed in one of their two bedroom suites, which was plenty big enough for our family.  The kids had their own TV and bathroom.  The kitchen was fantastic because it had a fridge, stove and dishwasher.  We were able to make our own meals when we had time.  Your hotel stay includes a full breakfast and a light dinner, which is a huge cost saver.  They also have ice cream socials for the kids as well as movie nights.  The transit bus that shuttles you back and forth from Disneyland is right out front the hotel and very inexpensive.  It is centrally located and close to
Manager Response: We thank you for sharing your experience on your recent stay. Our staff goes out of their way on a daily basis to make this a special vacation for all of our guests and we're thrilled that you and your family had such a wonderful stay. We hope to see you and your family again very soon.

Summary: My husband, daughter, and son stayed 7 nights and can easily say it was one of the best hotel stays we have ever had.  The hotel staff was very friendly.  They accommodated an early arrival and late check out.  The hot breakfast in the morning was a huge cost savings and very convenient.  My daughter loved making the family homemade waffles every morning.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom with a king bed and kid's suite with bunk beds.  The kids loved their kid's suite.  The king bed was extremely comfortable, even more so than some more expensive hotels we have stayed in.  Our room was very quiet.  While the hotel seemed to be fairly full, we hardly ever heard any other guests. Loved having the dining area and kitchen.  The pool area is very nice.  Loved having the hot tub and the 1
Manager Response: Thank you for fantastic review! We're thrilled that you and your family had such a great time on your vacation with us. Your review touched on many of the reasons that we are the best choice for a hotel stay during a visit to Disneyland. come see us again soon!

Summary Heading: Most amazing Staff! and wonderful location
Summary: We arrived on a friday to start our trip, our travel agent had booked us (merrly) buy mistake in the wrong Residence inn..Wanted the one closer to the gate. once i explained our situation to the front dest they offered to upgrade our room!, so we we thrilled to see a two bedroom suite one bebroom for our daughter with a bunk bed and seperate bathroom and T.V. the Beds are so comfortable! large bathroom in the other bebroom and a beautiful Kitchen . the Pool area was wonderful for my fish of a daughter ..lolz and the breakfast selection out of this world! would never stay any other place if we went to disneyland again! Love you guys !
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us during your recent trip to Disneyland! We’re delighted to hear that you and your family enjoyed the Two-Bedroom Suite, Disney shuttle service, and pool. We hope to see you and your family again very soon

Summary: We are a family of 6 and stayed in a two bedroom "kids suite".  The kids loved the bunk beds and the sofa bed slept two more.  The room was clean and in decent shape but starting to show signs of wear.  Having the use of the kitchen was a money saver and the hotel provides a grocery shopping service.  A full hot breakfast was available every morning with plenty of hot and cold selections.  For a large family this saved us 30-50 dollars every day.  In the evening there is a limited hot food selection but we found it sufficient for dinner.  The staff was friendly and accommodating.  Because of the proximity to the Disney parks walking from the hotel is not a good option.  Our experience with the Anaheim Resort Transit is they don't operate on a set schedule so some patience is
Manager Response: We thank you for posting this review. We feel that no hotel in the area caters to large families like the Residence Inn by Marriott. Whether traveling with a family of 5 or even more, the additional space enhances your trip by giving you room to relax after a long day. I’m glad that you were able to use the fully equipped kitchen to prepare yummy snacks for your family. Our daily breakfast buffet is an added value especially when you are traveling with a family. Thank you for being our guest! Hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: I have stayed at nicer but NEVER better!
Summary: Awesome hotel.  The staff were VERY friendly and helpful, the breakfast is wonderful.  Full breakfast waffles, eggs, sausage, gravy and bisquits - absolutely great.  Found room to be very clean and just a great place to make your home away from home.  I can't think of anywhere else I would stay when in the Anaheim area!!!  Very centrally located within an easy drive to Huntington beach, laguna beach and of course about a block away from Disneyland.  Parking was easy and plentiful.  I would Highly reccommend this hotel.  We stayed for four nights and had a very pleasant stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for being our guest. While quite a bit has changed at our hotel since your last stay, we still have the same great service and excellent staff. We certainly hope to see you and your family again on your next trip to the Anaheim area.

Summary: The Garden Grove Residence Inn is a wonderful place to stay.  Rooms are exceptionally clean, the staff is always happy and smiling.  They want to please and are very helpful giving us guidance.  They go the extra mile.  Frank, Brionna and his staff represent the Residence Inn on a superior level.  We would give this property 10 star rating if that rating was available.  Breakfast and dinners are hot, flavorful and filling.  I will stay there anytime I go to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Made reservations on short notice and was just floored with how well we were taken care of. Matt at reservations was extremely accommodating, when I made our initial reservation. He listened to all of my requests and understood what my needs were. We arrived on Saturday, May 5th, 2012 and could not believe our room was available at 9:00am, when check in time was not even susposed to be until 4pm. On top of that, they allowed to take part in the ongoing breakfast, which should have not have been part of our stay until the following morning, since we normally would not have checked in until 4pm. The breakfast is included in your stay, free of charge. Upon check in, the two girls at the front desk were sincere, happy, friendly, and professional, not to mention courteous. The same
Manager Response: Thank you for this review and your referral to other families visiting Disneyland. We're glad you and your family had a good stay. I absolutely agree with you; we do have a great staff and we are fortunate to have each and every one of them. I will be sure to share your feedback with our staff. I hope to have you back soon!

Summary Heading: Awesome home base for Disney vacation
Summary: We stayed here for 6 nights in April 2012, the staff (especially the manager who was very responsive and kind in responding to my requests prior to our visit) were lovely and helpful. We were checked in when we expected, while we waited they stored our bags.   Breakfast was very predicable but had something for everyone a good start to the day. We had a King / Queen/Queen room and it was perfect for us (family of 4 (2 teen girls) and grandma), though there was some sticky spots on the floor that we could not figure what they exactly were. The shuttle to Disney (and all over the Anaheim area) picked up right outside the hotel and took you to disney (3 stops I think), coming back from Disney, this hotel is the first stop which is nice after a long day.  Grab the bus information on
Manager Response: We thank you for posting this review. We feel that no hotel in the area caters to large families like the Residence Inn by Marriott. Whether traveling with a family of 5 or even more, the additional space enhances your trip by giving you room to relax after a long day. We hope to see you as a guest again very soon

Summary: We booked for 13 students from NZ competing in the Vex Robotics Competition at the Anaheim Convention Centre. The staff went out of the way to help us from our first booking contact to the arrangements for our depature on a late flight. The rooms functioned well and the students particularly appreciated the breakfast and the pool . The rooms were well maintained and access was easy and efficient even with all our gear. The location was ideal with take out and shopping close by and transport right outside.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review. I absolutely agree with you; we do have a great staff and we are fortunate to have each and every one of them. We are looking forward to seeing you again next year!

Summary: everything was wonderful, the room, the staff, the pool, basketball court. and the bar-b-q'er. my husband hates staying in hotels and always complains whoa thank goodness all he said were good things. we will definitely be staying here again. staff was awesome!!!!
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to write this review and share your experience during your recent stay. Thank you for noting some of the amenities in the suites that separate us from the rest of the hotels in the area.

Summary: Our recent stay at this Marriott Residence Inn was outstanding.  The staff was superb, the room was awesome...I just can't say enough good about it.  Thanks Marriott!
Manager Response: We thank you for sharing your experience on your recent stay. Our staff goes out of their way on a daily basis to make this a special vacation for all of our guests and we're thrilled that you and your family had such a wonderful stay. We hope to see you and your family again very soon.

Summary: Excellent Hotel for a Family Holiday and Disney Land etc Visits.  Great location just out of the centre of town but still with plenty of restaurants nearby and the bus stop right outside the hotel makes it so easy to get around.  Great free breakfast each day, but can be madness with all the kids (we were there in spring break also which probably made it worse) If your just after some toast or cereal go down and grab some and take back to your room. With toaster in room can just take the bread and spreads etc back and avoid some of the que.  Front desk staff were super helpful, and nothing was ever a problem for them to help with.  I travel extensively overseas for business (once a month) and found this hotel extremely comfortable without the un-necessary flashyness of 5 star
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great value for a family visiting Disneyland
Summary: As a self-retired Flight Attendant, I have stayed at more than my share of hotels.  This hotel was clean but very busy, especially during Spring Break, though great for families.  We stayed in a suite with a full kitchen, which is exactly I wanted and needed. I did not have a problem waiting for the elevator to take us to the 8th floor, which was at the top floor of this building. Breakfast buffet was average and the Evening Reception with food was average but a nice touch.  It was nice to see the Management come around with balloons in the morning for the kids during breakfast.  I didn't have any issues with the room and from what little contact I had with the Management, everyone was very nice and very pleasant to work with. The only things that I I didn't like were having to
Manager Response: Thank you for this review and your referral to other families visiting Disneyland. We believe we are the ideal choice for anyone visiting Disneyland and are happy that you agree. We will review our complimentary meals and continue to improve the experience for all of our guests. I’m pleased to announce that by May 1st our hotel will have wireless internet access in every suite! We hope to see you and your family again very soon.

Summary Heading: Good family hotel for visiting Disneyland
Summary: This hotel does a good job at what it is intended for -- a reasonably priced child-friendly hotel that is close to Disneyland.  We stayed for 4 days here and it pretty much was exactly what I expected.  We arrived early the first day (around 1 pm) and they allowed us to check-in early without any problems.  We reserved one of the "kids suites" they offer, which is essentially a two bedroom that has a bunkbed with kids furniture in one of the bedrooms.  The room was clean and functional, although smaller than other Residence Inns I have stayed at.  The kitchen is a bit dated - appliances have seen better days, but everything did work fine.  Good sized flat screen televisions in both bedrooms and the living room.  One serious drawback is that there is no wifi in the rooms, only in
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to write this review and share your experience during your recent stay. Thank you for noting some of the amenities in the suites that separate us from the rest of the hotels in the area. We are sorry that we forgot to replenish your soap and shampoo we will share your experience in our upcoming housekeeping meeting. Staying connect via internet is very important that’s why by the end of April our hotel will complete the installation of Wifi in all guest rooms! We are always looking to improve and your suggestions are appreciated.  We hope to see you again on your next visit to Disneyland. Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: This place is just not the cleanest due to the high volume of travelers that are in and out of the lobby area. My biggest complaint is they have  only one bank of 2 elevators in the entire building. You cannot take stairs because they exit outside of the hotel. Very flawed design. We waited as long as 10 minutes to take elevators and when you finally get on them it is wall to wall people. Rooms were clean, basic Residence Inn.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your thoughts on Tripadvisor. We greatly value the feedback from our guests and will take your comments and suggestions as we continue to try to improve the experience for all of our guests. We apologize for the wait time for the elevator as it seems to stop on every floor during this busy time of year (spring break).

Summary: I never write reviews but i was so pleased w/ our stay here i had to come share the EXCELLENT experience... 1st we got there early check in wasn't until i believe 4p and they were able to check us in around 11:30 am about a hour later they called up to make sure we got settled in ok ...the next morning on my way down to breakfast the staff member at the front desk addressed me by my last name and said good morning it caught me off guard that she remembered me...the breakfast was very good the waffles were very popular the kids loved it and also the evening snack...the kids loved the basketball courts and the arcade room...the rooms were very nice and the kids loved that they had bunk beds and own bathroom very clean i usually don't walk around a hotel w/o socks or my slippers on
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently stayed at this hotel and it was excellent, rooms were spotless, close to Disney with a shuttle bus right at the door. They have a complimentary breakfast which is great to get you started on your day also they had a couple of evenings which had food out, hamburgers and hot dogs nothing special but sure was nice to be able to just grab a burger after along day at Disney We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite which was perfect for our family! We will stay there again when we go back!!!! Keep up the good work!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location.  Good breakfast.  Wonderful stay.
Summary: We had a family reunion at Disneyland and used the Residence Inn as our home-base.  Our family (6) had a one bedroom suite - it was adequate but a little tight.  My brother and his family had a two-bedroom suite (with bunk beds) - a lot more room.  The rooms were clean and I have no complaints.  Beds were comfy.  Internet was wired and free (cable provided in the room).  We parked our car at the hotel for the 3 days we were there; we used the ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) to shuttle and/from the park.  It was very quick and easy.  The longest we had to wait for a shuttle was about 20 minutes.  You can buy tickets at the hotel gift shop or at the self-serve kiosk outside the hotel front door - very convenient.  --  We also walked to the park one morning - took about 25-30 minutes.
Manager Response: Dear Clovebs,  We are excited that you and your family had a great stay at The Residence Inn Anaheim Resort. Our staff members are committed to providing a clean and well kept hotel. I will make sure to share your comments at our next staff meeting. Thanks for being our guest! We look forward to hosting your next family event.  Sincerely,  Frank Palacios General Manager

Summary: Just completed  4 night stay for a Disney vacation with my husband and 4 kids.  Rooms were spacious,  free breakfast was tasty and not crowded, used the kitchenette for dinner at night, found bus service to Disney convenient and easy to use.  My daughter lost a tooth the first night, the tooth fairy found us even away from home! My daughter forgot to remove the $1.00 from under her pillow when we went out for the day.  Upon returning hours later, the maids had cleaned the room, made up all the beds- and EVEN re-staged the $1.00 under her pillow!  Wonderful! Very satisfied!
Manager Response: Dear RR,  I’m glad that you and your family had a fantastic stay with us. It’s great that you were able to use the fully equipped kitchen to prepare dinner. Hope to have you with us again in the near future.  Sincerely,  Frank Palacios General Manager

Summary: We reserved a two-bedroom suite for three adults and one child.  One bedroom had a king and the other two double beds.  It was great having two seperate bathrooms.  The living room and kitchen were spacious enough to spread out.  The rooms were clean and serviced well.  One of the reasons we like Residence Inns is the free breakfast - it saves us another $50.  If you get to the breakfast area before 9:00 it's not crowded and comfortable.  It you go after 9:00 be prepared for crowds on kids.  They change the selection of breakfast items every morning, not gourmet, but satisfying.  It you like make-your-own waffles, try the one on the right.  Instead of one big waffle, you get four mini-waffles.  There's a yogurt station, warm oatmeal, and lots of juices and coffees.  It's about
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Amazing service, Great breakfast, and nice rooms.
Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Residence Inn. Everyone we came in contact with gave us amazing customer service. The breakfast buffet had a lot of variety, and there were extra perks with complimentary BBQ in the evening etc. The hotel was perfect for a family to stay while visiting Disneyland. Highly recommend!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Amazing Place For A Family To Stay
Summary: Being a person who hates staying at hotels, I was so pleasantly surprised when we arrived at our suite at the Residence Inn.  First of all, the hotel staff could have not been more accommodating to our every need.  Secondly, the suite was extremely clean and spacious (we had the suite with the kids bunk bed).  It was so nice for my wife and I to have our own room and bathroom on the other side of the suite from the kids.  The breakfast was typical for an an Anaheim hotel but the dinner was a nice surprise... we found ourselves satisfied with the offerings and rarely needing to bring food in (which was a nice cost savings).  Having a full kitchen was also fabulous.  Other great hotel features included a great laundry room, a Disneyland bus stop right outside the hotel entrance, a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very good place to use as a family headquarters for Disneyland adventures
Summary: This is my second stay at this hotel for a family Disney trip.  I would not recommend this hotel for business travelers, but it is perfect for families with children as well as large family groups.  The suites include options for two bedrooms and two full bathrooms, breakfast is free and includes lots of options with choices changing (slightly) daily, and parking is $8 (it was free a year ago).  The hotel and decor are not luxurious, but is clean, and the staff keep up with the obvious high occupancy/use pretty well.  When we arrived, a sink wasn't draining and there was a strange smell in the bathroom; both issues were resolved promptly and requests for extra blankets were all handled cheerfully.  I would recommend an early breakfast, as it gets chaotic later in the morning
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a great stay at the Residence Inn.  Having the two rooms is great when staying with kids, we loved the comfort and convenience of it.  The breakfast was great with a lot of options for kids and adults.  The anaheim resort shuttle ran smoothly from the hotel to disneyland, which made staying a little bit away from the park not a problem at all.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone with children, who want extra room to spread out.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We as a family of 6 stayed here for 2 weeks while visiting from nz Location great, friendly staff, rooms clean and tidy all though a bit tired!  Unfortunitly the laundry facilities had a few issues but were resolved as quick as possible.  Breakfast buffet yummy sets you up for a great day at Disneyland  Even offered free light snack mon- Thursday.  Great value for money we will be back!! Thank you
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had the 2 room suite with 2 bathrooms, which is a must for a large family.  The room was very clean.  The breakfast had healthy options and some gypsies for the kids.  They loved making theirvown waffles!  We were celebrating birthdays, and the staff sent cookies and gallons for our daughter, and she was so pleased!  The staff was polite, and the cleaning staff made my daughter's stuffed animals nice and cozy on the pillows when they cleaned ( we even took pictures).  My only complaint is that they weren't willingbto budge on prices, while other hotels that I had called were willing to drop their advertised rate a bit.  So we paid a little more, and it was a splurge, but it was worth the extra money.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Easy walk to the Convention Center
Summary: Usual clean, bright and cheerful Residence experience. It's a relatively short and pleasant walk to the convention center.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Probably the cleanest hotel I've stayed at.  Loved the clean smell of the sheets.  The bed was very comfortable, I have a Tempurpedic at home so I'm very particular about the comfort of hotel beds.  Guest service at the front desk and breakfast was awesome.  I felt safe parking my car in their parking lot at night.  I also left my cell phone in the room and they shipped it to my home asap.  No complaints at all.  It was overall a great say.  I will not hesitate recommending this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Big rooms, clean grounds, staff exceedingly accommodating.
Summary: Fantastic place to stay - big clean rooms with a kitchenette and a decent size bath.  The hotel's pool and spa were clean and an added bonus for us, as was the close proximity of shops/restaraunts just across the road. The real high point of this hotel was the excellent customer service we received. For example, we arrived quite early and wanted to check out late, and the staff arranged this without a problem. In fact, nothing was a hassle for any of the staff at the hotel - they were all very helpful. We would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Big rooms, good location, nice staff
Summary: Stayed 2 nights, rooms good size, breakfast is good, we had waffles. Pool was cold, but people still used it. Beware of rooms facing the pool - kids are noisy and you can definitely hear it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked a 1 bedrm suite but when I arrived I am assuming those were sold out so, much to my amazement I was upgraded to a 2 bedrm suite. My kids were so happy to have an extra bedroom with twin beds and their own restroom! They were gonna sleep on the pull out sofa since this was just an overnight stay. We all were just amazed on how organized breakfast was ran. They served biscuits and gravy, french toast, waffles with strawberries and whipped cream and even chocolate chips to make chocolate chip waffles. There was two kinds of eggs served along with fresh fruit and assortment of breads and juices. I like that large containers of various coffee cream was provided. I stayed at the Homewood Suites a week before for a week and the breakfast there was nowhere near as good as here.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not your best option as a business traveller
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights while on a business trip.  It's definitely very family oriented (everything has a Disney theme).  Breakfast was average (served in foam plates and plastic cutlery).  I was in Anaheim in July and stayed at the Sheraton Garden Grove and regretted not having booked there yet again.  For families going to Disney I can see the attraction but for business travelers, there's definitely better options in that area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This place is great.  The breakfast was good and hotel staff was great.  There were six of us staying in a two bedroom room and had plenty of room.  The ART bus to DisneyLand was right outside and very convenient.  Our kids also enjoyed the light dinner served on week nights - very convenient.  There was also shopping (Target) within a block.  Like I said, great place!
Manager Response: none

Summary: what a BEAUTIFUL property.. my family and I stayed 4 days for a Disneyland trip... this property had a wonderful breakfast every morning (waffles, eggs, fruit, potatoes, cereal) much more than the usual continential.  they also had dinner and snacks in the evening.  movies for the kids, a big beautiful pool/kid pool/spa.   rooms are big and CLEAN, and comfortable with a full size fridge, dishwasher, dishes everything you need.  also there are fantastic restaurants within walking distance.   I will be booking again with this property!!!!!!!!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I’ve stayed in 100’s of hotels and this one rates in the top 3 for cleanest. I was here on business, but it is also family perfect. Two rooms, two flat screen TV’s, and a kitchen area. Windows open. Unusual HOT free breakfast, scrambled eggs, potatoes and all the regular stuff.  I will go out of my way to stay here again. Great rates.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent. Comfortable. Friendly. Overall one of the best stays I've had.
Summary: This is my first tripadvisor review or any review for that matter.  However, I was so impressed by this place, I felt the least I could do was commend them for their service,.  I wasn't sure what to expect since most of the reviews were great, but the ones that weren't good, concerned me, especially about the kids, etc. Upon arrival, J Lin at the front desk was friendly and very helpful.  After checking in, she called the room to make sure everything was in order and asked if I needed anything.  The suite felt like home.  There was a kitchen and dining room table, with refrigerator and stove; a desk; good sized living room space with couch, sofa chair and TV.  Although I was located by the elevator, I didn't hear as much noise if any that I expected.  The rooms were very clean
Manager Response: Thank you for being our guest and taking a moment to share your experiences with us. We hope to see you again on your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay when travelling with a family
Summary: If you are looking for a fabulous family friendly, clean and convenient place to stay.  This is it. We were travelling with 4 kids and we got a room that had 2 bedrooms. Ours had a king bed, and our own bathroom .  The kids had 2 queen beds and their own bathroom. In between the two rooms we had a full size kitchen with a table that was great for the kids to catch up on some homework, play card games and have some snacks.  Having the full kitchen was amazing.  We went to the grocery store which is close by.  Stocked up on some drinks , and snacks and things we could take to the Disneyland and it sure helped with $$ when travelling with 4 kids. Having a full breakfast in the morning is fabulous.  Then the appy hour was almost like dinner.  There are grills in the courtyard by the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for a business trip... Wrong move! Lots of kids very average rooms etc.  I would recommend for families visiting Disney. If you are a business traveler u recommend shelling out a few bucks and staying at the Marriott
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here 2 nights with my husband and our 4 year old & 4 month old sons. Room had everything we needed but was a bit dated and smaller than othe Residence Inns we have stayed at. Kind bed was very comfortable but sofa bed was horrible. Shower was hot. Room was clean. Staff was efficient and friendly.The morning breakfast buffet was great! About a 5 to 10 minute drive to Disneyland depending on the traffic.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great stay for families traveling to Disneyland
Summary: Hotel staff is awesome!  Rooms are comfortable and clean.  Nice bar-b-que and pool area.  Good hotel breakfast included.  Convenience is amazing.  The Anaheim transit shuttle stop is literally steps away from the lobby.  We have season passes to Disneyland which include free parking, but the transit is so convenient that we utilize it.  The nice thing is that the shuttle stop at the Residence Inn Garden Grove is for Route 1, which has very few stops, and is the closest drop off and pick up point in the park.   The cost is $4.00 per day and can be used for multiple trips within the same day.  They also offer a 3 day pass.   We were able to secure a $139 per day rate which included two queen beds and a pull out sofa.  It was nice having the kitchen and fridge.  Parking is $8.00
Manager Response: none

Summary: I think we found our hotel for our Disneyland vacations.  We've stayed at several other hotels, and though the others were okay, this Residence Inn in Garden Grove is perfect for families going to Disneyland or other nearby places.  It is a happy, pleasant atmosphere.  The staff are very accomodating and go out of their way to attend to requests and needs.  We loved the daily breakfasts!!  The location is great.  We loved the nearby restaurants and stores.  Target is across the street.  We definitely plan to make this our hotel for Anaheim.  The rooms are great and clean and very comfortable.  Loved the kitchen areas.  There's a lot of small extra details that this hotel staff think of to make the staff a little extra fun and special.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here before, several years ago?  Nice hotel.  Clean, well maintained.  Pool is large.  Pool area is nice with gas BBQ grills and a fire pit.  Free breakfast is the best one I have ever eaten.  Good variety. Waffles, eggs, potatoes, sausage, toast, bagels, etc.  Nice large area with lots of seats inside and out.  The rates are pricey.  I stayed in a 2 queen bed suite.  It was 169.00 each night.  Plus 8.00 to park the car in a lot with no security!   Nice that they accept pets.  I think 100.00 extra is a lot to pay.  I would probably stay here on my next visit.  It will all depend on the room rates.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We usually stay at the Marriott Suites across the street from this hotel, but decided to try the Residence Inn as we were meeting family with 3 kids and thought the 2 bedrooms and 2 baths would be more comfortable.  Although the furnishings are simple, we found the hotel to be clean, spacious and comfortable.  There are doors that close off both bedrooms and the kitchenette area was great and stocked with dishes, glasses, utensils.  The pool area is very nice with a large pool, kiddie pool and hot tub along with towels outside.  I didn't even know there was free breakfast (eggs, pancakes,  waffles, muffins, bagels, fruit, potatoes, juice) every morning and free snacks (mac and cheese, nachos, etc) around 5 pm.  This hotel is in short walking distance to a Target, Walgreens,
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Residence Inn at Garden Grove was a perfect choice for our 5-person family vacation. A roomy bedroom with adjoining bath for mom and dad, a fold-out couch for grandma, and and a separate bedroom with bunk beds and an adjoinging bath. The kitchen area was very handy when we wanted to make a snack for ourselves in our room. The room was always sparkling clean when we returned from Disneyland or a day excursion. The Continental Breakfast was very good, with a different "chef's choice" each morning. The breakfast has a lot of variety and everything tasted great. The staff was more than helpful and friendly, and always ready with a smile or directions to where ever we wanted to go.  I give a thumbs up to Residence Inn!! We'll stay here again the next time we visit Anaheim.

Summary: Not only is this hotel clean and well maintained, the staff are all very friendly.  The breakfast is one of the best I've had at a hotel as far as choices and quality are concerned.  The hotel is very family friendly with a room for cartoons and movies just for kids.  The pool area has a wading pool for small children and the hot tub isn't too hot so the kids can go in too.    During the week they have a managers reception and when we were there there was a full on barbeque with hamburgers, hotdogs, corn on the cob, pasta salad, chips and lemonade.    The shuttle to Disneyland stops right out front and couldn't be more convenient.    The rooms are very family friendly, with bunk beds and a bathroom in one bedroom and then a typical bathroom and bed in the second bedroom.  The
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our 3rd visit to this property and we were very satisfied with our visit.  The property is clean and well maintained.  We stayed in the two bedroom suite.  The value can't be beat.  Breakfast is good and satisfying.  The associates (employee's) we came into contact were friendly and accommodating to our needs in particular Joe and a young lady who checked us in (sorry forgot name).  She was there in the evenings throughout our stay.  I asked her if she ever gets a day off and she replied that it was a funny question since she was responsible for the scheduling.  =)  Location is great - next to Target and restaurants, couple blocks from Disneyland.  If our travels bring us back to Anaheim, we will definitely return!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The personal staff is very friendly and they are always aware of the guests needs. The breakfast is good but there should be more variety.  Bad thing: there is no wireless in the room you have to stay in the lobby to have a wireless connection which is very noisy.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: You can do much better for less $
Summary: I have been to Anaheim 7 times in the past 4 years. I stayed at the Hyatt Orange County, Marriott Suites on S. Harbor and serveral other hotels.  Please take my advice and scratch this hotel from the list of hotels to consider alltogether. I booked it because it had a relatively high standing on Trip Advisor. I don't know how it earns that ranking. I would never even consider booking this hotel again. The Hyatt Orange County and the Marriott Suites are both within a half - block radius from this hotel. Both the Hyatt and the Marriott Suites are clean, modern, comfortable and up to date. Because the Marriott Residence Inn has a kitchen, we thought that it would be worth the extra $20/night. It was not. The property is run down and in major need of an update. The matressess are
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Family friendly, fantastic service incredible value
Summary: We recently had a family vacation to Disneyland, my wife and I, our 2 daughters and our 2 grandsons.We had a suite 2 bedrooms,2 bathrooms, full kitchen and a BBQ area in the main courtyard. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful, we  enjoyed our stay immensely and would highly recommend for families on a budget as we were able to shop for groceries. The hotel does provide a hot breakfast buffet and a dinner( baked potato night to which we   added steak, and a sloppy joe night. We would certainly return. The Carlton Family Calgary Ab

Summary: We stayed at the Residence Inn by Marriott Anaheim resort area from Sept 5-10th for a family holiday to Disneyland.  Our whole family agreed that this must be the best hotel we have ever stayed at! The staff were friendly and professional, the breakfast buffet was wonderful.  We were pleasantly suprised by the quality and quantity of food in the evenings.  The hotel advertised it as a snack but for our family, it was a full dinner.  This saved us alot of money while we were there!  Rooms are spacious and very nice.  Pool area is great and you can eat your dinner out on the patio in the evenings.  We have 5 children and there was plenty of room for all of us!
Manager Response: Thank you for being our guest and taking a moment to share your experiences with us. We hope to see you again on your next trip to Southern California.

Summary: Our family planned a vacation to Disneyland and was unsure of which hotel to stay at; we decided to stay at the Residence Inn, and what a great choice it was. The Hotel is near the park, restaurants, and a number of other shops. The room was very spacious with two separate bedrooms (the little one fell in love with the bunk beds in his room & not to mention his own bathroom- got to admit I was glad he had his own bedroom too), full kitchen, and a nice living room. Each staff member we encountered was very friendly and helpful, the suite was real nice and roomy, good breakfast, and the pool area was just the icing on the cake. Long story short- Love this place!

Summary Heading: Very Nice Hotel, great for families
Summary: I have stayed at the Residence Inn Garden Grove many times.  This stay made me realize why I love this hotel.  It is clean, the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, the pool area nice.  The food is okay and it is a nice perk for a family trying to keep to a budget while visiting Disney.  If you come mid week, you get a 'hospitality couple of hours', which basically is a dinner.  So, if you are trying to save a few dollars with a family, breakfast and some dinners...it is a good deal.     I am sorry they have added a charge for parking.  It seems like these Garden Grove hotels are all jumping on the bandwagon and seem to be taking advantage of their customers.  I was told it was added because they now have security...I was thinking that if the hotel had 100 customers and
Manager Response: none

Summary: My daughter and I escorted my parents on their business trip. We had a great time. The room was clean and centrally located to shops, restaurants and Downtown Disney was a few miles away. This place has a nice basketball court and a kid-friendly swimming pool. It was not hard keeping my 8 yr old entertain on property while my parents were busy. It offers a free breakfast buffet every morning and a light confession every evening during the weeknights. In addition to everything, the rate was affordable.   Lots of kids on property while we were here and they all appears to enjoy their stay. VERY, very kids friendly compare to other Residence Inn. Summary: We initially had several serious issues with our rooms at the Residence Inn Orange Grove that led us to change our room 4 times in the first night.  I was at the point that I had even sugggested to my husband that we go to a different hotel but I'm glad that we didn't.  All hotels issues (some serious like ours) but after the management resolved our problems we had one of the best stays ever.  The hotel is centrally located.  The staff is OUTSTANDING, front desk clerks, managers, everyone.  Every single person at this hotel goes out of their way to help the guests.  We all had a wonderful time especially the children.  The breakfast is good with plenty of selection.  Anyone that complains they repeated the same thing at breakfast everyday just finds things to complain about.

Summary Heading: A great hotel our Disney trip
Summary: We stayed 5 nights here and went to Disney 4 straight days.  We have 2 young children (1.5 and 5 years old) so we returned to the hotel late afternoons ro recharge.  We cooked dinner in our rooms before heading back to the parks in the evening. Service:  Front desk staff were friendly.  We asked for extra towels and sheets which were brought up quickly and they stayed to confirm we had the what we needed. Common areas:  This was a really nice Residence Inn.  The lobby was spacious with high ceilings, breakfast area was huge and they had a separate kids area with small tables and chairs and a movie screen showing cartoons.  Pool area was nice also nice.  Laundry room was bright, clean with lots of machines. The whole place felt well kept and new. Breakfast:  One of the best out

Summary: Love this hotel, the employe's are kind and go out of there way to help. The breakfast is always good.
Manager Response: Thank you for being our guest and taking a moment to share your experiences with us. We hope to see you again on a future trip to the Anaheim area.

Summary: Close to Disneyland, family size rooms, great breakfast, weekdays supper, large outdoor pool for the kids.

Summary Heading: Very happy we did not switch hotels
