We read the reviews about this hotel and we were nervous about staying here. We are glad we stayed with Residence Inn. 5 years ago we stayed at Homewood Suites. Residence Inn beats them 10:1. Good breakfast with plenty of seating room. If it gets crowded inside, just walk out the patio doors and eat outside on the patio deck. Great staff, friendly, courteous and helpful. The two bedroom/ two bath suites are the only way to go.

Summary: The rooms were just wonderful. A family friendly hotel, the garden grove residence inn has a fantastic location. The rooms were clean and spacious. We highly recommend this hotel to others looking to stay near disney in the Anaheim area. Another thing we really liked about the hotel was that it was near both a variety of places to eat, and a target. Summary Heading: Pricey But Nice Place to Stay
Summary: I booked three adults into a suite at the Residence Inn. It was nice having two bedrooms and two bathrooms and three TVs. Plus there was a full kitchen, fridge, and Sink.  I wish there was a place to hang stuff up near the second bedroom, and it would have been easier if the provided a suitcase stand--which we lived out of and placed our suitcases on the floor at the foot of our beds.  The breakfast was OK--Nothing fancy but there was everything you needed.  It was a nice 3 star venue. kinds pricey, but OK. near Disneyland.

Summary Heading: It worked for the purpoe of visiting Disneyland...
Summary: Hotel- Needs Updating and a thorough cleaning. The maids did the day to day cleaning ok, but there was a thick ring of dust around the edges of all the carpet, the shower walls had grime on them.  Location- You definitely have to drive or take the shuttle to Disneyland.   Parking- Tiny spaces and not enough of them, we had to park at the Hyatt one night at midnight after Disneyland and then walk our 5 sleepy kids through a dark parking lot.   Service- One good, One awful and one so so experience.  Breakfast- Better than pastries and donuts, but not enjoyable  IMO  Room- Plenty of space, comfortable beds, but OLD Tv's- we got a PPV for $16.99 and then regreted watching it on such an old TV.

The hot breakfast was fantastic for the kids ~ waffles, eggs, sausage, cereal, pancakes, bagels, etc.  The menu changed daily but the basic waffles were always there. Summary Heading: Fantastic hotel, we wouldn't stay anywhere else in Anaheim
Summary: We did all the usual research and settled on this hotel and we are so glad we did.  We have 4 children aged 4 to 9.  We stayed in a two bedroom suite that was perfect for us.  It had two bathrooms and a fully contained kitchen, sitting area and dining area.  The staff were fantastic - nothing was ever too much trouble.   The kids loved the basket ball court (balls provided).  The location is brilliant in terms of convenience shopping. Target is a short walk across the street and there are plenty of places to eat in the immediate area (Red Robbin was our favourite).   The bus for Disneyland picks you up at the front of the hotel and is very cheap.  The other bonus was the breakfast and evening snacks (although it was crowded at breakfast if you got there later in the morning).

Summary: Every member of this hotel's staff were terrific. They all put customer service first. The front desk ladies were amazing. We drove to Disney and parked b/c we didn't want to hassle w/a shuttle.  It's quick by car, although you then take a shuttle from the parking lot.  But, it didn't take long.  My only real complaint is that trash trucks show up b/t 5:30 and 6:15 am most mornings.  You can hear them dumping trash and beeping as they go backwards.  We were on the top floor (the 8th) and could still hear them.  The hotel was very quiet other than that.  The breakfast was not great, but fine.

Summary Heading: Some good reasons to stay here and a few reasons why we won't again.

There is free parking which is nice, so many of the hotels  have a steep parking fee now. .They also have a breakfast buffet which is better than a continental breakfast but not much better and having a suite with the kitchen is helpful. The down side for us was the noise of the heating/air ducts. There was a loud humming noise that was always present. I found it very difficult to sleep. I would recommend  the Homewood suites right down the street instead. Their breakfast is better, it's much quieter and just an  all around  higher quality hotel.

Summary Heading: Nice place for a group of six
Summary: Stayed here as a group of 2 adults and 4 teens.  The 2 bedroom suite format with 2 queens in the second bedroom is uncommon and a very pleasant way to stay for a group of this size,  The rooms were good.  Plenty of space versus similar hotels in this class, a nice kitchen, very clean.  The beds were very comfortable.  I never like hotels pillows, and the pillows here were no different.    Breakfast was above average for a hotel in this class,  Beware that the seating area for breakfast gets VERY crowded on days when the hotel is full of Disneyland visitors.  We had to eat up in our room two of the four days we visited.    The manager's reception is not good at all.  A very weak salad offering and a cheap snack to go with it.  A bowl of Campbell's soup one night, a fist full of
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Watch your valuables, great for families
Summary: This motel is pretty comfortable and nice, but  I marked them down because my wallet was taken out of my room.  There are NO SAFES in the rooms.  Noise:  The rooms are laid out pretty well for sleeping.  Our side of the building had a LOT of street noise.  I would ask for a parking lot /pool view if you want to skip major noise.    Check in: The front desk seems a bit understaffed so allow more time for check in or other issues.  There are NO safes in the rooms and larger valuables have to be checked in to a "secure" room available to only "associates"  This means that if the item is stolen from that room then the motel is liable for it up to a certain amount.  See the back of your motel room door for more into.  The beds are comfortable and the showers are nice - I'm picky
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Needs Improvement but meets minimal expectations.
Summary: We have stayed at other Residence Inn and Marriot properties and loved them.   This one is a disappointment though.  I think the Staybridge in the Anaheim Area, Homewood and Hampton Suites all outperform this RI.   We have stayed all over the Disneyland Resort Area and in general the motels and hotels are all pretty hard worn by the constant use by families. We liked was the size of the room, we had a one and a half bedroom, two bath with living room and full size kitchen for $152 a night.  I say half bedroom because it was a small room with two twin beds and no window or closet.   The kitchen was well eguipped and even had a full size oven. We had a lot of problems with our room (707)and called maitenance several times.   The thermostat, ice maker, garbage disposal and tv
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here from Oct.7-12 and it was our first time at this hotel, but not to the area.... We have stayed at 2 other "suite" style hotels in the area on previous Disneyland trips - Homewood Suites and Staybridge Suites. They were nice but our family has grown and this hotel offers 2 bedroom suites, so even with 3 or 4 kids, no one has to sleep on the pull-out couch! Our suite was clean and the furniture and carpets were in good shape...no sign of stains, holes or wear and tear ,as I was afraid of from past reviews! The beds were comfortable, but the pillows were a nightmare!! Extremely lumpy and "chunky"?! Never have I had pillows like this at a hotel.( I asked hsk. for newer, firm ones, but the replacements weren't much better.) The duvets and covers were a bit flat and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I like the concept of extended stay type suites but...
Summary: I really don't like some things about this hotel. When I walked in I thought it was pretty nice. I booked the place for work and I stayed two weeks.  They could not locate a cart for my luggage. They seem to only have like 5. I only got one because my job sent me many packages and my packages were on a luggage cart. I took the packages to my car and loaded my luggage on. I then was greeted by a woman and her two kids. They followed me to my room in order to get my luggage cart after I was done. Not a big deal but I felt they should have more or know where the ones they have are going. I requested a room on a high floor and they only had the first and second so I took the second floor. The elevator is incredibly slow. Twice so far one of them has broken down. Why couldn't I take
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Residence Inn, Garden Grove is in the middle of a cluster of suite type hotels a couple of miles away from Disney. It is also near some good shops and several excellent restaurants.  The four of us stayed in a two bedroom suite (1 king, 2 twin) and had plenty of room. The breakfast buffet was very good with something for everybody - everything from granola to waffles. The serving containers were always full and the food was always hot and fresh. The hotel was very clean. It was busy, especially pre and post Disney, so there was the occaisional elavator wait. The pool was bigger than I thought it would be, and also warmer. The A.R.T. stops outside of the hotel, but now that it's $4 per person and a cab ride is only $6...it made more sense and was easier to take a cab.  All of
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family stayed here and enjoyed it overall.  There were 5 of us and we stayed in a suite with 2 Queen beds, bunk beds and sofa sleeper.  Our room had a small kitchen, with everything, but we never used it.    Did make the room feel spacious though.  The hotel offers a great continental breakfast with a lot of options!  It's across the street from great restaurants (like Joe's Crabshack where we had dinner once) and a shopping center with Target.  Shuttle was easy to catch to and from the parks.  Our only complaint would be that the sofa sleeper did not fit in the living room as the end of the bed rested on the TV stand, so it would not lay flat.   All the tables are fixed, so we could not move the table back to allow the sofa sleeper to lay flat.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Room was okay and the beds were comfortable.  Given the size of the property the pool was far too small and always full.  Breakfast is included in the room rate and the selection is outstanding  There are a few decent places to eat within walking distance (Outback is close).  If your trip is centered around visiting Disney then this property would be  a good choice - if you plan on visiting the beach often then be prepared to fight the traffic.
Manager Response: none

Summary: WHAT I DIDN'T LIKE ABOUT THIS HOTEL: The rooms and furniture are looking a little tired. Stains on the couches, the bedding and the pillows must be 6 years old and was not fresh.  Duvet was flat, not nice and puffy, and pillows were very very flat, which leads me to beleive they have been used for the past 6 years and never changed.  Bedding is important to me and should be fresh feeling and luxurious.  Rooms were not entirely clean, although they look clean on first glance.  Mold in the bathroom showers.  Bathroom wallpaper has water stains all over it.  The furniture and bedding does need to be replaced to keep up to the Marriott brand.    WHAT I LIKED ABOUT THIS HOTEL: Breakfast was adequate and lots of options, although it was the same every day.  The shuttle to Disneyland

Summary: I always stay at the marriott residence inn hotels and this was the worst ive ever been to, the rooms were dirty, the elevators were dirty and the swimming pool was horrible. If u complain about anything they simply just ignore you. I will never stay here again
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at Residence Inn from the 4th August - 11th August. We were in room 714, there were 5 of us in our group, 2 Adults and 3 teenagers.  Our room had 2 Queen beds and a pull out couch bed, also a kitchenette,  the hotel room was very clean, the Disney Parks  were about a 25 minute walk from the hotel, there is a bus stop just outside of the hotel ( costs $3 an adult, $1 a child for a day ticket). The hotel breakfast is great, lots to choose from, cereals, toast, waffles, eggs, sausage, etc. It does get busy at breakfast, we would go between 7.30 - 8am and it was fine. The hotel pool is great to cool off in a at the end of a day its open 8 - 10pm. Not a huge pool, but clean, also has a hot tub and small kids pool.  The staff were very helpful when we asked about shopping

Summary: When checking in we thought this place would be ok, but nothing special.  For the price we were pleased, until we got to the room.  As we walked into the room and started looking around we noticed the couch was torn in several places and just didn't look clean.  As we walked around the place just didn't seem like it was extremely clean.  I felt like I didn't want to put anything down.  Then we went into the bathroom to check it out.  The toilet was running so we called and they were going to send maintenance up.....waited and no one ever came.  As we looked into the shower we noticed black mold all around the shower.  At this point we left to go get our luggage.  As we talked to the car and started discussing we decided to call our travel agent as we had a bad feeling about this

Summary: My Family and I (wife and 3 kids) stayed at the Residence Inn By Marriot  on Harbour Boulevard in Anaheim during our recent trip to the US and what a place for families it was ,the hotel is just minutes from Disney, shops restaurants and anything you need is just over the road ,but my review also has to include the front desk manager Kathy Leveque i think her name was,nothing was to much trouble for this wonderful staff member whether it was transportation,information or help sending souveniers home to Australia she would always go out of her way to help .   Rooms were clean and spacious in our family suite,serviced daily ,very roomy and most of all very clean ,the hotel had breakfast every morning and it filled my kids up for most of the day.   We are coming back to the USA

Summary: Thank goodness we only stayed here one night and we used our free night certificate.   We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite that would normally cost $280 and the place was filthy!  There was trash left over from the prior hotel guests.  The bed sheets were not changed.  We contacted the housekeeping manager to take care of the problem. In addition, the whole place felt sticky and there were stains all over the couches.   We are Marriott Rewards members and have stayed at many Residence inns but none were as dirty as this one.  We understand alot of families stay here with kids but they really should take more time and effort in cleaning this place.

Summary: I had read all the great reviews of this hotel. I could not believe this was the same hotel. The hotel was dirty, air conditioning broken, room filthy with crumbs on counters and old food is dishwasher which wasn't even unloaded. The pool area was disgusting, and the hot tub was ice cold. We had a two bedroom, which turned out to be one bedroom and an alcove-like room without windows. The mattress on the sofa bed was stained. Too expensive for this quality. I have written to Marriott to complain but have received no reply as of yet.  No more Marriotts.

Summary Heading: Don't know if I would stay here again

The overall experience at the hotel was mediocre, although I would not tell someone to avoid the hotel, just be aware what you are getting at this hotel.  First, although the staff was pleasant enough, the staff was not willing to do anything beyond the minimum necessary.  First, when we checked in the hotel at first refused to honor the rate we booked online.  I had to talk to various managers at the hotel, and waste about half an hour talking to them before they finally honored the rate. Summary Heading: Best Place To Stay For Families
Summary: We are frequent visitors to the Disneyland area due to our children's grandparents living in the area. We have stayed at other hotels along the Harbor strip including the Embassy Suites. I have to say the the Residence Inn really impressed us. We reserved a 2 bedroom kitchen suite with 2 full baths and the children's bedroom with bunk beds. We loved it! Plenty of room with 3 TV's to satisfy  everybody's choice of channels. The buffet breakfast was very good and not too crowded. On Thursday they had free barbecue burgers and hot dogs for dinner. The hotel is in excellent condition and the service was outstanding. We will be going back to this this hotel for Christmas planning a week stay to visit Disneyland and the children's grandparents.

Summary: I booked this hotel based on the previous reviews and I was not disappointed.  We booked this hotel for seven nights through Getaway Today.  We stayed from June 14-21st.  We had 4 adults and one child.  We reserved a two bedroom suite.  The master had a king bed and bath and the other room had two twins and a bath, however this room was tiny but it worked out for us.  We ate breakfast at the hotel almost everyday and it was wonderful just like everybody has said.  Monday through Thursday they do a lite dinner, we were able to enjoy this two of the four nights of our stay.  One night was a baked potato bar and the other was the summer BBQ which was hamburgers, hot dogs and chips.  It was nice to take advantage of this and save a little money. Summary: We splurged and got the 2 room suite so that we could put the kids to sleep but adults could stay up. 3 tvs, one in each bedroom, one inn the common area, a extensive breakfast, including plenty of fresh fruit and waffles. This is in addition to the full kitchens in the suites setups.  I have learned that in resort areas like Disneyland and Monteray you have to go for the brand name hotels, even if it is $50- $60 more. There many advantages - like the huge pay laundry room, the ART shuttle that stops outside and door and more.  Staff were pleasant and accomodating. The rooms are reasonably furnished - you are not getting a Hyatt or Westin but furnishings and bedding are above average in hotel quality. Summary: This is a very nice hotel, especially if you are staying in the area with  children or for an extened period of time.   The internet access is excellent (good if you need to work from the hotel), the workout equipment is fairly good and usually free. The breakfast is really great, though I reccomend you get there before the 8am children and family rush and madhouse. You can eat as early as 6:30 am  Ask for a room on the ground floor as the elevator gets very busy and very slow for the 8-9AM breakfast rush and dash off to the theme parks.  The only minor criticism I might offer is that there are not enough luggage carts and a number of the carts are falling apart and in need of replacement or repair.

Summary: We loved our stay.  We stayed  May of 2007 and stayed again this year.  It was perfect to have a 2 bedroom suite and my son was very excited to have his own room.  The breakfast was very good - my only complaint is I wish it included bacon.  The staff was very friendly.  The only bad thing that occured was on the day we checked out they had shut down one of the elevators, and it took us awhile to find a cart for our luggage (my husband hauled most of it down without it and finally found one).  They only had 4 luggage carts for the whole hotel.  My suggestion would be that they get bell service.  Other than that we were very pleased.  We paid a very good price for what we received. Summary: Our family stayed in the two-room, two-bath suite (two queen beds and kids bunk bed) for 7 nights.  It was ample room for our family, and we were able to see the Disney fireworks from our hotel window.  For the most part, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel.  The seating area for breakfast was larger than I had expected, but it did get pretty full if you arrived the last hour of breakfast.  So, better to go early.  While there was a good variety and it was a hot breakfast, it seemed the main breakfast items stayed the same.  However, it was a much better breakfast than what is offered by most other hotels. Summary Heading: Great for kids and Disneyland...otherwise, stay elsewhere
Summary: If you are visiting Disney with kids, this is an excellent choice. Big rooms with separate bedrooms (each with their own TV), kitchens, etc. And of course the location is very close to Disneyland. The rooms are acceptable though definitely not upscale. Cleanliness was adequate though it appeared that the carpet and furniture takes a bit of a beating with so many kids.  If you are not traveling with kids, I recommend staying elsewhere. There are kids everywhere; the breakfast buffet is overun with pushy Disney tourists and their kids; ditto for the pool area. This is a family-oriented hotel so if you're traveling on business in the Anaheim or Garden Grove area, there are more suitable options. Summary: Now, I must say ... this place is on our top five list of favorite spots!  Maybe it's the location :-)  We stayed here for our trip to Disneyland in Oct '06 for six nights.  Yes, it has taken me this long to write the review.   We decided to spoil ourselves and our kids with a two bedroom kid's suite.  The monkeys had a bedroom with bunk beds and their own bathroom & TV!  I thought they were going to pass out form the excitement when they saw this room!  The gales of giggles were well worth the extra $$ for this room.  Not to mention the privacy factor!   We still had a family room with a sleeper sofa (Grandma slept there!), a kitchenette and the large master with private bathroom. Summary Heading: Great Service at the Residence Inn
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Residence Inn with our 4 kids for a Disney Land Trip.  The hotel staff at the front desk was very friendly.  We arrived early and she up graded our suite for free so we could get into our room.  The family suite is spacious and each section could be closed off, with a TV in each room.   A total life saver when your 3 year old is worn out and wants just cartoons! Then our air conditioner leaked, not badly but maintenance was right on it and checked on us several times, the hotel offered to switch our rooms while we were at Disney, we decided to keep our room since it had been managed and honestly we just didn't want to gather up all our stuff again.  In the end they gave us a free movie.   The location is a couple of miles from Disney but the bus

Summary: We stayed for 9 nights and this hotel is great for families.  We had a 2 bedroom kids suite which had a separate bedroom with bunk beds and a bathroom off the kids' room, plus another bedroom with a king-size bed and full bathroom.  The middle was a living room and kitchen with a table that seats 4 and a separate desk area.    The hotel itself was extremely quiet - probably the quietest hotel we've ever stayed in. The beds were comfortable and it was easy to get a good night's sleep, especially after walking all day at Disneyland.  The hotel has a full breakfast each morning that includes hot items as well as make your own waffles, cold cereals, fruit, bagels, toast, pastries, etc.  Very good value. Summary: We are a large family with 5 children. We have stayed in Residence Inns all over the US and the Annaheim R.I. is one of the better hotels.  It is a lovely hotel.  The entrance is something that you would find in a more expensive hotel, with nice cream colored flooring and modern furniture in the lobby.  The people who checked us in were kind, quick and efficient.  WIth the exception of a lack of a luggage cart, our check in was relatively stress free. Summary Heading: Good value, Clean Rooms, Poor Pool
Summary: Stayed for 14nights, room was clean and ideal for 2 adults and 2 kids. Complimentary breakfast was included. Staff friendly. Free car parking. Great place if you are visiting Disneyland as it is in walking distance. The swimming pool is small, was not particularly clean and cold. This was the only downside but as we were only using the hotel as a base it did not spoil our holiday. If you want to spend a lot of time by the pool then I would look at alternatives.

Summary Heading: Perfect for Familes with more than 2 kids
Summary: We had stayed here once before and loved it and it's just perfect for families with more than 2 kids.  The rooms are clean, big and perfectly sized for a family needing some relaxing time.  The beds are super comfortable and that helps after a long day at the park.    Breakfast in the morning is pretty much the same every day but it's good so it's no matter.  Kids love the fact they can make their own waffles.    Internet access is free in the rooms if you have a laptop, which we did.    Maids did a great job of cleaning every day, including dishes and making and putting back the haida bed each morning.  (I have a son that thought it was fun to sleep on)  ART bus picks you up outside on Harbour each day and it's approximately every 20 -30 minutes.  Easy to catch and get back.

Summary: This is a great hotel.  The rooms are large with full kitchens, 2 bathrooms and two bedrooms.  The rooms were very clean and the maids even did your dishes when they came into clean.  The buffet breakfast was great - same thing everyday but it was still really good.  The evening snacks during the week weren't that great but that didn't affect our stay.  Overall it was great and would we would stay  there again.

Summary: We have just returned from a week at the Residence Inn in Garden Grove, CA.  We chose this hotel due to other reviews and were not disappointed.  We stayed on the 8th floor, room 829 and would highly recommend it as it was at the end of the hall, overlooking the pool and was very quiet.  The room was a two bedroom, two bath which worked out well for the three of us.  As with other Residence Inn's, there was a full kitchen and living room with a sofa bed, chair and TV.  They had a huge breakfast buffet downstairs and the refrigerator was wonderful for our extra fruit and juice.  The maid service was great.  They did a thorough cleaning every day. The room also had a decent sized bathroom attached to it.  The master bedroom had a king-sized bed and its own bathroom.  The living room included a sofabed which we did not use as a bed. Summary: We just got back after staying at this hotel for 5 nights last week.  It worked really well for us!  We have a family of 6--2A, 12, 10, 5, and 5.  It is difficult to find a hotel that fits us all comfortably because our twins can't sleep together yet without kicking each other or one of them falling out of bed.  So, we need room on the floor for an air mattress, even if there's a pull out couch.  This room was perfect!  We stayed in the kids suite.  The adults loved having a king bed in our own room with a bath.  There was another bedroom with bunks and it's own bath.  An ample sized kitchen and living room. Summary Heading: Perfect Family Hotel for a SoCal Vacation!!

Summary Heading: This was a very disappointing hotel and stay

Summary: We stayed here and had a suite. The room was exceptionally clean, lovely bed linen, choice of pillows. Large fully equiped kitchen, 3 TV's. The breakfast was outstanding, hot buffet, waffles, cereal, pastries, fruit etc.  Lovely pool area with warm jacquzi. Key controlled. Very warm and freindly staff All of them, from the kitchen manager and his staff, the reception team.  Plenty of free parking. Near to disney about 10 mins drive or catch a bus outside the hotel for $3. Would advise anyone to stay, would return ourselves if we visit the USA again.

Summary: The purpose of our trip was to visit Disneyland in celebration of our daughter's birthday. We were traveling with adults and teens. Summary: Our family (Mom, Dad, and three kids ages 5-7) stayed at the Residence Inn for our winter vacation this year (last week of February). Last year we stayed at the Embassy Suites for our vacation and my husband and I stayed at the Hyatt a few months later when he had a conference.   For a family our size, the Residence Inn is the best choice. We originally had reservations at Homewood Suites, but changed for the larger suite option here. It was only $10 more a night! The rates at Embassy were much more than what we paid last year, so the Residence Inn worked out both in price and size.  The suite is standard for a Residence Inn. The room was very clean, quiet, and overlooked the pool area.  The kid’s room had bunk beds and their own full bathroom (tub, shower, toilet, and sink). Summary: This was our first trip to Disneyland. We loved the Residence Inn. When we first arrived, we realized that our room was too small for our family. The front desk helped us relocate to a very spacious 2 bedroom room that had  bunkbeds for the kids, with their own bathroom, and then our own bedroom and bathroom. the breakfast is huge, everything is clean and nice. We had just stayed at a Ritz Carlton a few months prior on the other side of the nation, so the Residence Inn was up against some tough competition. Of course, the Ritz is spectacular, but you have to pay for it. This hotel, for the price and amenities, is a great deal and perfect for families that want to enjoy Disneyland. Summary: This was our third time staying at this property and I'm impressed that they've maintained their high standards of service.    Any staff I've encountered has been friendly and professional without fail, and they go out of their way to resolve any issues fairly and quickly.   So-called "full service" hotels could definitely learn from their example.  We stayed in a family suite which, with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, provided ample space for our family.  True, it is not the newest property and shows a little wear, but it is quite well maintained for such a high-traffic property.  Catering to families and groups as it does, there are admittedly some caveats (elevator service can be slow, and the lobby can be noisy, especially during peak times such as breakfast) but these are
Manager Response: none

Summary: I will admit that the hotel is in a good proximity to the parks and it being a Marriott is always a good thing. The hotel lobby was nice, the staff wasn't all that knowledgeable or helpful (maybe because it was late? 3rd stringers on shift?). Our room was a 2 bedroom suite with furniture so beat up and stained that we had to put towels down on the furniture before sitting. The couch was bowed and really dirty...thank GOD we didn't have to open it up. The worst part was the food containers from the previous guests left behind the furniture which we discovered while changing the tempature in the room and notice the floor was SOAKING WET. When we called down to explain we basicly had a swamp happening in our room they said they would be up... but never were. The next day returing
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Only place to stay for Disney!
Summary: Our family has stayed in this hotel the last two years for our Disneyland trips.  The rooms are spacious.  The children love the bunkbeds.  We, the parents, love our own room and bathroom.  The breakfast buffet is more than enough to get us off to a good start.  The children love watching the Disney channel while they eat breakfast.  The shuttle picks up right outside the hotel.  The hot tub is cool enough for little ones.  The staff responded quickly when we had one problem with a toilet and made it possible for another family to stay in a room close to ours.  They were always helpful and courteous.  We appreciate not having to pay for parking in addition to the room.  We're planning to stay at the Residence Inn again this year.  Looking forward to it!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The best hotel in the area!
Summary: I loved our stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort Area.  We arrived at the hotel around 12:30pm and our room was ready.  We had a 2 bedroom with a king and bunkbeds.  Some reviews said that the bunk beds were small, but we found them to be average size.  The full kitchen and 2 bathrooms were wonderful!  Target is right across the street so we were able to pick up some snacks and water there.  The hotel offers a very nice buffet breakfast.  A ton of variety and everything was wonderful.  We would hit the buffet early and then grab a snack right before we left for Disneyland.  They also have a light dinner M-Th.  We took advantage of that 3 of the 4 nights that we were there.  Very filling andmore than I had invisioned.  The kids enjoyed the pool one afternoon.  Even in
Manager Response: none

Summary: We've been to this hotel many times. Twice this year.   It's excellent value for the price if you have a family. We like to stay in the two-bedroom suites. Either the two-queen or the kids suite. Both are roomy.  Breakfast is great as usual. And for some reason the hotel gives you a sense of warm and casual friendliness.   For the negatives, the hotel does show its heavy usage. Bathrooms are not as new as we first came when it just opened. The parking is very difficult sometimes. The queen-queen two bedroom suites are a bit noisy because it's close to the road.  In the picture the 29/30 rooms are closest to the road and hence most noisy. So you better off get the rooms on the other wing.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here the week after Thanksgiving.  We usually stay at the Marriott Suites, but decided to give this a try.  We were very pleased with our decision!      The rooms are very comfortable, clean, and "homey".  It was wonderful to have a full kitchen to use the fridge for  treats etc.     The cleaning staff did a great job!   Our personal belongings were treated with repsect, and our room was always clean on our return.  The breakfast each morning is well worth trying!  We ate there every morning of our 7 day stay.  The kitchen staff was courteous and kept everything stocked and clean. My son loved the biscuits and gravy!  It is close to Disneyland and several nice restaurants are within walking distance!  Make sure to try Bubba Gumps!!  We will DEFINITELY be staying here
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at this property in October based on previous reviews and under a preferred Marriott Rewards member rate. The hotel is conveniently located in the Anaheim Resort Corridor, and only a few minutes from Disneyland. The seventh floor one-bedroom unit we stayed in was generally clean, however the under sink trash had not been emptied upon our arrival. A quick call to the Front Desk brought prompt correction. Road noise was not too much of an issue, though I would have preferred the pool side of the hotel had it been available. In typical Residence Inn fashion, the room was furnished well and comfortable. The breakfast was well done, and worth getting up early to avoid the throngs of other families. Parking was not a problem as we tried to return early enough in the evening

Summary Heading: You can make yourself at home
Summary: We stayed at the Residence Inn Garden Grove from October 15th to October 27th and really enjoyed our stay. At first arrival I was a little underwhelmed as the hotel or room does not "wow you".  However, what this hotel lacks in the"wow factor", it makes up in comfort, function and location. We stayed in the suite with 1 king bed and bunkbeds. Our bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in and the shower had great water pressure. The kids loved their bunkbeds and  we loved having two bathrooms and three televisions. The kitchen was a full kitchen with all the necessary dishes and pots and pans and the couch was comfortable enough to sit on for a few hours.  We loved having the table for four when we ordered in food and I loved the desk where I could write notes for my trip

Summary: Just got back from a week stay at the Residence Hotel. My family of five adults stayed from Nov. 7th -- Nov. 12th in a one room suite. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Breakfast everyday was a great money saver. They offer eggs, sausage, hashbrowns, waffles, muffins, pastries, bagels, yogurt, cereal, fruit, french toast, and pancakes daily. Go early to breakfast, the later it gets to park opening the more crowded it gets, however they are always refilling the food.They also offer a manager's special Monday thru Thursday, however my family didn't partake. The room was clean and the maid came every day. When we needed more towels they were quick to bring them. Summary: When I first booked this hotel I thought was booking the one closer to the park so I was a little disapointed when I realized I booked the one farther away. When I arrived however, I quickly changed my tune! This hotel was perfect for families!!   The room: We booked a two room kids suite that my both my kids were impressed with when we walked into the room. They had their own T.V., bunkbeds, AND bathroom. Our room had it's own door so we could have some privacy and the kids room had a slider with curtains on it so they too had their privacy. Summary: We had stayed at the Residence Inn Maingate last year which was equally as impressive and closer to Disney however their prices had sky-rocketed.  So when I booked this year's trip I decided to try this Residence Inn.  It was a little further away but it looked like a nice property and we were not disapointed.  Breakfast was available everyday and was delicious.  You could have the bagels and muffins if you wanted (the normal fair at most hotels) but you could also get scrambled eggs, sausage and hashbrowns.  Waffle makers were available for made to order waffles and the hotel rotated pancakes, french toast, and biscuits and gravy on alternating days.  They even had tortillas and salsa for those wanting a breakfast burrito.  The pool and hot tub areas were beautifully maintained

Summary: My family of 4 (children ages 10 and 5) stayed at this property for a 3 night stay for exploring Disneyland.   We chose the kids bunkbed arrangement which works out well.  The separate bedroom and bath for the kids help for those afternoon naps after a long day in Disney.  The hotel is not cheap in high tourist season, but the amenities were great and its convenient having a stocked kitchen.  The hot breakfast is more than adequate, but I recommend getting to breakfast before 8am to avoid the worst of crowds.  The hotel could do a better job of containing the noise from the pool and patio revelers at night.  Even seven floors up, we could hear the crowds below after 10pm at night. Summary: Excellent hotel for Disneyland area. Rooms are very clean, very comfortable, well-supplied. Staff at desk, housekeeping, breakfast room very helpful. Management is very responsive. Summary: Went there from August 13th - 17th and we enjoyed our stay.  We stayed in a one bedroom suite which faced the pool so it was quiet. Each day we came back to the hotel late in the afternoon for a dip in the pool and refreshments since it was very hot in Anaheim.  Then we went back for the evening.  The parking in Disney is good for the whole day.  The breakfast buffet made life hassle free. Summary: My family of 4 has stayed at the Residence Inn Anaheim Resort area during our last 2 visits to Disneyland.  It is a great hotel.  The rooms were always clean and the beds very comfortable.  The breakfast was always crowded but very good.  When items on the buffet ran out, they were replenished quickly.  The evening receptions were good and saved money on dinner.  I don't like the ART shuttle to Disney, it is never on time and the wait is awful.  But, this is not the hotel's fault.  The staff is very polite and helpful. Summary Heading: Very nice, clean and lots of space

This reduces the wait time at the park--in three days we never waited more than 5 minutes to go back to the hotel.  I believe we determined we could take the J bus (the shuttle right in front of the hotel) or the K or L shuttle.  The pool area was nice and they had gas grills for grilling. Summary: Great location for Disneyland and the Anaheim Convention Center.  I booked three rooms for a business meeting. Summary: We stayed at the MRI Garden Grove in late October of 2003, and got a very reasonable rate of $99/night. The hotel is very new, and all the fixtures are in very good shape and everything is clean. We had a one bedroom suite, which is simply ideal for families that need to put the kids to bed earlier. This hotel has queen beds, as opposed to doubles, and the beds were very comfortable. I'm not sure why some upscale hotels supply double beds. However, as with any hotel, never count on the sofa bed being remotely comfortable. Apparently some people have an expectation that a sofa bed is going to be fine, and then complain profusely when they discover otherwise. Summary Heading: Good from the moment I walked into their lobby
Summary: Discontented with the deal and view from our suite at Homewood Suite, I walked into a cheerful and pleasant Marriot Residence Inn (MRI) nearby. The receptionist (Vanessa) was patient and helpful in securing a kid's suite for me. As I was booked for 10 nights at Homewood, I had to check whether I could cancel the rest of my stay. Vanessa was helpful in allowing to go back to try to cancel my hotel before I conifirm my booking with MRI. When I checked in the next day, I met a very pleasant and informative Cathie at the front desk. She became my "holiday consultant" in some ways for the rest of my trip. Summary: No previous info on this hotel. It is out of the main hotel area (way down S.Harbour Blvd), but only a 15 min FREE shuttle ride to the park. No issues there. The hotel is clean, new and well set up. The kids suite has bunk beds in a separate room area, full kitchen and eating area. The two bathrooms were a life saver! Deluxe hot continental breakfast was perfect to start a busy day at the parks - pool was big enough for lots of kids. Fitness room and basketball court let adults unwind too. Helpful, friendly staff all over. Only downfall was garbage truck every morning at 6:10 am --- very minor annoyance. Highly recommend this hotel - will stay there again next trip.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If your looking for good sized accomodation for 2 adults and 3 children in the disney area (1 mile), look no further than the Kids Suites. The rooms are pretty spacious with one king en-suite, one kids bunk room also en-suite and a pull down full double size sofabed in the moderately sized lounge. All rooms have 25 inch cable tv with pay per view movies and VCR,s. This place only opened early 03, so everything is pretty new. The pool is also nicely sized and includes an adjascent spa pool. These are both opened until 2200 every evening. The free courtesy shuttle leaves from the Hyatt 100 yards away every 30 minutes.  There,s also a small well priced store , very small kids arcade game room and communual access to utilise the hotels 1 computer for accessing your mails / internet.

Summary Heading: Residence Inn - Good choice for this large family!
Summary: I spent many hours trying to find a good deal on a quality hotel in the Disneyland area for our Oct 14-19, 2003 vacation.  We chose the Residence Inn in Garden Grove for several reasons:  - It provides a 2 bedroom / 2 bath family suite with kitchen with bedding for up to 8 people--sufficient for our family of 7. - The hotel offers a full breakfast to its guests. - A free shuttle carries you to and from Disneyland at convenient intervals. - The hotel is new. - Hotel parking is free. - Reasonable daily rate.  The family suite is adequate in size, similar to an apartment. It includes a living room with sofa sleeper, two queen beds (not doubles) in one room with a bath; one set of bunk beds in another bedroom with its own bath.
